My [From.GetRootRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has contacted me, asking for private lessons in the arts of one-on-one combat. "The [From.GetTitle] is likely to appreciate any guidance we offer, my [Root.GetLordLady]", the messenger says.
I'll of course personally set up [From.GetHerHis] training regime.
I will loan [From.GetHerHim] some of my best veterans to practice with.
This character is taking time out of [GetHerHis] own schedule to help a fellow member of [Society.GetName].

When we started practicing together, I had a hard time imagining displaying the kind of expert confidence that [mentor_target.GetTitledFirstName] exudes on the battlefield. However, bolstered by [mentor_target.GetHerHis] training, I think I have truly found my calling.

The last time we spoke, [mentor_target.GetTitledFirstName] had only praise to offer me. It's an odd feeling that [mentor_target.GetSheHe] is not here to see me now. Letting out a sigh, I clear my mind, focusing on the feeling of my [Root.GetDuelWeapon] in my hand. It's so natural to me now, as if part of my body.

Be careful where you point that thing! a courtier cried out today, as I was sauntering back from yet another session at the training grounds, idly playing with the sword in my hand. The woman hurriedly corrected herself: "Of course, a master duelist such as yourself would know best, my [Root.GetLordLady]."
I'll always be grateful for your lessons, [mentor_target.GetFirstName].
Oh, a master, am I? Why, yes, I suppose I am!
It took time, but I suppose all that hard work has paid off...!

The stack of books in front of me is intimidating. My scholars tell me these are classics, for anyone interested in an introduction to strategic warfare. But I am [Root.GetTitledFirstName]! Surely, I do not need the basics? Should I not be out on the field, surveying the troops, first-hand?
There is value in the historical records.
I think I am more of a visual learner.
This character has more or less locked themselves in [GetHerHis] library, studying the classical records of ancient warfare.
This character is often out in the field, engaging [GetHerHis] soldiers in conversation about the tactics of warfare.

My commanders have come to request my advice on some exercises they are performing outside the [Root.GetCapitalHolding] walls. "We could really use that strategic mind of yours, [Root.GetMasterMistress]", they say. Startled, I realize that my studying has paid off, and my chest swells with pride. I then collect myself, nodding: "Of course, I'd be happy to help."
Typically, what you'll want to consider in a set-up like this...
Soon, you are talking and gesturing excitedly, receiving "Oohs" and "Aaahs" in an even distribution.\n

The experienced hunters I have spending time with seem quite pleased with my weapons skills, and are wondering what I would like to explore next. Poring over the maps of the area outside of [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName], my advisors suggest I learn more about the theory behind the tracking of various prey.
Oh, are these sketches of animal footprints? Tell me more!
What about the actual capturing...? Let's talk more about that!
This character likes long walks in the forest, and observing [GetHerHis] surroundings.
This character tends to carry rope and metallic bits and pieces, and is often seen fidgeting with some new contraption.

We have been tracking a wild [Root.GetRegionalBigAnimal] for hours, when a growl sounds in the bushes next to us. A thunk, followed by a soft groan, tells me that my arrow has found its target. Relaxing my posture, I realize that the hunt is over. "They should be calling you [Root.GetTitledFirstName] the Hunter!" one of my companions laughs. I smile.
I can't believe I wasn't always like this.
This character possesses great ability as a rider, thundering across the steppes.
This character is used to defending ancient and sacred woodlands.
This character is used to a harsh environment and blistering winters.
This character stands firmly on flat terrain, an inspiring figure for [GetHerHis] troops.
This character is accustomed to fighting in the desert and traveling light.
This character works well with siege weapons and is fast on [GetHerHis] feet, easily traversing both mountain and desert.
This character can move hastily through the hills and plateaus of any mountain range. Especially when leading troops of light infantry.
This character is a source of morale for [GetHerHis] troops, bringing them singing into battle.

[Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] would be proud of you, [fellow_member.GetTitledFirstName] tells me, [GetWarriorLodgeTrainingDesc]
"The dedication you display is admirable, [Root.GetSisterBrother]", [fellow_member.GetTitledFirstName] tells me, [GetWarriorLodgeTrainingDesc]
Thank you, [fellow_member.GetFirstName]. That means a lot.
In your heart, you feel that [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] might frown upon your dedication to these people.\n\n

wiping the sweat from [fellow_member.GetHerHis] brow, reminding me that our sparring match has gone on longer than planned. Cocking [fellow_member.GetHerHis] head, the [fellow_member.GetManWoman] concludes: "you're good at this, my friend."

inspecting my horse. We have been riding for hours, but all I feel is invigorated by the fresh air. "You are good with her", [fellow_member.GetSheHe] says, gesturing at the animal. "At all of this", the [fellow_member.GetManWoman] concludes.

inspecting my maps of [Root.Capital.GetName]. Together, we have been setting up some wilderness exercises. "In fact, my [Root.GetLordLady], I think you're a natural at these things", the [fellow_member.GetManWoman] concludes.

carefully putting the contraption of leather straps back on the table. "I am thinking it could be used for better movement in snow", I explain. [fellow_member.GetFirstName] scratches [fellow_member.GetHerHis] chin, nodding slowly. "You're good at these things", the [fellow_member.GetManWoman] concludes.

groaning and clutching at [fellow_member.GetHerHis] side. The blow I landed to [fellow_member.GetHerHis] ribs would have hurt a lot more, had it been a sharp weapon. "I have to hand it to you, my [Root.GetLordLady] – you're good at this", [fellow_member.GetSheHe] says.

washing [fellow_member.GetHerHis] face. We have been sparring for hours, and the water of the river is a welcome reward. "I hope you know you have a talent for these things", my companion says, nodding at the spear in my hand.

challenging me to keep up with [fellow_member.GetHerHim]. We have been out chasing a [Root.GetRegionalBigAnimal] for hours, but I am starting to wonder whether the animal even exists, and if [fellow_member.GetFirstName] was not simply looking for company. "It's rare, you know", [fellow_member.GetSheHe] says. "Someone with talent, as well as wits."

nodding approvingly at my lightly packed horse. We are returning from an exercise in the mountains, and we are well ahead of schedule. "It is an honor training with you, [Root.GetFirstName]", the [fellow_member.GetManWoman] says, squeezing my shoulder briefly.

softly humming the tune I just finished singing, before clearing [fellow_member.GetHerHis] throat. "It's just something I made up, while we were marching" I say, dismissively. "You should keep it up, friend!", the [fellow_member.GetManWoman] argues. "It's good for morale, for the troops, you know".

Personal Combat Skill is a measure on how well you perform in duels against other characters, where it is compared to the skill of your opponent in order to decide the outcome. A high skill will also help you survive when leading an army into battle.

These are the titles which this character has a claim on. Claims can either be Strong or Weak, where Weak Claims can only be pressed under certain circumstances. You can press Claims through War or Factions.

These are the titles held by this character. Titles come in five tiers: Empire, Kingdom, Duchy, County and Barony. Counties and Baronies are tied to a physical location on the map (Baronies exist within Counties). Empires, Kingdoms and Duchies denote rulership over a larger area of land, but do not represent a physical location on the map.
These are the diplomatic relations this character currently has. Diplomatic relations include a variety of things, such as Truces or ongoing Wars.
These are the traits of this character. Traits are a defining feature of every character, representing their abilities, condition and personality.

These are the modifiers affecting this character. While similar to traits, modifiers are often of a more transient nature with a fixed date of expiry. Modifiers do not affect the personality of a character.
Show a list of characters that this character has killed. If looking at a character other than your own, only known kills will be shown.
By going to the Barber you can change the hair and/or beard style of your character.
Show a list of any Bloodlines this character is perceived to be a part of. Bloodlines are founded by characters of fame or legend and are passed on through their descendants.

Show all Artifacts collected by this character. Artifacts provide powerful bonuses and come in many levels of quality, from family heirlooms to legendary relics. Some Artifacts will have to be equipped to be used.
As this is a Shattered World you can choose to outright conquer any Counties that either border your realm or is no more than one sea zone away. [GetShatteredInfo] [GetShatteredJadeInfo]

This Casus Belli is valid only against any infidel or impious [christian.GetGroupName] who holds land in Central Italy. I shall be glad to legitimize your divine right to rule, as soon as you recognize that the Church is no servant to any King or Emperor, but instead watches over the salvation of the souls of all [christian.GetGroupName]s, regardless of their stature.

[From.GetTitledName]

The [christian.GetGroupName] Pope has decided to call one of his lackeys to arms against me, in an attempt to reclaim some of the Italian lands currently under my control. [From.GetTitledName] has just declared war against me on the Pope's behalf.

Organizing such a monumental ceremony has given me the chance to meet the rulers of the realms neighboring [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Maintaining healthy relationships with my [christian.GetGroupName] peers is fundamental to ensure future peace and prosperity for my realm. [potential_friend.GetTitledFirstName] in particular seems like a [potential_friend.GetManWoman] I could trust...

The night at [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s court took a strange turn when our host decided to call some of the clergymen and scholars at the nobles' table, engaging with them in a long discussion about theology. I did not expect this feast to turn into a lesson about [christian.GetGroupName]ity, but...
Yet, should a [christian.GetGroupName] not eschew excesses?

The Benedictine Order is an old monastic community with 'Ora et Labora', meaning 'pray and labor', as their motto. Often recognized by their black habits, they worship God and find purpose in prayer and quiet contemplation as well as scholarly work.

The Diligent Ones is an old monastic community with 'Ora et Labora', meaning 'pray and labor', as their motto. Often recognized by their black habits, they worship [catholic.GetHighGodName] and find purpose in prayer and quiet contemplation as well as scholarly work.

[Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] is reminding you that you had promised to liberate good [muslim.GetGroupName] living under [christian.GetGroupName] rule, and there still exists such in the world.

A [christian.GetGroupName] priest came to my court today to talk about matters of faith, but it soon became clear he only wanted to convert us to his faith! As a zealous [muslim.GetGroupName] I believe I did the right thing when I gave the order to imprison this infidel.
Never! I will save my [christian.GetGroupName] soul!
The default De Jure setup for Kingdoms and Empires will be dynamically generated based on the parameters set below (§Y'De Jure Kingdom Size'§! and §Y'De Jure Empire Size'§!).

Begin swaying §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! to your cause.\n\nWhile swaying another character you will be presented with opportunities to increase their §YOpinion§! of you. These opportunities can present themselves in many ways, with outcomes often being decided by how compatible you are with the character you are swaying. You can only sway one character at a time.

Begin swaying §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! to your cause.\n\nWhile swaying another character you will be presented with opportunities to increase their §YOpinion§! of you. These opportunities can present themselves in many ways, with outcomes often being decided by how compatible you are with the character you are swaying. You can only sway one character at a time.
Stop swaying §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!, ending your efforts to improve [Root.GetHerHis] opinion of you.
Stop swaying §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!, ending your efforts to improve [Root.GetHerHis] opinion of you.

Begin antagonizing §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!, taunting and threatening [Root.GetHerHim].\n\nWhile antagonizing another character you will be presented with opportunities to make life miserable for them, lowering their §YOpinion§! of you. These opportunities commonly involve trickery, deception or outright slander and often improve the mood of characters with a cruel disposition. You can only antagonize one character at a time.

Begin antagonizing §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!, taunting and threatening [Root.GetHerHim].\n\nWhile antagonizing another character you will be presented with opportunities to make life miserable for them, lowering their §YOpinion§! of you. These opportunities commonly involve trickery, deception or outright slander and often improve the mood of characters with a cruel disposition. You can only antagonize one character at a time.
Stop antagonizing [Root.GetTitledFirstName], ending your efforts to provoke [Root.GetHerHim].

I can borrow 300¤ from [jewish.GetName] merchants and moneylenders living in the realm. [Root.JewishGoldInterests]
I will repay the gold that I owe the [jewish.GetName] moneylenders.
Borrow money from [jewish.GetName] merchants traveling on the Silk Road.
§Y*§! Can only declare limited Holy Wars against non-[GetDharmicOrRandom] religions
§Y*§! Can only declare Holy Wars against non-[GetDharmicOrRandom] religions

A month has passed since I gave birth to little [From.GetFirstName]. As is tradition, I should undergo my Churching, as any good [christian.GetGroupName] mother does, and rejoin the Holy Church now that my body has been cleansed of all impurities.

Feudal government revolves around the oath between liege and vassal, and Feudal lords can only directly own so many Holdings before they must start to rely on vassals - whose loyalty may vary... There are several Succession Laws to pick between - each with its own merits. The Centralization Law controls the maximum size of your Demesne and the number of direct vassals you can have. If you should convert to a religion in the [muslim.GetGroupName] group, your government form will change to Iqta.

The [arabic.GetGroupName] Iqta system is similar to the Feudal system - rulers must rely on land holding vassals of varying loyalty and ambition. The maximum number of vassals and the number of Holdings you can directly own are controlled by the Centralization Law. However, there is only one form of Succession available - the chaotic 'Open' type, where the son with most land inherits. If you should convert to a non-[muslim.GetGroupName] religion, your government form will change to Feudal.

All adult [muslim.GetGroupName] men below the rank of Count risk acquiring the §YDecadent§! trait, especially those of low character. The amount of Decadence these men incur on their dynasty depends on their own social status as well as the total amount of Holdings controlled by the Dynasty. Decadence affects the tax income from your demesne and the morale damage that demesne levies take in battle. Ways to halt or decrease Decadence include:
§G*§! Granting landed titles to dynasty members
§G*§! Successfully convincing decadent Dynasty members to abandon their sinful ways
§G*§! Imprisoning, banishing or killing decadent Dynasty members
§G(The Religion View contains a list of decadent dynasty members.)§!

The Monastic Feudal government, much like the ordinary Feudal government, revolves around the oath between liege and vassal, and Monastic Feudal lords can only directly own so many Holdings before they must start to rely on vassals - whose loyalty may vary... The Monastic Feudal government is unique to [tibetan_group.GetGroupName] of either the [buddhist.GetName] or [bon.GetName] faiths, and allows holding Temples in addition to Castles. Monastic Feudal rulers can also construct Gompa Monastery buildings in Castle holdings.

This character, though neither [hindu.GetName], [buddhist.GetName], [jain.GetName] or [taoist.GetName], has a special sympathy and understanding for the [indian_group.GetGroupName] faiths and their practitioners.
This character, though not a [muslim.GetGroupName], has a special sympathy and understanding for the [muslim.GetGroupName] faith and its practitioners.
This character, though not [jewish.GetName], has a special sympathy and understanding for the [jewish.GetName] faith and its practitioners.
This character, though not a [christian.GetGroupName], has a special sympathy and understanding for the [christian.GetGroupName] faith and its practitioners.
This character, though not a [pagan_group.GetGroupName], has a special sympathy and understanding for the [pagan_group.GetGroupName] faiths and their practitioners.
This character, though not a [zoroastrian.GetName], has a special sympathy and understanding for the [zoroastrian_group.GetGroupName] faith and its practitioners.

The conversion of [converting_king.Capital.GetName] starts on a cold morning.\nThe Bishop leading [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s embassy meets you at a river near the city. Your faithful vassals stand beside you, while the rest of your subjects wait their turn behind them, looking still visibly confused. The Bishop recites a few verses from [catholic.GetScriptureName] before you lead your vassals into the river. As you pass the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests they baptize you, one after the other, in the cold water. It takes some prodding from the guards to convince the peasants to follow you into the water, but, after a while, the entire crowd stands soaked and shaking by the riverside, just in time to watch the priests and their helpers drop your old idols into the waves.\n"As the false visages are swallowed by the tides" the Bishop proclaims, "may their memory forever be banished from your soul."

Reforming the [Player.Religion.GetName] faith will turn it into an organized religion with a religious head. Unless you control all of the Holy Sites, doing so requires §Y50§! Moral Authority and control of §Y3§! [Religion.GetName] holy sites. It will cost you §R750§! [Player.Religion.GetPietyName]. Rulers of a Reformed [pagan_group.GetGroupName] religion can use the Holy War Casus Belli, get access to most succession laws, no longer suffer Prestige loss while at peace, and will have less trouble with independent minded vassals. However, they also lose the defensive supply limit penalty for religious enemies in their territory and vassals will get upset if you have their levies raised for too long for no good reason.
[This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted [buddhist.GetName], is trying to learn to abandon [This.GetHerHis] harmful drinking habits.
[This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted [buddhist.GetName], is trying to learn to reject emply pleasures.
[This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted [buddhist.GetName], is trying to learn to abstain from excesses of the flesh.
[This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted [buddhist.GetName], is trying to learn to reject cruelty.
[This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted [buddhist.GetName], is trying to learn to eat without excess.
[This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted [buddhist.GetName], is trying to learn to reject the poison that greed brings to the mind.
[This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted [buddhist.GetName], is trying to learn to reject the poison that envy brings to the mind.
[This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted [buddhist.GetName], is trying to learn to reject the poison that hate and anger brings to the mind.
[This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted [buddhist.GetName], is trying to learn to reject pride.
[This.GetTitledFirstName], as a devoted [buddhist.GetName], is trying to learn to defeat [This.GetHerHis] fear of the world and of the designs of others.
This fortified trade post is owned by the Radhanites, [jewish.GetName] merchants known for their extensive trading contacts around the known world.
This route is favored by Radhanite [jewish.GetName] merchants.
This route is a primary route used by Radhanite [jewish.GetName] merchants, traders pass by here almost every day.

Changing caste is traditionally not possible. However, for a determined ruler who is willing to pay the price in gifts and bribes as well as risk the ire of [hindu.GetName] society, even the impossible might be achieved. And after a generation or so, who knows, people might even forget that [Root.GetHerHis] family weren't always Kshatriya...\n\nA person of high learning will impress more and thus and have a lower cost in gold for the whole process.

Changing caste is traditionally not possible. And after a generation or so, who knows, people might even forget that [Root.GetHerHis] family weren't always Vaishya...\n\nA person of high learning will impress more and thus and have a lower cost in gold for the whole process.

Only a few more days remain before I am crowned [Root.GetTitle] before [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and all my subjects. My court is filling with distinguished guests, both vassals and foreign dignitaries come to bear witness to this fundamental moment of my reign. Such a lavish ceremony is a rare spectacle to behold even amongst royalty.

I kneel before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as a host of Electors and vassals surrounds us in complete silence. The Pope blesses me as he prepares himself to place the Imperial Crown upon my head and proclaim me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of the [roman.GetName]s by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], and protector of all [GetChristendomOrRandom].

I kneel before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as host of vassals surrounds us in complete silence. The Pope blesses me before placing the Imperial Crown upon my head and proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

I kneel before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] in the empty hall of my palace and, after a quick blessing, the [coronation_priest.GetTitle] summarily and places the crown upon my head, proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

[GetJewsName] will be welcomed back into the realm with open arms, enjoying the same rights and liberties as your other citizens.

All [GetJewsName] will be expelled from the realm. Loans you have taken from [jewish.GetName] moneylenders are forfeit and will not need to be repaid, but [GetJewsName] will not return for many years.
All [GetJewsName] are expelled from the realm.
[GetJewsName] are welcomed back into the realm.

You have decided to expel all [GetJewsName] from your realm. After your guards round the [GetJewryName] up, they are forced to depart in yet another large exodus for lands more friendly to their kind. They are allowed to keep many of their belongings, but you confiscate much of their gold.

Several of the largest patrons of culture in [Root.Capital.GetName] were apparently [jewish.GetName], something your advisors were ignorant of. Since the expulsion of the [GetJewryName], cultural life all across the realm has suffered.

It would appear that the military of your realm was more dependent on the efforts of [jewish.GetName] men than previously thought. Since the expulsion of the [GetJewryName], several important administrative posts remain vacant and there simply aren't enough qualified men to fill them.
As you are a Great Conqueror, nothing can stand in the way of you claiming your destiny!

The Dominican Order are able to listen to the confessions of any Christian – dressed in white and black, they lead the holy inquisition, charged with a mission to identify heretics. As a lay member of their Order you are expected to not pursue material wealth, but strive to be a seeker of truth.

The followers of Saint Basil lead an ascetic life, finding purpose in prayer as well as work, often in the name of aiding their fellow men and women. A lay member of the Order is not required to take on the life of a hermit – instead focus should be placed on helping the members of your community.

The order of Abraham the Great follow the monastic rules set by Abraham of Kashkar. Members swear to observe to strict obedience and to spread the word of the three great Nestorian doctors, Nestorius, Diodore of Tarsus, and Theodore of Mopsuestia. Only the literate may join the order and strict celibacy is required. Study and proselytism are the corner pillars of the order and as a member you are expected to spread the Nestorian faith ever eastwards.

The Community of Saint Anthony follows the oldest of monastic rules, set originally by Saint Anthony of Egypt, Saint Paul of Thebes, Saint Macarius and Saint Pachomius. In the spirit of the Great Fathers of Egypt's deserts we value simplicity, submission and humility. It is the duty of Miaphysite monks to work to spread the word of Christ, building on the oldest Christian monastic tradition in the world.

The Monks of the Hindu Mathas aim to be an integrative and supporting force in society. Monks can seek to achieve spiritual enlightenment through meditation and scriptural studies or through charity and participating in the local economy. The Mathas are honored and often patronized by the rulers of India.

Members of Buddhist monasteries are expected to follow a strict set of rules aiming to attain Nirvana through a simple and meditative life. Foreswearing all physical property except the bare necessities Bhikkus vow to live only of what others give them.
Jain monks swear to abide by a number of vows, regulations, essential duties and restrictions. They dispose of all personal property, seeking purification and self-realization.

The Inquisitors are able to listen to the confessions of any [christian.GetGroupName] – dressed in white and black, they lead the holy inquisition, charged with a mission to identify heretics. As a lay member of their Order you are expected to not pursue material wealth, but strive to be a seeker of truth.

The Faithful Ones lead an ascetic life, finding purpose in prayer as well as work, often in the name of aiding their fellow men and women. A lay member of the Order is not required to take on the life of a hermit – instead focus should be placed on helping the members of your community.

The Devout Worshipers follow the monastic rules set by the hallowed martyr. Members swear to observe to strict obedience and to spread the word of the three great [nestorian.GetName] doctors. Only the literate may join the order and strict celibacy is required. Study and proselytism are the corner pillars of the order and as a member you are expected to spread the [nestorian.GetName] faith.

The Pious Following follows the oldest of monastic rules, set originally by the hallowed martyr. In the spirit of the deserts we value simplicity, submission and humility. It is the duty of [miaphysite.GetName] monks to work to spread the word, building on the oldest [christian.GetName] monastic tradition in the world.

The Monks of the [hindu.GetName] Mathas aim to be an integrative and supporting force in society. Monks can seek to achieve spiritual enlightenment through meditation and scriptural studies or through charity and participating in the local economy. The Mathas are honored and often patronized rulers.

Members of [buddhist.GetName] monasteries are expected to follow a strict set of rules aiming to attain enlightenment through a simple and meditative life. Foreswearing all physical property except the bare necessities.
[jain.GetName] monks swear to abide by a number of vows, regulations, essential duties and restrictions. They dispose of all personal property, seeking purification and self-realization.
There suddenly seems to be an awful lot of these [From.TrueReligion.GetName] believers around...

The world has reached boiling point. Intolerance is on the rise, with conflicts of ideology and religious oppression rampant across the world. The many religious leaders congregate within their spheres, bent on having all others subjugate themselves before them. This is the era of large-scale religious wars.
The Era of Great Holy Wars has Begun\n
Great Holy Wars are now active\nAll Holy Orders are now active

A wandering warrior has requested an audience. It appears as if the entire court is abuzz with stories of [invited_character.GetHerHis] exploits, this [invited_character.GetFirstNameWithNick] is seemingly of great renown. [invited_character.GetSheHeCap] wishes to swear fealty to me, having heard of my relation to the legendary [target_bloodline_founder.GetFullName]! I truly am blessed by my blood.
Increased Culture Conversion speed to §G[bodpa.GetName]§! from §Y[zhangzhung.GetName]§! and §Y[sumpa.GetName]§!
Periodically attracts the servitude of §GGreat Warriors§! (if §Y[From.Founder.Religion.GetName]§!)

The blood of [target_bloodline_founder.GetFullName] flows through my veins. Since the days [target_bloodline_founder.GetSheHe] walked the earth we have abandoned our old [target_bloodline_founder.Religion.GetName] faith, though I do see merit in the ways that helped shape such a legend...
We were once like them, we should not judge their ways.
No, the ways of old belong in the past.
[target_bloodline_founder.Religion.GetHighGodName] speaks directly through my blood! I repent!

Generates a realm somewhere in the world based upon the Holy Roman Empire. The realm will be large and religiously uniform, but heavily decentralized and elective.\n\n - Requires §Y'De Jure Kingdoms and Empires'§! be set to 'Random'.

Generates a realm somewhere in the world based upon the Byzantine Empire. The realm will be large and centralized, with Viceroyalty laws in effect. The Emperor will start off with all De Jure Duchy titles, to be handed out as Viceroyalties.\n\n - Requires §Y'De Jure Kingdoms and Empires'§! be set to 'Random'.

Determines how large Kingdoms will be when De Jure Kingdoms are randomized. The slider sets the minimum and maximum number of Duchies per Kingdom. Depending on their placement, Kingdoms might in rare cases end up below or above the set limits.
Increases the amount of Pagans in the world. Note that in rare cases the Pagans can be cut off from being assigned more land.
Generates a number of Merchant Republics throughout the world. Merchant Republics will only spawn if there are enough coastal cities to accommodate them.
Generates a small portion of Theocracies. Theocracies will only spawn if there are enough temples to accommodate them.
This character follows the Vaishnavist branch of [hindu.GetName]ism.
This character follows the Shaktist branch of [hindu.GetName]ism.
This character follows the Smartist branch of [hindu.GetName]ism.
This character follows the Mahayana branch of the [buddhist.GetName] faith.
This character follows the Vajrayana branch of the [buddhist.GetName] faith.
This character follows the Theravada branch of the [buddhist.GetName] faith.
This character follows the Digambara branch of [jain.GetName]ism.
This character follows the Svetambara branch of [jain.GetName]ism.
Determines whether names of Titles should be random or not.
Title names will not be changed. If a non-historical De Jure setup is used, the names of their base titles (Counties or Duchies) will be used.
Kingdoms and Empires will be assigned random names.
Duchies, Kingdoms and Empires will be assigned random names.\nNote that names might sometimes repeat when using this option.

The elusive Assassins consider themselves the true followers of [shiite.GetHighGodName], and will do anything to further the advances of the [shiite.GetName] faith and protect their fellow believers. Consisting of loyal warriors as well as competent spies, wielding manipulation and social skills as expertly as a dagger, they specialize in asymmetrical warfare, striking hard at the heart of their enemies.

The elusive Assassins consider themselves the true followers of Allah, and will do anything to further the advances of Shia Islam and protect their fellow believers. Consisting of loyal warriors as well as competent spies, wielding manipulation and social skills as expertly as a dagger, they specialize in asymmetrical warfare, striking hard at the heart of their enemies.
A combination of mobile cavalry and heavily armored infantry trains here.
Hardened [GetGermanic] warriors meet here to train and exchange tactics.
The [jurchen.GetName] are famous for their skilled cavalry, the Tie-Futu and their unique battle tactics – this is their practice grounds where they train to improve upon their specialty.
The agile [iberian.GetGroupName] "jinete" light cavalry is raised here. Inspired by the Moors, these horsemen are skilled at skirmishing and harassment.
Druzhina retinues train here, well-knit martial fellowships in service of a [russian.GetName] lord.
Large numbers of [ethiopian.GetName] warriors are drilled here in the effective use of spears and bows.

This is where the elite infantry serving an [israelite.GetGroupName] ruler is trained. Special care is taken to equip the soldiers with the finest heavy armor that money can buy. This, combined with rigorous training and iron discipline, makes them an elite force to be truly feared.
Sharpened palisade walls and trenches dug in strategic areas aid in defending our settlement.
Outposts stationed by archers allow for a rapid defense.
Extra layers of palisade walls allow our defenders to safely retreat should one of them fall.
Long trenches lead out of the settlement to watchtowers built of stone.

These barracks are where the ancient [nubian.GetName] warrior traditions are nurtured and developed. [GetNubia] has since ancient times been respected for its masterful archers, and other elite units of infantry are trained and drilled to support this potent weapon of the [nubian.GetName] rulers.
Highly trained light infantry is used to patrol and defend the borders of a [somali.GetName] ruler's domain. This is where they train and hone their skills.

The heavy infantry formations of the [old_frankish.GetName] and [lombard.GetName] are heavily influenced by the [roman.GetName] army's organization and tactics. Here is where these elite warriors are trained and drilled to be ready for battle in the service of their liege.

The Hall of War is where the most experienced and fierce of the [pictish.GetName] warriors gather to train their skills and exchange stories of battle. When the horns call them to war they are a fearsome force - woe to those that come in their path!
Since the days of Zhuge Liang and the invention of his crossbow, [chinese_group.GetGroupName] soldiers carry an advantage on the battlefield. Here they gather, turning proficiency into mastery.
The hardy peoples of the Himalayas are experts at fighting in rough and mountainous terrain.
The hardy peoples of the mountains are experts at fighting in rough and rocky terrain.
This light cavalry force can trace its origins back to Serbia. Armed with spears and shields, they often serve in a support role, charging the enemy as soon as an opportunity presents itself.
This light cavalry force can trace its origins back centuries. Armed with spears and shields, they often serve in a support role, charging the enemy as soon as an opportunity presents itself.
These urban militias are named after the Flemish goedendag mace they favor in battle. They have proven themselves more than once against armored cavalry.
These urban militias are named after the mace they favor in battle. They have proven themselves more than once against armored cavalry.

The schiltron is a compact body of [scottish.GetName] pikemen. If threatened by cavalry, they present row upon row of spears firmly braced in the earth. Only a fool or a madman would willingly charge into such a dense wall of killing instruments.
Determines whether Religions will work historically, or with randomized features.
Religions have their features randomized.\n\n - Requires §Y'Culture and Religion Names'§! to be set to 'Random'. If not, religious descriptions and their effects might not correlate.
This act violates your religious doctrine of non-violence\n
In a world dominated by animals, can mankind still prevail?
