Should I stay and fight for the throne of [top_liege_match_target.PrimaryTitle.GetName], or should I abandon my past and look towards [target_invasion_character.PrimaryTitle.GetName]?

The time has come. My blood burns with ambition, I can stay idle no longer! It is my destiny to become [child_of_destiny.GetKingQueen], and I have the support I need to realize it! My eyes are set upon [target_invasion_character.PrimaryTitle.GetName], and all the riches that lie within...
I shall lead my armies towards [target_invasion_character.PrimaryTitle.GetName]!
The time is not right... I will give it more time.

I always expected [child_of_destiny.GetFirstName] to do this, though I hoped the day would never come... [child_of_destiny.GetSheHeCap] has, with popular support, laid claim to [top_liege_match_target.PrimaryTitle.GetName]! With a massive host of willing soldiers backing [child_of_destiny.GetHerHis] claim, I fear it will not be long before a civil war breaks out...
Oh [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], [child_of_destiny.GetHerHis] ambition will ruin us all!

It seems as if [child_of_destiny.GetFirstName] has decided that [child_of_destiny.GetHerHis] ambitions will never be realized as long as [child_of_destiny.GetSheHe] stays in [top_liege_match_target.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. [child_of_destiny.GetSheHeCap] has attracted a massive host of eager soldiers, willing to fight and die for [child_of_destiny.GetHerHim], which he is steering towards the realm of [target_invasion_character.GetFullName]. I fear [target_invasion_character.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is doomed...
This is the last drop, [child_of_destiny.GetFirstName] is out of the will!
What a relief! Now [child_of_destiny.GetFirstName] is [target_invasion_character.GetFirstName]s problem!

Lately my thoughts have been shaded by dark clouds. Today I read a book about an ancient hero, and [child_of_destiny.GetSheHe] reminds me of myself! [child_of_destiny.GetSheHeCap] fights impossible odds, and overcomes hardships similar to my own. It is as if the hero of the book and myself share a destiny! I must not doubt myself, this world will be mine one day.
Beware, darkness - for I shall banish you from my mind!
This character leads by example. [GetSheHeCap] orates inspiring stories that ensures the loyalty of [GetHerHis] subjects.
This character has no problems sacrificing [GetHerHis] friends to reach [GetHerHis] goals. This ruthlessness attracts the most fierce of warriors to [GetHerHis] cause.

My natural charisma has led me to become very popular. Other kids do not dare to pick on me, as I have many friends who would come to my aid at a moments notice. In fact, there is always someone following me around. Whatever I want them to do, they will do for me – in the playground, I rule.
When I am [child_of_destiny.GetKingQueen], loyalty will be rewarded.
They say they would die for me, I like that!

[child_of_destiny.GetFirstName] seems to be very charismatic – in the playground [child_of_destiny.GetSheHe] is always 'guarded' by at least three other children. It would almost seem as if [child_of_destiny.GetSheHe] is building the foundation of a very young army...
I am glad that my [child_of_destiny.GetSonDaughter] is making friends, I suppose?
Ominous, children should not act like this...
Finally, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is mine! Now, how do I wish to rule over my new subjects? Should I impose my beliefs and traditions upon them, or should I adapt to their culture and morals?
I shall adopt both their traditions and faith!
I will adopt their traditions, but I will not abandon [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
Their faith speaks to me... adopting it could further my plans.
I will not change, they will have to get used to me!

Ever since I was a child I dreamt about this moment, to seize a crown and name myself [Root.GetTitle], and now it has finally come true! But my ambitions know no bounds – for as long as I live, I shall conquer. My name shall be known across the world, and my legacy will last for millennia!
I have seized my destiny, though it does not end here!

A great conqueror by the name of [child_of_destiny.GetFirstNameWithNick] has invaded and taken over the realm of [child_of_destiny.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. [child_of_destiny.GetSheHeCap] is a [child_of_destiny.GetManWoman] of unrivaled ambition, with eyes set on the rest of the known world. Time will tell if [child_of_destiny.GetSheHe] will build an empire to rival that of Alexander the Great himself, or if [child_of_destiny.GetSheHe] will march [child_of_destiny.GetHerHis] army into oblivion in the Gedrosian desert...

I thought I was going to rot in prison forever, until I heard a voice outside my cell. "Be very silent, I am getting you out of here!" the voice whispers. It is [savior_target.GetFullName], come to save me!
No, I quite like it here.

During the night, [child_of_destiny.GetFullName] escaped from my dungeons! [child_of_destiny.GetSheHeCap] was apparently helped by [savior_target.GetFullName], who has joined [child_of_destiny.GetHerHim] at [child_of_destiny.GetHerHis] court.

[child_of_destiny.GetFullName], who was imprisoned by [jailer_target.GetFullName], has escaped during the night! [child_of_destiny.GetSheHeCap] was apparently helped by [savior_target.GetFullName], who has joined [child_of_destiny.GetHerHis] court.

I know that the key to success lies in who I let close to me. No great [child_of_destiny.GetManWoman] ever reached the top without having at least a couple of loyal friends by their side – and I intend to choose only the most useful of people to stand by my side. There are many people clamoring for my attention, but who should I encourage?
Someone powerful, to aid me if I need help.
Someone in a position to further my goals...
Someone wise and clever, to provide counsel.
I do not like either of these people.

Lying in my bed I glance out through the open window. In the stars I can see my destiny, the soft light dancing in front of my eyes – telling of the many adventures I will have, the friends I will make, and the Kingdoms I will rule. It is comforting to know that the stars align just for me.
When I am older I will seize what is mine, but for now I will rest.
For as long as you live, you can use the §GInvasion Casus Belli§!
An army with wich to claim your destiny assembles!
[This.Founder.GetTitledFirstName] was a duelist of great renown. No one would stand in [This.Founder.GetHerHis] way lest they wanted a humiliating defeat, or a swift death...
[This.Founder.GetTitledFirstName] was a duelist of great renown. No one would stand in [This.Founder.GetHerHis] way lest they wanted a humiliating defeat, or a swift death...

No matter the weapon: sword, axe, mace or spear – I am unmatched in a duel. Many have tried to best me, and few have ever succeeded. My reputation reaches both far and wide – I am known for my skill, my tenacity, my cunning and my ruthlessness... Come the day, I would even defeat [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] in personal combat!
This character has used [GetHerHis] cunning to track down and corner those who refused to duel [GetHerHim].
This character is a violent and unyielding duelist, not many have walked away alive after challenging [GetHerHim].
I will always approve this type of war!
Swords may give a bonus to commanded §YLight Infantry§! and §YHeavy Foot Troops§!, as well as §YMartial§!, §YPersonal Combat Skill§! and §YMonthly Prestige§!.\n
Scimitars may give a bonus to commanded §YLight Infantry§! and §YHeavy Foot Troops§!, as well as §YMartial§!, §YPersonal Combat Skill§! and §YMonthly Prestige§!.\n
Lances may give a bonus to commanded §YPikemen§! and §YMounted Troops§!, as well as §YMartial§!, §YPersonal Combat Skill§! and §YMonthly Prestige§!.\n
Axes may give a bonus to commanded §YHeavy Infantry§! and §YLight Foot Troops§!, as well as §YMartial§!, §YPersonal Combat Skill§! and §YMonthly Prestige§!.\n
Maces may give a bonus to commanded §YLight Cavalry§! and §YHeavy Foot Troops§!, as well as §YMartial§!, §YPersonal Combat Skill§! and §YMonthly Prestige§!.\n
Bows may give a bonus to commanded §YArchers§! and §YMounted Troops§!, as well as §YMartial§!, §YPersonal Combat Skill§! and §YMonthly Prestige§!.\n

This is the character who the Pope wants to grant the Crusader Kingdom, should the Crusade be successful. If no character is chosen, it means the Pope has no preference and the Beneficiary of the top contributor will be chosen to rule the Crusader Kingdom.

This is the target character and kingdom of the Crusade. The Pope chooses his targets based on importance to the faith, and will usually prioritize protecting the faith's homelands before going off on distant adventures.

The War Chest symbolizes both wealth collected in preparation for the crusade, and any spoils of war gathered during the Crusade. At the start of the crusade, a portion of the wealth in the War Chest will be divided between the Pledged Crusaders to support their levies. At the end of a successful Crusade any wealth, piety, prestige and any artifacts remaining in the War Chest will be divided between the Pledged Crusaders, with the largest share of the spoils going to the ones who contributed the most (up to a limit).
These characters are pledged to participate in the Crusade when it starts.
Click to show the Pledged Participants of the other side of the Crusade.

This is the character you have chosen as your beneficiary. A beneficiary might be made into a ruler in the Crusader Kingdom, should the war be successful. Having a beneficiary in a Crusader Kingdom will convey a piety bonus to your entire dynasty.
This is the comparative military strength of this side in the Crusade, in relation to the other side. The higher the strength of your side, the more likely you are to win the war.
Has NOT donated to a Holy Order in the past year[Root.GetHolyOrderDonationCD]
- you can donate to a Holy Order again on: §Y[This.donate_to_holy_order_cooldown.GetExpiryDate]§!
Absurd events may appear during the game.
No absurd events may appear during the game.
AI rulers will be eligible to receive absurd events.
Do not ruin this place - I have other plans for it.

My [home_liege.GetRootRelation] [home_liege.GetTitledFirstName] is apparently thoroughly impressed by my battle technique. A missive I have received speaks at length about my bravery, and of people telling stories about the decapitation of [enemy_commander.GetTitledFirstName] for years to come.

You let your fellow commander deal with the road block.\n

On our way through the [battlefield_location.GetTerrain], a gigantic boulder blocks our path. I call across the [battlefield_location.GetTerrain].

Nostalgia comes easily in the soft light of a campfire. Last night, one eager soldier blessed us with a riveting tale of the battle that claimed the life of my [target.GetRootRelation], [target.GetBestName]. As I am [GetRidingMarching] onto the battlefield today, I let the past fuel my resolve.

In the light of the campfire, my men often talk about heroes of old. Last night, one of them blessed us with a fabulous tale of the battle that claimed the life of [target.GetBestName]. I never gave it that much thought, but [GetRidingMarching] onto the battlefield, I find myself lingering on the story.

It was long ago I felt so good about being in charge of a regiment. Today, while lying in wait for an ambush, one nervous officer confessed that there was a time when the stories about my command were all over [home_capital_province.GetName]. "It's what made me vow to join the [Root.Culture.GetName] army, my [Root.GetLordLady]", [Root.GetSheHe] murmurs.

I remember hearing the stories from [home_capital_province.GetName], about the command and leadership of [target.GetBestName]. "It is important to have role models", I said at the time. Today, I look out over my regiment, thankful for all the great leaders that came before me.
You're saying *I* am the reason you became a soldier...?
Now they all look to me.
No, I do not drink from the skulls of my enemies I laugh, when one curious recruit lets slip a question about that time when I decapitated an enemy on the battlefield. [GetSkullTrophyComment]

If [target.GetTitledFirstName] drank from the skulls of [target.GetHerHis] enemies? I ask. The recruit nods eagerly. I laugh, putting my arm around [Root.GetHerHim] conspiratorially: "Of course, there is a secret chamber back home in [home_capital_province.Capital.GetName], where [target.GetSheHe] is rumored to have bathed in their blood". The recruit grows pale.
You're never gonna let that story go, eh?

But that is not a bad idea! I like your humor, [Root.GetBoyGirl] I say, patting [Root.GetHerHim] on the back.
I didn't even take the skull with me! Honestly, you have too much imagination, soldier I say, patting [Root.GetHerHim] on the back.
This character is riding on a wave of glorious battles, long gone by.
This character is awash with a sense of pride and duty.
This character is enjoying the attention.

I am one with [GetWarriorLodgeSymbol], I find myself chanting with each swing of my [GetDuelWeapon]. "For [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]!" I roar, my weapon [GetWeaponSwinging] the soul out of any who dare step in my way. I was chasing [enemy_commander.GetTitledFirstName] [battlefield_location.GetThroughOver] the [battlefield_location.GetTerrain], when [commander_to_the_rescue.GetTitledFirstName] shoved me aside, barking "I'll take this one, my [Root.GetLordLady]!", [commander_to_the_rescue.GetClumsilyElegantly] swinging [commander_to_the_rescue.GetHerHis] [commander_to_the_rescue.GetDuelWeapon]...

[home_commander.GetTitledFirstName] is reported to have been chasing down [enemy_commander.GetTitledFirstName] [battlefield_location.GetThroughOver] the [battlefield_location.GetTerrain], when my commander [commander_to_the_rescue.GetTitledFirstName] decided to intervene, [commander_to_the_rescue.GetBattleRescueDesc]
taking complete control of the situation!
expertly outmaneuvering the enemy commander and painting the battlefield with [enemy_commander.GetHerHis] blood!
completely disrupting the flow of the battle and getting [This.GetHerselfHimself] injured in the process.
Fortune does not always favor loyalty.
Fortune does not always favor the brave.

The enemy commander [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] is not playing fair, and has me completely cornered up against a [battlefield_location.GetTreeRockFence]. Behind [other_combatant.GetHerHim], a group of [other_combatant.GetHerHis] soldiers are moving closer. They are laughing, mocking me, thirsting for blood...

The enemy commander [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] is swinging [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetDuelWeapon] with increasing precision, and I am beginning to think that I will die here, [battlefield_location.GetInOn] the [battlefield_location.GetTerrain].

I cannot believe what is happening, but with each swing of [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetDuelWeapon] [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] is getting closer and closer to winning this fight. It seems that the enemy commander [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] actually expected me to play fair when [other_combatant.GetSheHe] chased me down on the battlefield. I was swinging my [Root.GetDuelWeapon] with increasing precision, but I am not sure the enemy commander [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] realized that [other_combatant.GetSheHe] was going to perish on this battlefield, until I landed a deadly blow to [other_combatant.GetHerHis] skull, cracking it audibly open.

It was surprising, but with each swing of my [Root.GetDuelWeapon], [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] seemed to have increasing difficulty controlling [other_combatant.GetHerHis] stance. All in all it was close, but in the end I landed a lucky blow to [other_combatant.GetHerHis] temple...

I yield! [From.GetTitledFirstName] calls out. Sweat dripping down my forehead, I am holding my [Root.GetDuelWeapon] high, a deadly blow about to come down on my enemy. "You what?!" I demand. The [From.GetManWoman] drops to [From.GetHerHis] knees. "I'll be your prisoner! I'll be of more use to you alive" [From.GetSheHe] cries.

W-wait! I yield! [From.GetTitledFirstName] cries out. My [Root.GetDuelWeapon] high, I slow the deadly blow about to come down on my enemy. The [From.GetManWoman] scrambles backwards, almost tripping over [From.GetHerselfHimself]. "I'll be your prisoner! Spare my life!" [From.GetSheHe] whimpers.
I think I prefer you dead.

In the heat of the battle, my commander [From.GetTitledName], has been slain in one-on-one duel, between [From.GetHerHim] and [FromFrom.GetBestName]. It is said the [From.GetTitledFirstName] tried to surrender, but to no avail.

In the middle of battle I catch sight of a [my_dear.GetBoyGirl] wearing the same colors I am. I just have time to notice the fierce expression on [my_dear.GetHerHis] face, when [my_dear.GetSheHe] is struck down. I feel a pang of guilt, realizing how much [my_dear.GetSheHe] reminded me of my [my_dear.GetRootRelation] [my_dear.GetFirstName].

During the battle I catch sight of a [my_dear.GetFaceDescription] [my_dear.GetManWoman] who looks a lot like my [my_dear.GetRootRelation] [my_dear.GetTitledFirstName]. Then [my_dear.GetSheHe] is struck down. Suddenly, I am pushing soldiers out of the way, hurrying over to where I saw [my_dear.GetHerHim] fall. We must remember to tend to our wounded.

The old wound has finally healed, leaving a pretty grotesque scar behind. Some fresh air and walks in the [Root.Location.GetTerrain] surrounding [Root.Location.GetName] was all I needed!
I am starting to think the physician who looked at my injury was mistaken. The wound from the maiming has healed completely! Maybe it was all a trick of the light?
The old wound has finally healed, leaving a pretty grotesque scar behind.

My injuries were extensive, but not enough to break me. Waking up this morning, I straighten my back. "This pain is temporary" I declare to my servant, who is watching me incredulously. The demons will have to try harder before [Root.GetTitledFirstName] surrenders to self-pity.

All my [Root.GetBrotherSister]s of [Root.Society.GetName] know that infections are best treated with a calming poultice, good sleep, and fresh air. I am not surprised to find that the foul smell is gone from my wound, leaving but a pale scar behind.

Someone get me an axe! I roar. The crowd gasps as I start swinging it around me, some scrambling in panic to get out of my way. One brave soul, [kinslayer_target.GetTitledFirstName], steps in front of me, accepting the challenge. When we are done, we are laughing heartily. "I like your rage, [Root.GetBrotherSister]!" [kinslayer_target.GetSheHe] says, wiping the sweat from [kinslayer_target.GetHerHis] brow.

Someone get me an axe! NOW! I roar to the closest soldier I can find. In the corner of my eye, I see my [kinslayer_target.GetRootRelation] [kinslayer_target.GetTitledFirstName] watching me. As I start swinging the weapon around, the rush of combat fills me. I find myself smiling, then laughing, from the bottom of my belly. [kinslayer_target.GetFirstName] is laughing too, and the crowd cheers me on.

Give me your axe! NOW! I roar at the recruit. The young [Root.GetBoyGirl] obeys and the crowd around me gasps as I start swinging it around me, some scrambling to get out of my way. "[Root.GetFirstName], what are you doing?!" my [kinslayer_target.GetRootRelation] [kinslayer_target.GetFirstName] yells in despair, clutching at [kinslayer_target.GetHerHis] bloodied tunic.
Aaah, I shall be the scourge of our enemies!
Aaah, by [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]! You are a small sacrifice for my new-gained strength!
I was just... Curses, someone help us out here!
died caught in the violent fury of $KILLER$
died a victim of violent fury

[From.GetTitledFirstName] apparently went on a wild rampage through [From.GetHerHis] [From.GetCapitalHolding], and my poor [kinslayer_target.GetRootRelation] [kinslayer_target.GetTitledFirstName] was caught in the crossfire!

Signed, [lodge_hero.GetTitledFirstName]

Hail, [Root.GetSocietyRank]!

Your fellow members of [Root.Society.GetName] have received word that you did not fully seize control of the contested territory, but that it was not for lack of trying. May [Root.GetWarriorLodgeSymbol] bring you better fortune in the future.

Signed, [lodge_hero.GetTitledFirstName]

Hail, [Root.GetSocietyRank]!

From every battle there is a lesson. Let us take solace in the thought that our fallen brothers and sisters dine with [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] tonight, and that you may one day find vengeance for this bitter defeat.

Signed, [lodge_hero.GetTitledFirstName]
send your galleys and soldiers to

For [Root.Society.GetName]! I proclaim, raising my glass. The cheers around the table are boisterous and the air hangs heavy with anticipation. "There is nothing left here to conquer!" someone laughs. Raising an eyebrow conspiratorially, [fellow_hero_1.GetFirstName] murmurs: "Have you ever been to [target_title.GetName]?"
Capital idea, [fellow_hero_1.GetFirstName]! Let's seek out fighters in [target_title.GetName].
A group of heroes begin preparing for a journey into the realm of §Y[target_ruler.GetTitledFirstName]§!. For blood and glory!\n
I am quite comfortable here in [Root.Capital.GetName]...

[original_hero.GetTitledFirstName] has declared that the highest ranking members of [Root.Society.GetName] are to go on an adventure, into [target_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName], the lands of [target_ruler.GetTitledFirstName]. After the cheers have gone around the table, I am left with my thoughts.
Terrific initiative! It is about time we earned our names as warriors!
You will follow §Y[original_hero.GetTitledFirstName]'s§! lead, and venture forth, into blood and (hopefully) glory.\n
You will be §Rblocked§! from ranking up to [Root.GetSocietyRank] again.\n

[giving_member.GetTitledFirstName] approaches me, as I am poring over some maps of [target_title.GetName]. A servant alerts me to [giving_member.GetHerHis] visit, and as I glance up from the table, I notice they are carrying something wrapped in fine fabric. "For the battles to come", the [giving_member.GetManWoman] says, without further ceremony.
I will make certain this is put to good use, [giving_member.GetBrotherSister]!
Oh, this is far too generous. I shall pay you for it!
I think you need this more than I, [giving_member.GetFirstName].
I would rather focus on my personal training.

To bolster [fellow_member.GetHerHis] confidence for our adventure into [target_title.GetName], I am showing [fellow_hero_1.GetTitledFirstName] around my trophy room. "You are... a collector of skulls then", the [fellow_hero_1.GetManWoman] comments, before interrupting [fellow_member.GetHerselfHimself]: "Oh, but this one would make a fine chalice!".
Yes, I'll have someone fashion a cup out of one of these.
You set your finest craftsmen to re-purpose the old trophy.\n
Actually, staring into its hollow eyes gives me great comfort as is.

Out [Root.GetRidingMarching] with [fellow_member.GetTitledFirstName], my eagle by my side, the [fellow_member.GetManWoman] showers both me and my bird with compliments. "You make a great team", [fellow_member.GetTitledFirstName] concludes.
You are right. [Root.GetSheHeCap] is always there for me.
You gently stroke the head of the eagle.\n
Actually, it is just a bird.
This character is not of a sentimental persuasion.

As I am soon to be off into the lands of [target_title.GetName], my [Root.GetMyMarshalName] [marshal_character.GetTitledFirstName] is concerned for our troops being without leadership. "Might I suggest you leave your [target_artifact.GetName] behind, as a token of your continued guidance?" [marshal_character.GetSheHe] offers. "If nothing else, you should have that thing sharpened, my [Root.GetLordLady]" [marshal_character.GetSheHe] frowns.
The weapon could use some love, I suppose.
Sharpen it! I'll inform the troops of the confidence I have in you.
I trust you will take good care of it, [Root.GetMyMarshalName].
I am not letting anyone else touch this weapon.
A treasured trophy of [OriginalOwner.GetTitledFirstName]'s, the [Root.Society.GetName] had this weapon sharpened, before [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s adventurous journey to [target_title.GetName].
A treasured trophy of [OriginalOwner.GetTitledFirstName]'s, the [Root.Society.GetName] had this weapon sharpened, before [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s adventurous journey to [target_title.GetName].

The time has come for us to move into enemy territory. [fellow_member.GetTitledFirstName] and I are toasting once more, to [Root.Society.GetName]. "We shall find their most experienced warriors, and show them what it means to be [Root.Culture.GetName]!" I declare. "Everyone shall know our name!" [fellow_member.GetSheHe] agrees, slamming [fellow_member.GetHerHis] fist into the table.
The glory will be all mine!

We are camped [target_ruler.Capital.GetInOn] the [target_ruler.Capital.GetTerrain], on our way to [target_title.GetName]. While I am scouting the perimeter, I hear the sound of fighting. As I lean out from behind a [target_ruler.Capital.GetTreeRockFence], I spot a [my_duel_target.GetManWoman] wrestling a [target_ruler.Capital.GetRegionalBigAnimal]! And winning...!
A challenge! *clears throat* Hey, you! Yes, you! Let's fight!
The [my_duel_target.GetManWoman] wipes some blood off [my_duel_target.GetHerHis] face, before steadying [my_duel_target.GetHerselfHimself] to face you.\n
This one looks too big for me...

Having spent the evening drinking and talking around the campfire with my traveling companions, I finally bid them good night. On my way back to my sleeping spot, I pause. Nearby, leaning against a [target_ruler.Capital.GetTreeRockFence], is a [my_duel_target.GetManWoman] tending to nature's call. "An enemy!" I yell, more surprised than alarmed.
Oh, excellent! I will duel this one!
I should just leave you be, I think.

Walking through the streets of a village in [target_ruler.Capital.GetName], the locals seem eager to point out how foreign I am. They have clearly never seen a [Root.GetManWoman] like I before, and while some are adoring my armor and confident stride, it does not take long before I encounter open hostility. "Go home!" one [my_duel_target.GetManWoman] barks.
You want to say that to my face? Let's fight!
This one looks too big for me...

Having turned in for the night, I find myself wide awake listening to the snoring of [fellow_member.GetTitledFirstName]. Just as I am about to get up and do something about my irritation, I hear a rustling in the bushes. Before I can get to my feet, I find a [my_duel_target.GetManWoman] leaning over me, eying me suspiciously, a weapon aimed at my throat.
You come armed, I see... How about we do this one on one?
You challenge the scout to a duel, and the two of you meet on a moonlit field.\n
Together with §Y[fellow_member.GetTitledFirstName]§!, you fight the scout off.\n

The finest warrior around? Well, that would be [my_duel_target.GetTitledFirstName], [Root.GetMasterMistress], a little [Root.GetBoyGirl] says. [fellow_member.GetFirstName] fishes a coin from [fellow_member.GetHerHis] pockets, rewarding the urchin for the information. "There [my_duel_target.GetSheHe] is!" the child suddenly cries, pointing at a [my_duel_target.Culture.GetName] [my_duel_target.GetManWoman] down the street.
Aah, such fortune! My [my_duel_target.GetLordLady]! Come face me!
§Y[my_duel_target.GetTitledFirstName]§! stops in [my_duel_target.GetHerHis] tracks, drawing a weapon...\n
... On second thought, perhaps this one is for you, [fellow_member.GetFirstName]?
§Y[fellow_member.GetTitledFirstName]§! cracks [fellow_member.GetHerHis] knuckles, eager for a fight.\n

Walking through the streets of a village in [target_ruler.Capital.GetName], the locals seem eager to point out how foreign I am. They have clearly never seen a [Root.GetManWoman] like I before, and while some are adoring my armor and confident stride, it does not take long before I encounter open hostility. "Go home!" one [my_duel_target.GetManWoman] barks.
A challenge! I will duel this one!
You are entitled to your opinion, I suppose.
The legendary journey is over for §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n
This is becoming too dangerous for me.
The legendary journey is over, for both you and §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\nYou return home in shame.
[From.GetTitledName] has perished during [From.GetHerHis] adventurous journey through foreign lands. Everyone who fought alongside [From.GetHerHim] know that [From.GetSheHe] died a warrior.

The [target_ruler.Capital.GetRegionalBigAnimal] dead on the ground, the [other_combatant.GetManWoman] braces for my attack. I call out: "For [Root.Society.GetName]!", my [Root.GetDuelWeapon] swooshing, nay, singing through the air. With the trees as our audience, and only witness to my deed, I have soon seen to [other_combatant.GetWeaponInjuringBlow].

Albeit under the influence, the battle stance comes naturally to me. My opponent staggers backwards in surprise, almost tripping over the [target_ruler.Capital.GetTreeRockFence]. Before [other_combatant.GetSheHe] has time to catch up, I [Root.GetKillingBlow].

I draw my weapon, without hesitation. The crowd scatters around us and my opponent and I fall into circling one another. The ensuing fight is more even than I care to admit. At the end, I am sending a quiet prayer to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], as I take in the cheers of our audience, and slam my weapon against [other_combatant.GetHerHis] head.

As soon as the camp is out of earshot, my opponent draws [other_combatant.GetHerHis] weapon. Wind moves over the moonlit meadow, the grass bending in waves, causing it look as if the ground itself is breathing, under our feet. "This is too easy", I murmur. Then I [other_combatant.GetWeaponInjuringBlow].

[fellow_member.GetTitledFirstName] motions for people to get out of the way, just before [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] lunges at me, indignity on [other_combatant.GetHerHis] face. I parry immediately, defending myself well, judging by the excited cheers of our spectators. At the end of it all, the crowd has grown still, the streets flowing with the blood of their [other_combatant.Culture.GetName] warrior.
My opponent seems to be getting tired, [other_combatant.GetHerHis] moves becoming slower. Strengthened by the cheers of the crowd, I [Root.GetKillingBlow].

Charging into the glade, I am itching for a fight. My opponent simply waits, one hand resting on [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetDuelWeapon]. I draw closer, thinking this is going to be fun! The [target_ruler.Capital.GetRegionalBigAnimal] dead on the ground, I raise my own weapon, about to let out my battle cry. Then I hear the desperate roar of the animal behind me and then... nothing.

You must be lost! I proclaim, drawing my weapon. I sway a little, internally cursing the alcohol in my veins. The [other_combatant.GetManWoman]'s face darkens, and I swallow. A scout! A spy? My mind races. "Your liege knows we are here then?" I demand to know, but my opponent has already slashed my guts open. "You heathen drunk", [other_combatant.GetSheHe] mutters.

You want me to DUEL you?, the [other_combatant.GetManWoman] mocks, rolling [other_combatant.GetHerHis] eyes. The next thing I know, I am under a furious flurry of attacks, only barely keeping up with my opponent. A young girl screams as I collapse into the crowd, bloody and unable to stand any longer. "Inform [target_ruler.GetTitledFirstName], that the heathen troll is dead", is the last thing I hear.

I hear birds. It must be dawn, I think to myself. Why does my face feel cold, my limbs frozen...? Tensing, I cannot move. What happened? We fought on a meadow, the moon was guiding me, and... I fell. That blasted scout skewered me, with [other_combatant.GetHerHis] sword. Oh [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], welcome me to your side...

[other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] seems to be flying towards me, swinging [other_combatant.GetHerHis] weapon vigorously. [fellow_member.GetTitledFirstName] pulls a small child out of our way, and yells for the crowd to step back. My opponent's technique appears more focused on showmanship than actual swordplay, and I find myself drawn in by the spectacle. Then suddenly, [other_combatant.GetHerHis] weapon sinks into my chest.
You make progress on your legendary journey\n
You make §Ggreat§! progress on your legendary journey\n
Has NOT forfeited the rank before

Upon your return to [Root.Capital.GetName], [Root.GetLegendaryReturnReception] The whole [Root.GetCapitalHolding] has been dressed in celebratory banners and your [my_beloved.GetRootRelation] [my_beloved.GetTitledFirstName] greets you with a smile. [Root.GetLegendaryAchievementSummary]\n\nFrom deeper in the [Root.GetCapitalHolding] [Root.Society.GetName] are singing a song of battle, its melody inviting you to celebration...
everyone seems happy to have you back. A lot of them ask what you are going to do next. "Surely, you still have things to do?"
your servants and household members trip over themselves to greet you, the victorious warrior returned.
warriors and commoners alike swoon when they see you - one [Root.GetManWomanOpp] actually faints as you ride by with your entourage.
I am just happy to have you home, my [Root.GetLordLady].
I have the impression you have some rumors to explain, my [Root.GetLordLady]. [my_beloved.GetSheHeCap] smirks, adding: "Or to embellish, I suppose".

The bards will sing of your accomplishments for generations to come! They say you took down an army of a hundred men and wild [target_ruler.Capital.GetRegionalBigAnimal]s?! We received news that some of you were taken captive and... The [my_beloved.GetManWoman]'s words trail off, and [my_beloved.GetSheHe] composes [my_beloved.GetHerselfHimself].\n"My [Root.GetLordLady]: welcome home."

[From.GetTitledName], your [From.GetRootRelation], has left this earthly realm, but tales of [From.GetHerHis] adventures are all around us. The memory of the [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] warrior-[From.GetManWoman] is sure to live on, if not in the hearts of [From.GetHerHis] companions, so in the blood of [From.GetHerHis] family.\n\nA hero has left us.

They say that everyone in the [From.GetCapitalHolding] of [From.Capital.GetName] spent several moons preparing for the return of [From.GetTitledName]. The [From.GetManWoman] has been the main source of interest and fascinating rumor since even before [From.GetSheHe] left for [target_title.GetName], but reports all agree that the pomp is well deserved. As [From.Society.GetName] celebrate this warrior's victory, we pray that our young find this living legend an ideal worthy of emulating.
May we all share in [From.GetHerHis] glory.

Having wreaked havoc in the realm of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], the warrior scoundrel [bloodline_founder.GetTitledName] has been carving a name for [bloodline_founder.GetHerselfHimself] in blood. Our records will remember that [bloodline_founder.GetSheHe] and [bloodline_founder.GetHerHis] band of warriors have taken great pleasure in cutting their way through our countryside, fighting any willing man or woman who dared stand in their way, leaving traumatized children and devastated villagers in their wake...
It is the way of barbarians.
died trying to best $KILLER$ in a legendary duel
was slain in a legendary duel
was slain by $KILLER$ in a spectacular duel
was slain in a spectacular duel
slam my [Root.GetDuelWeapon] into [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetBodyPartInjured], soaking [other_combatant.GetHerHim] in [other_combatant.GetHerHis] own blood
slam [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetDuelWeapon] into my [Root.GetBodyPartInjured], soaking me in my own blood
Unlocks the society §YLegend§! progress bar\nAll members of your society will begin to contribute to the §YLegend§! of §Y[Root.Society.GetNameCap]§!
Make it known to all that [Root.Society.GetName] will have bards singing of their deeds for time immemorial.\n
Has NOT been done for one hundred years

Wings brushing my shoulder, dark eyes trusting me. I... I must have been dreaming about hunting with my eagle. "My [Root.GetLordLady]! I tried to stop it, but it just flew in through the [Root.GetChamberOpening]!", an embarrassed servant blurts as I rub my eyes, realizing I can still hear the gentle cawing of a bird.
What do we have here? A new friend?
You will care for the young bird.
You get the feeling that §Y[bloodline_founder.GetTitledFirstName]§! would approve of you caring for the young bird.
Get that thing out of my chambers!

Training with my soldiers, I find myself distracted by an excited barking from the barracks. "What *is* that noise?", I finally demand to know. My sparring partner lowers [Root.GetHerHis] weapon and clears [Root.GetHerHis] throat: "It was going to be a surprise, my [Root.GetLordLady], but we got a new puppy..."
I... I *have* been missing a companion...
You will care for the dog.
You get the feeling that §Y[bloodline_founder.GetTitledFirstName]§! would approve of you caring for the dog.
Do I look like I have time to raise another dog? Come on, raise your weapon!
Someone else will care for the animal.

From playing its favorite games in the [Root.GetCapitalHolding], to warming my feet in the winter, my trusted war hound has taken its last breaths. "I will... Leave you alone with [Root.GetDogName], [Root.GetMasterMistress]" a servant says, wiping a tear from her face.
It was an honor to serve with you, friend.
Perhaps you will get a new dog. One day.
Characters have an easier time joining §GWarrior Lodges§!
Characters tend to keep hunting birds.
Characters tend to keep hunting dogs.
Characters tend to have their Councilors be §YLoyal§!.
Characters have §YSmiths§! strive to please them.
Unlocks special actions on the battlefield.
The §YPromote Commander§! decision attracts better commanders.
Increases the chance of capturing enemy Commanders.
Increases the chance of looting §YArtifacts§!, after sieging enemy Holdings.
Becomes known as the founder of a §YBloodline§!
This character is famous for their combat prowess and warrior's blood they carry in their veins. Their presence alone has people swooning.

[This.GetTitledFirstName] traveled far into foreign lands, fighting [This.GetHerHis] way through the best warriors of [This.GetHerHis] time. The [This.Founder.GetComplimentAdjective] [This.Founder.GetManWoman] was rumored to have a supernatural affinity with birds.

A highly respected [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole] within [This.Founder.GetHerHis] society, this [This.Founder.GetComplimentAdjective] [This.Founder.GetManWoman] was rumored to often have been charging into battle surrounded by war hounds.

A particularly resilient [This.Founder.GetManWoman], [This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] proved [This.Founder.GetHerselfHimself] one of the finest [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole]s of [This.Founder.GetHerHis] time.

Known as a great [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole] and leader of others, [This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] accumulated enthusiastic support during [This.Founder.GetHerHis] legendary raids into foreign lands.

This [This.Founder.GetComplimentAdjective] [This.Founder.GetEducationRole] made a name for [This.Founder.GetHerselfHimself] fighting for [This.Founder.Society.GetName] and spreading the way of the [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole] to all who would dare challenge [This.Founder.GetHerHim].

Always ready for battle, [This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] became famous for [This.Founder.GetHerHis] many victories, and being the finest [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole] [This.Founder.Society.GetName] had ever seen.

Rumored to often have gone singing into battle, [This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] was a [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole] of a different time, [This.Founder.GetHerHis] deeds inspiring greatness in others for generations to come.

[This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] was known as the [This.Founder.GetComplimentAdjective] leader of [This.Founder.Society.GetName] – the mention of [This.Founder.GetHerHis] courage still lights a fire in many [This.Founder.Culture.GetName] soldiers.

[This.Founder.GetFirstName] was both feared and respected, not only for [This.Founder.GetHerHis] combat prowess, but for [This.Founder.GetHerHis] relentless courage. For years to come, [This.Founder.GetHerHisCap] name alone held power over [This.Founder.GetHerHis] enemies.

[This.Founder.GetFirstNameWithNick] was well respected within [This.Founder.Society.GetName], known for [This.Founder.GetHerHis] strategy and skill in battle, inspiring other [This.Founder.GetWarriorRole]s for years to come.

My [Root.GetLordLady]!, the [Root.GetWarriorRole] struggling next to me shouts. "We have to do something about these [enemy_liege.Culture.GetName] soldiers! They are gaining on us!".\n"What do you expect me to do?" I shout back over the turmoil of battle.
Clang your swords together! To the rhythm of BLOOD!
This character is known to inspire [Root.GetHerHis] companions on the battlefield, singing songs of triumph even before the battle is won.
This character is known to intimidate [Root.GetHerHis] enemies from a distance, rhythmically chanting threats of destruction upon entering a battle.
I must survive, so I can compose a ballad of my trials!
Let me sing you the one about the idiot [enemy_liege.Culture.GetName]...!
Ooh, insults? I know a song, mocking [enemy_liege.GetTitledFirstName].
Through clenched jaws, you begin humming a familiar tune, throwing your enemy off completely...!\n
Hah! I will try to remember that one, for my next battle chant!
You run away, abandoning your fellow soldiers, and leaving behind a confused enemy.\n
*gulp* Wait! Have you heard the one about the [enemy_liege.Culture.GetName] [enemy_liege.GetRegionalSmallGameAnimal]?
You attempt to talk your way out the situation. It is not entirely successful.\n
Come to hear me sing, have you?
You begin shouting a hymn of battle, the soldiers next to picking up the tune, just as you practiced...!\n
This option is available because of your §YBloodline§!
Is part of a §YLegendary Bloodline§! favored by §YWarrior Lodges§!
Characters are NOT busy, or fighting a war

The Wolf Warriors consist of ferocious men and women fighting for honor and recognition on the battlefield, as well as an ideal of bravery and companionship. In honor of [norse_pagan.GetHighGodName], they wear their pelts into battle, and favor the spear.

The Eagle Hearts carry on the ancient tradition of training and hunting with birds, the most prestigious type being the golden eagle. The hunters, also known as 'berkutchi', are said to only need three things in life: a fast horse, a faithful dog, and an eagle.

Hunters and warriors alike look to [baltic_pagan.GetHighGodName], as the guardian of the woods. Most fighters wear animal pelts for its connection to the wilderness, and they worship trees, as the roots are seen as connected to [baltic_pagan.GetHighGodName]. At the end of the day,the Forest Walkers have but one calling: to protect the forest, the ancestral home and legacy of their ancestors.

The [finnish_pagan.GetName] do not even utter the name of the sacred animal, but draw strength from worshiping the bear, calling it 'the King and Queen of the Forest'. After hunting one, a complex ritual must take place, wherein the bear is convinced that it was not slain, but died due to fault of its own, so that its hunters may don themselves in its fur.

The members of the Silver Arrowheads worship the thundering skies, and strive to uphold an ideal of honor, guarding their fellow men and women from wrongdoing. Their families are known to hang protective symbols of arrows and bolts by their houses, to grant their heroes luck on the battlefield and shield them from storms.

Occasionally spotted leaving offerings in the water, the Rain Runners fight and train in the name of [west_african_pagan.GetHighGodName]. When charging into battle, they wear blue and are known to carry small fetish symbols close to their heart.

The Zun always watching, the Keepers of the Flame vow to be a strong as their scorching god in the sky. Spending long hours training and practicing with each other, clad in the colors of flame, they are known for their cool determination on the battlefield.

The sun always watching, the Fire Dancers vow to be a strong as the scorching being in the sky. Spending long hours training and practicing with each other, they are often clad in the colors of flame. Many admire their usage of fire, during their ceremonial fights.

The Sentinels are the boon of a society of warrior clans surrounding the many Bön monasteries. Possessing a discipline as harsh as the environment of the mountainous plateau they inhabit, these fighters are from a superstitious community and will always make certain to perform the appropriate rites and sacrifices, before each battle.

The Light Keepers are the boon of a society of warrior clans surrounding the many [bon.GetName] monasteries. Possessing a discipline as harsh as the environment they inhabit, these fighters are from a superstitious community and will always make certain to perform the appropriate rites and sacrifices, before each battle.

The Mountain Guardians train hard and maintain an expert physique, not only for the purpose of battle, but for games of sport – participating is prestigious, and the most skillful of their community are adored by everyone, commoner and noble alike.
A commander named §Y[invited_character.GetBestName]§! joins your court, ready for service.
Members of warrior lodges often spar with one another, for practice and recreation. It is not a duty one neglects without the notice of one's peers...
To complete this mission you need to §Gright-click§! on the portrait of your target and choose to §YDuel§! them. The winner will receive the most §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!.
It is important to occasionally test one's mettle and prove oneself as a warrior. A straight-forward way is to seek out enemies and deal with them, personally...

To complete this mission you need to §Gright-click§! on the portrait of your target and choose to §YDuel§! them. The winner will receive the most §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!, while losing and still breathing will mean losing §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!...
A warrior cannot afford to grow idle, in the comfort of their home! Spreading one's name, as well as domain, is a clear path to glory.

To complete this mission you need to §Gright-click§! on the portrait of the top holder of your target province and choose to §YDeclare War§!, using §YConquest of [From.Location.GetName]§!. The outcome of the war will affect the §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§! gained.

[hero_character.GetTitledName] of [hero_character.Society.GetName] eyes me up and down, first skeptically, but then [hero_character.GetHerHis] posture relaxes. "Say, my [Root.GetLordLady]... Are you related to [founder_target.GetTitledFirstName]?". I nod, smiling. "That [founder_target.GetManWoman] is a legend!" [hero_character.GetSheHe] laughs. "I look forward to seeing you in action", [hero_character.GetSheHe] adds, squeezing my shoulder.
Legendary or not, I'm itching for a duel, my [hero_character.GetLordLady].

[From.GetTitledName] has volunteered as my opponent. I am uncertain what [From.GetSheHe] thinks of my lineage, and judging from the whispers surrounding us as we shake hands, so is [From.GetSheHe]... "Best of luck to you both!" [hero_character.GetBestName] says, shooting [From.GetFirstName] a reassuring glance. I let go of [From.GetManWoman]'s grip, noticing the sweat of [From.GetHerHis] hand.
