The Prestige is distributed based on participation when the Crusade succeeds.
The top two participants will receive two artifacts each. The remaining artifacts are then handed out in participation order to the remaining participants.
The Crusade War Chest for $TYPE|Y$ changes by $AMOUNT|+0$
Distribute $FRACTION|%Y0$ of the Crusade War Chest to $TARGET|Y$
Distribute $FRACTION|%Y0$ of the Crusade $TYPE|Y$ War Chest to $TARGET|Y$
Distribute $FRACTION|%Y0$ of the Crusade War Chest
Distribute $FRACTION|%Y0$ of the Crusade $TYPE|Y$ War Chest
The $DYNASTY|Y$ Dynasty gets $MODIFIER|Y$, giving the following effects:\n$EFFECT$
$MODIFIER|Y$ will be removed from the $DYNASTY|Y$ Dynasty
Does NOT have the Dynasty Modifier $MODIFIER|Y$
This Dynasty provides its members with the Modifiers below.
Is NOT targeted by a Crusade
Religion is targeted by a Crusade
Religion is NOT targeted by a Crusade
Has pledged to defend against the Crusade
Has NOT pledged to defend against the Crusade
Strength of the Crusaders is $COMPARISON|Y$ $VALUE|Y%$ of the defenders
Strength of the defenders is $COMPARISON|Y$ $VALUE|Y%$ of the Crusaders
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! pledges [Root.GetHerHis] troops in defense against the Crusade.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! retracts [Root.GetHerHis] pledge to defend against the Crusade.

Pledging my support against the Crusade shows the whole world that the power of our faith is not to be taken lightly. Assuming the infidels go through with their foolish Crusade, I will defend the target.
I will remove my pledge to defend against the Crusade. Without my help, our faith might suffer a significant blow.
A Crusade is targeting our religion. We should consider how to best defend against it.
This Player will now control $WHO|Y$ instead

Decide what should happen if the Crusade is won and we are the biggest contributor to its success. Should we comply with the Papal suggestion, give the kingdom to our beneficiary, or claim it for ourselves?
§Y[Recipient.GetTitledName]§! accepted the offer to make §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetTitledName]§! the [ThirdPartyCharacter.GetConsortSex] of §Y[Actor.GetTitledName]§!.
§Y[Recipient.GetTitledName]§! refused the offer to make §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetTitledName]§! the [Actor.GetOppositeConsortSex] of §Y[Actor.GetTitledName]§!.

\n\nThe grace and beauty of §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetBestName]§! is known throughout the lands. We propose to grant [ThirdPartyCharacter.GetHerHim] the honor of becoming my [ThirdPartyCharacter.GetConsortSex].
Select a person from the court of §Y[Recipient.GetTitledName]§! to take as your [Actor.GetOppositeConsortSex].
§Y[Actor.GetBestName]§! would gain §G$PRESTIGE$§! prestige from taking a [Actor.GetOppositeConsortSex] as noble as §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetBestName]§!.
[Actor.GetOppositeConsortSexCap]s enjoy no special rights and can simply be set aside when no longer pleasing.
[Actor.GetBestName] has set you aside. You are no longer their [Actor.GetOppositeConsortSex]!

You can have up to three [Actor.GetOppositeConsortSex]s in addition to your spouse. [Actor.GetOppositeConsortSexCap]s are not truly married, but pregnancies involving them will result in legitimate children. Someone who is the prisoner of a ruler can be forced to become their [Actor.GetOppositeConsortSex], even if they are already married.
Not allowed to play §YBön§! characters without the Old Gods DLC, the Holy Fury DLC, or the Jade Dragon DLC!
§Y$PLAYER$§! not allowed to play §YBön§! characters without the Old Gods DLC, the Holy Fury DLC, or the Jade Dragon DLC!
Not allowed to play §YPagan§! without The Old Gods DLC or the Holy Fury DLC!
§Y$PLAYER$§! not allowed to play §YPagan§! without The Old Gods DLC or the Holy Fury DLC
Not allowed to play §YZoroastrian§! without The Old Gods DLC!
§Y$PLAYER$§! not allowed to play §YZoroastrian§! without The Old Gods DLC
The §YBön§! religion is not playable without The Old Gods DLC, the Holy Fury DLC, or the Jade Dragon DLC
Pagans are not playable without The Old Gods DLC or the Holy Fury DLC
Zoroastrians are not playable without The Old Gods DLC
§RCan't make someone below Count level antipope§!
§RNearby [Recipient.Religion.GetName] rulers are likely to ask to join [Recipient.GetTitledName] in defense of their religious head.§!
The Religion's adherents might now come to the defense of their religious head when people of a different religion declare war on them
The Religion's adherents will no longer come to the defense of their religious head when people of a different religion declare war on them
Change the name of the artifact §Y'[From.GetName]'§! to whatever you desire.
Change the name of this character to whatever you desire.\nFor as long as they are located within your subrealm, underage kinsmen can be renamed at any point before they reach the age of 11.
$RULER|Y$ is personally leading this unit, providing the following effects:

§YLeading Armies§!
You are allowed to lead armies.
Personally leading one of your own armies would give it a §YMorale§! boost.
§GClick to recall and forbid yourself from leading armies.§!

§YLeading Armies§!
You are currently forbidden from leading armies.
Personally leading one of your own armies would give it a §YMorale§! boost.
§GClick to allow yourself to lead armies.§!
$WHO|Y$ is responsible for the death of $COUNT|Y$ person.
$WHO|Y$ is responsible for the deaths of $COUNT|Y$ people.
Land path to $TO|Y$ does NOT exist

In the same screen, you can also see your Attributes and Traits, which represent your skills and personality.\n\nCharacters can also have an Ambition, which represents their current short term goal. Whenever an Ambition is fulfilled the character will get a reward, such as a Prestige or Piety bonus. Click on the 'Choose an Ambition'-button, look at your Ambitions and choose one.
Plot is revealed and I will stop spying on §Y[target_spy_on.GetTitledName]§!

The [From.Religion.GetCrusadeName] for [Root.GetBaseName] against [New.GetTitledName] has resulted in [New.GetTitledName] converting, and becoming a faithful [From.Religion.GetGroupName]. [From.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] will surely be pleased!

Whispers in the East claim that [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName] is in a joyous mood as the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] claimant, [invasion_of_china_claimant.GetBestName], has died.\n[invasion_of_china_claimant.GetHerHisCap] death has shattered the morale of the [From.Culture.GetName] forces who now retreat back to their homes in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].\nJust like [invasion_of_china_claimant.GetBestName] this invasion of [offmap_china.GetShortName] has come to an end.
Not only have I lost [invasion_of_china_claimant.GetFirstName], but also this war!

[papal_attacker.GetTitledName] has declared a war on [From.GetTitledName]. Proclaiming the Pope a traitorous impious leader of the [papal_attacker.Religion.GetName]s, [papal_attacker.GetTitledName] want to return the Holy See back to its roots, to once more be led by a true [From.Religion.GetGroupName].\n\n[papal_attacker.GetSheHeCap] is leading [papal_attacker.GetHerHis] men from [papal_attacker.Capital.GetName] to [From.Capital.GetName], to depose the impious [From.GetTitledName] and turning the bishopric of Rome over to someone more fit to rule. With the war for who will rule over the [From.Religion.GetName]s at hand, every man, woman and child need to find out which side they will support.
I have more important matters to attend to.
We will protect our faith from the unjust!
I hope [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] will take the right side.

After the whole [ThePope.Religion.GetName] world has been through the turmoil of the fighting between the two sides, the Pope finally surrenders to [From.GetTitledName].

With the rise of the new [ThePope.GetTitledName], the church move past this dark chapter of its history and can once more become the beating religious heart of the [ThePope.Religion.GetGroupName] world.

[From.GetTitledName] and all those who joined [From.GetHerHim] in the fight against the old Pope are personally thanked by [ThePope.GetTitledName] for defending the faith.
But I preferred the old Pope...

After the whole [ThePope.Religion.GetName] world has been through the turmoil of the fighting between the two sides, [From.GetTitledName] finally surrenders to [ThePope.GetTitledName].

With the fall of the coalition who fought to restore the Holy See to its former glory, there is nothing that stands in the way of the continued impious attitude of [ThePope.GetTitledName].

[ThePope.GetTitledName] happily celebrates this victory over [ThePope.GetHerHis] opponents, and excommunicates all of them. The rest of the world is watching in horror, as the farce continues.
We will overthrow this fake Pope!
Maybe I should be more like [saint_person.GetTitledName]?

The last days have been filled with arguments back and forth. No matter what I try to tell [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetFirstName], it always ends up leading into another conflict.\n\nI wake up to my men searching all of [Root.Capital.GetName] for [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetHerHim]. It seems [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetSheHe] has left in the middle of the night, and fled the city. Though we surely have had our disagreements, I did not expect [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetHerHim] to simply run away.
Maybe I should not have said all those things...

I am strolling through the streets of [Root.Capital.GetName] when I notice the throngs of people rushing down to the harbor. Somewhat curious what might have happened, I tell my retainers we will make our way down there as well.

A grand ship unlike any I have ever seen is docked by the port, several [From.Culture.GetGroupName] flags hanging from the masts. I can see several guards rushing about the deck, as they are helping someone off the boat. As the [Root.GetTitle] of [Root.Capital.GetName], it is only right that I am the one to greet them.

An impressive looking [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetTitle] makes [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetHerHis] way off the ship, instantly locking eyes with me. With a smile, [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetSheHe] takes my hand and says "My [Root.GetLordLady], I need your help."

It has been some time since [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetTitledName] came to my court, and it has certainly been quite the experience having [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetHerHim] around. However, today [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetSheHe] came to talk to me about putting [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetHerHim] on the throne of Byzantium.\n\n"My dear [Root.GetLordLady], I know you have had your disagreements with the Empire. And of course, you would be well paid..." [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetSheHeCap] tells me. With some of the money I would receive from [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetTitledName], I could join the ongoing preparations for the Crusade and convince the other members to make this part of our goal.
Let us toast for this deal, my dear friend.
I rather not agitate the Empire.

In a passionate speech [From.GetTitledName] explains how all of us must gather our men to support [fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetTitledName] for the throne of [e_byzantium.GetName]. The Emperors of [e_byzantium.GetName] have for a long time looked down upon the rest of us, pretending to be the descendants of the Romans. Now it is time to show them that we can overthrow the false Emperor in their midst as well.\n\nWith the gifts sent by [From.GetTitledName], [From.GetSheHe] has managed to convince the rest of the [From.Religion.GetName] realm to target Constantinople as part of the next Crusade.
The next §YCrusade§! will be waged against §Y[fourth_crusade_byzantine_emperor.GetTitledName]§!, to raise §Y[fourth_crusade_byzantine_refugee.GetTitledName]§! to the throne.

It seems that interest for the Crusade towards Constantinople has become somewhat less interesting in most people's eyes, even going so far as to consider abandoning it. Maybe I should revitalize their interest?
Yes, I promised I would help after all.
I guess it just was not meant to be.
I will crush you, insolent traitors!
Hah! Let the wild dogs fight!

Once more [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has been at the forefront of the Crusade, single handedly bringing victory to the faith. Known throughout all the [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] world as one of the most loyal and fierce [Root.Religion.GetName] there is, [Root.GetSheHe] is revered wherever [Root.GetSheHe] goes.\n\nRespect is showered upon [Root.GetTitledName] and [Root.GetHerHis] family, the legends and tales of their deeds will be brought down in history as the deciding factor of the [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] victory in the face of adversity. There is no doubt the members of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty will continue bringing the lost lands into the fold of the faith, and continue to be at the vanguard of the Crusades.

Forward! I shout as I cut down another of the men charging at me. "For [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]! To victory!"
At some point all my men seem to be pushed away, and I grit my teeth for the onslaught of incoming enemies. I can see their commander through the battle, sitting back on a horse with a grin on his face. If I am going down, I am bringing him with me. One cut follow another, and I see his grin slowly fade to a grimace as he tries to back out of the fight he is slowly being pulled into.

I look down upon the dead commander and his retinue as the rest of the battle is settling down. "My [Root.GetLordLady], are you all right?" One of my guards comes running over, looking across my bloodied body.
I am... More than all right.

[From.GetTitledName] has started planning a campaign against the pagans of the north. For too long, the pagans have been steadfast in their fights against the [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s, and [From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to convert them with the sword.

The wild people of the north have started gathering in response, bellowing their battle hymns and demonic rituals, unstoppable in their frenzy. Surely, this will lead to a bloodbath on both sides, as neither will let the other be.

With a final blessing from [From.RelHead.GetTitledName], the armies of the Teutons leave the south for good.
Maybe I could ask the §Y[d_teutonic_order.GetName]§! for help with my pagan neighbors?
What will they think of next?
Let them come, and be slaughtered.

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]

[northern_crusade_potential_target.GetTitledName] is a dangerous force to be reckoned with, and I agree with your assessment that [northern_crusade_potential_target.GetSheHe] needs to be dealt with. My troops are ready to march towards the [northern_crusade_kingdom_title.GetAdjective] lands.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Wait, I need to reconsider this.

[Root.GetTitledName]

We are ready to march our troops against [northern_crusade_potential_target.GetTitledName], but we will need monetary support for the campaign.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Wait, I need to reconsider this.

[Root.GetTitledName]

I agree [northern_crusade_potential_target.GetTitledName] is a dangerous foe, and we would need a base for our campaigns against the [northern_crusade_kingdom_title.GetAdjective] lands.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName].
Wait, I need to reconsider this.

The Teutonics march towards [northern_crusade_kingdom_title.GetAdjective] lands, to secure it for Christianity. The pagans have had too long to convert peacefully, now they will be taken by the sword.

Their first goal is to take out [northern_crusade_target_character.GetTitledFirstName], the warlord of [northern_crusade_target_character.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName]. If they secure [northern_crusade_target_character.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName], they will use it as a base to quell the rest of the [northern_crusade_kingdom_title.GetAdjective] lands.

The blood of the pagans will flow through the rivers of the north, no mercy will be shown.
What will the [From.Religion.GetName]s think of next?

The city of Antioch was originally raised by Seleucus in Alexander's time, and was under [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] control for centuries before the infidel onslaught took control of it. Finally, you have restored the ancient city to its true glory.\n\nWith Antioch back in Christian hands, it is only a matter of time before all of ancient Christendom will be returned. The rest of the world is watching, as I am the forerunner of what is to come.
Watch as I take the Holy Land back.

The island of Cyprus stands at the precipice of the Holy Land, and with its return to the fold of Christianity, the path to the Holy City has once more opened.

I have raised the new banner of Cyprus for the first time, and I look east to the lands of Jerusalem and Antioch. For too long, those lands were controlled by the enemies of the cross, but no more.

This is just the first of many victories. Everything will return to [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] hands.
We will retake the Holy Land, one piece at a time.

For a long time the city of [Root.Capital.GetName] has flourished. Our grasp reaches across the Mediterranean, our traders rich and powerful in their roles.

The Feudal rulers of Europe has looked down upon us for centuries, but it is finally coming to an end as our potential for greatness is undisputed. The time of the old nobility is about to pass, and the mercantile era is beginning with the rise of our merchant class.

Watch, my friends, my rivals, my countrymen, as I show the world the true strength of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

The [From.GetDukeDuchessCap] [From.GetFirstName] of [d_osterreich.GetName] has started calling [From.GetHerselfHimself] the [From.GetArchdukeArchduchessCap] of [k_austria.GetName], and over time it has become normal to accept [From.GetHerHis] superiority over the other princes and princesses of the Empire. In a grand ceremony in [From.Capital.GetName], the title has finally become official.\n\nAs one of the prime electors of the Empire, [From.GetTitledName] has proved [From.GetHerHis] superiority beyond a shadow of a doubt. The other lords and ladies of the Empire have grudgingly accepted it, looking towards [From.Capital.GetName] in envy. They will look for any opportunity to take [From.GetHerHim] down and raise their own positions.

The [From.GetDukeDuchessCap] [From.GetFirstName] of [d_osterreich.GetName] has started calling [From.GetHerselfHimself] the [From.GetArchdukeArchduchessCap] of [k_austria.GetName], and over time it has become normal to accept [From.GetHerHis] superiority over the other princes and princesses of the Empire. In a grand ceremony in [From.Capital.GetName], the title has finally become official.\n\nAs one of the prime [From.GetLadiesLords] of the Empire, [From.GetTitledName] has proved [From.GetHerHis] superiority beyond a shadow of a doubt. The other inferior members of the Empire have grudgingly accepted it, looking towards [From.Capital.GetName] in envy. They will look for any opportunity to take [From.GetHerHim] down and raise their own positions.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has gathered all the [k_bavaria.GetAdjective] and [k_carinthia.GetAdjective] lands in under [From.GetHerHis] rule, and has raised the banner of a new Kingdom of [k_eastern_marches.GetName] to celebrate [From.GetHerHis] victories. This new Kingdom has become the new defacto leader of all the old eastern marches of the Empire.\n\nThis new Kingdom in the Empire is expected to be a power to be reckoned with. The old lands of [k_bavaria.GetName] and [k_carinthia.GetName] were well known for their strength and fortitude, and it is expected the new Kingdom will be all that and more.
An impressive feat, to be sure.

Once more the grand Byzantine banners of Constantinople have been raised. [From.GetDynName] has restored the old crown lands of Byzantium, and the Greek Empire rises from the ashes of defeat, to conquer its old enemies in both the east and the west.

The Eastern Roman Empire suffered defeat after defeat, finally falling to the throng of hostile states at its borders. But like the Rome of old, its enemies could not keep it from growing in power and becoming a relevant actor once more.

The Byzantine Empire is one and indivisible, all hail [From.GetTitledName].
I will serve the true leader of Rome!
Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.

Great [Root.GetTitledFirstName]!
It feels me with hope and dedication towards the future, to once more see the Byzantine banners raised. If it would please you, I would do my utmost to serve you in these challenging times to come.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledFirstName]
I need to decide where to situate my new Kingdom. The old eastern margravates were all well known and powerful, and my decision will set certain expectations of what to come.
[c_osterreich.GetName] and the old margravate of Austria.
[d_styria.GetName] is well known for its strength.
[k_bavaria.GetName] has always been the center of this region.
[k_carinthia.GetName] has a long fruitful history behind its name.
An End to the Muslim Caliphates

Since the rise of the Prophet in Arabia, the Muslim faith has been a strong independent actor throughout the lands. [From.GetTitledFirstName] put an end to that, and the Muslim faith has been shattered by the latest advances of the [From.Religion.GetName]s.\n\nIn a grand announcement in front of [From.GetHerHis] castle in [From.Capital.GetName], [From.GetTitledFirstName] declared all the infidel faiths dead, and that all the previous believers would be given a choice to convert to the true faith, or fear the [From.Religion.GetName] faith as it would crush them as it did the Muslims. Nowhere is safe from the Crusaders of [e_outremer.GetName].
We have to beware the Christians...

The [d_knights_calatrava.GetName] is the most recent addition to the soldiers of the Cross, founded by the magnanimous [From.GetTitledName]. Working out of the old Moslem castle in Calatrava, they will be one of the vanguards against the dangers to the faith, and make sure the Iberian peninsula never again fall to heathens and infidels.\n\nThough they are willing to follow the orders of [From.GetTitledName] for now, their loyalty lies with [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] first and foremost.
May their battles end in victory!

This chivalric order owes its name to Santiago Matomoros, the legendary Saint appearing at the battle of Clavijo to help the [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s against the Moslem infidels. The [d_knights_santiago.GetName] was formed by the benevolent [From.GetTitledName] in [From.GetHerHis] bountiful wisdom, and all its members have vowed to protect the pilgrims traveling the Way of Saint James.\n\nBlessed and sponsored by the [From.Religion.GetName] church itself, they will fight at the forefront of the struggles to keep Iberia [From.Religion.GetGroupName].

The Order of the Brothers of the German House of Saint Mary in Jerusalem has been formed, sponsored by the [From.Religion.GetName] church and [From.GetTitledName]. The Teutonic Order primarily protect and care for pilgrims to the Holy Land, but will serve [From.Religion.GetName] rulers willing to pay for their upkeep.\n\nThough they only fight to protect the pilgrims for now, there is already ambitious murmurs in the order about what the future might bring.
The infidels come in many flavors.

A messenger approaches us with a letter from the Vatican, from the Vicar of Christ [From.GetHerselfHimself]. [From.GetSheHeCap] is asking us to prepare our men to fight against the heathens and infidels, to restore Christendom to the lost places of the world. 

The Pope wants to send our faithful [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] men against [crusade_title.GetBaseName]. The region is held by [crusade_character.GetCrusadeReligionDescription] [crusade_character.GetTitledName], and it is time to return it to Christianity once more.

Though the Pope wants to invade [crusade_title.GetBaseName], a pious [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] could convince everyone to focus on another objective that is of more value to us.
I should consider preparing my men.
The preparations for the next Crusade begins.

In a grand announcement the Pope declares [crusade_title.GetCrusadeLaunchAnother]Crusade for [crusade_title.GetBaseName]. [Root.GetCrusadeLaunchFirstPart]

[Root.GetCrusadeLaunchSecondPart]

[From.Religion.GetHighGodName] will grant remission of sin to everyone partaking in the righteous war.

The announcement about the grand Crusade was sent to every [From.Religion.GetName] realm, but apparently to no avail. The Pope has been trying to gather up support for the Crusade for months, but now the Vatican has gone quiet, as the Vicar of Christ has given up on his Crusade.\n\nThe [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s seem more interested with infighting than fighting the heathens or infidels outside their own borders. The Crusade was officially canceled, as the Pope held a large announcement denouncing the [From.Religion.GetGroupName] Lords and Ladies for their ineptitude in the matters of Faith. Now it is only a matter of time until [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] forsakes his faithless followers, and leaves them to be conquered by the sacrilegious infidels, blasphemers and heathens.
A terrible day for all of us.

Dear [Root.GetTitledName]
It has come to my attention you have not yet put on the cross. I have decided that it is time for you to pay back the favor you owe me, and be part of this endeavor.
Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
I guess I will go then...

[pleased_courtier.GetFirstName] approaches me as I am on my way out, to tell me how happy [pleased_courtier.GetSheHe] was to hear I had pledged my men to the Crusade, and wish me luck in the upcoming war.

I receive a letter from [pleased_participant.GetTitledName], with a well detailed approval of my decision to join the upcoming Crusade. Maybe this is a chance to get closer as we fight the the heathens together?
Let us fight the heathens together!

I receive a letter from the despicable [pleased_participant.GetTitledName]. As we are both going to participate in the upcoming Crusade for [crusade_title.GetName], [pleased_participant.GetSheHe] wants us to make amends and move on from our disagreements.
Maybe it is for the better.

I have been unable to stop myself from being somewhat excited at the prospect of the driving away the infidels from [crusade_title.GetName], and restoring peace to those lands. I have not usually felt this inspired as a [Root.Religion.GetGroupName], but maybe I am changing?

Knowing I will be gone for a while, I decide to spend a day with the local sea creature while I still can. It comes up with some great battle plans I can use in the upcoming wars for [crusade_title.GetName]. I am blessed to have such a good friend.

I drop by the local forest, to spend some hours with the beasts and fauna before I leave home. I end up having a fruitful discussion with, well, I am not entirely sure what it is, but the conversation was enlightening!
I am inspired to do my utmost.
An eye for your wisdom, you say?
We will see each other again!

[displeased_courtier.GetFirstName] explains to me in great detail exactly how disappointed [displeased_courtier.GetSheHe] is in my decision to leave the Crusade. After the long tirade [displeased_courtier.GetSheHe] finally leaves the room, and I get some time for myself.
Maybe it wasn't the right decision after all.

I received a letter from the esteemed [displeased_participant.GetTitledName]. It seems [displeased_participant.GetSheHe] is displeased in my decision to revoke the pledge I made to the Crusade, and finds me somewhat untrustworthy.

One of my messengers brings me a letter from [displeased_participant.GetTitledName], where [displeased_participant.GetSheHe] declares me an unreliable swine and a traitor to all [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]s.

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]
I have noticed that neither you nor your troops have partaken in the Crusade you pledged to join. I am disgusted that you would dare to lie about something like this, and expect your troops to show up soon.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]
You have already received one warning, and clearly not taken heed. I consider your lack of faith and interest in keeping your promise to be unbecoming of a Christian ruler.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName].

Messengers are sent to every corner of the world, as the Pope furiously excommunicates the despicable and vile [unpledging_actor.GetTitledName]. [unpledging_actor.GetSheHeCap] is expelled from the faith for forsaking [unpledging_actor.GetHerHis] fellow [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]s in their righteous war for [crusade_title.GetName].\n\n[unpledging_actor.GetTitledName] should not be helped, cared for nor forgiven. A traitor to the faith as well as to the cause, the only thing [unpledging_actor.GetSheHe] deserves is to be justifiably overthrown. A true [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] would not betray [unpledging_actor.GetHerHis] allies to fight the heathens alone.

[Root.GetTitledName]
I noticed you still have not pledged to the Cross. As a faithful [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] ruler, I hope and pray that you will reconsider your actions, and join in the righteous war for [crusade_title.GetName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Yes, you are right your Holiness.
Not joining nor supporting the Crusade might have dire consequences.

After the long fought battle for [new_crusader_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName], it has finally been restored to the faith. [new_crusader_king.GetDynName] has stepped up to the throne as the beneficiary of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], becoming the [new_crusader_king.GetKingQueen] of the Crusader State. Surely it will be hard to continue fighting at the fringe of Christendom, but everyone can agree [new_crusader_king.GetTitledFirstName] is the right person for the task.\n\nThe Pope requests that the rest of the [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] world support this new Kingdom as best they can, and not let it once more fall to the infidels and heathens.
If only it could have been me...

[Root.GetTitledName]
I know we have had our differences, but it pleases me to hear you have decided to join our rightful cause. I have made the preparations to recant your excommunication from the church.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

The victories against the infidels were hard-fought, but things have finally settled down and the titles I fought for were given to [beneficiary_check_crusader_beneficiary.GetDynName]. It will surely be difficult to be a part of the new Kingdom, but I wish [beneficiary_check_crusader_beneficiary.GetHerHim] luck in [beneficiary_check_crusader_beneficiary.GetHerHis] future endeavors.\n\nI look back one last time as my men and I leave [beneficiary_check_crusader_beneficiary.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. I wonder what life would have been like if it had been me staying here, rather than [beneficiary_check_crusader_beneficiary.GetDynName].
Maybe in another life, it could have been me.

Greetings, [Root.GetTitledName]

I was informed the heathen Pope have declared a will to bring a Crusade to your doorsteps. As a fellow [From.Religion.GetName], I pledge to stand by your side when the unfaithful come to take your lands.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
How much gold should I donate to the Crusade?
I hope the Pope will appreciate this gesture.
A grand gift befitting my station!
I simply can not afford to donate anything...
I need to make a decision, if I should comply with Papal will, or go my own way when it comes to the distribution of the titles in the case of a victory in the Crusades.
I will let the Pope decide.
If the Crusade is won, the Pope will grant the titles to the §YPapal Crusade Recipient§!. If there is none, it will pass down to the §YBeneficiary§! of the most participating member of the Crusade.
My beneficiary will get the titles.
If the Crusade is won, and I am the most participating member of the war, the Crusade title will be granted to my §YBeneficiary§!.
Why would I give MY titles away?
If the Crusade is won, and I am the most participating member of the war, I will take the titles for myself.
I will stick to my previous decision.
Sadly, my beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! seems to have died, I need to find a new one.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! seems to have gained land, and is no longer an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! seems to have become an heir for a landed title, and is no longer an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! seems to have become a mercenary, and is no longer an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! seems to have joined a holy order, and is no longer an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! is not old enough, and is therefore not an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! is not healthy enough to be an appropriate beneficiary.
My beneficiary §Y[old_crusade_beneficiary.GetDynName]§! have become a [old_crusade_beneficiary.GetAscetic], and is no longer an appropriate beneficiary.

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See no longer supports [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName], but rather [new_crusade_recipient.GetDynName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See can no longer support [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName], as [old_crusade_recipient.GetSheHe] has passed away. The Holy See now support [new_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] to be granted the titles.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See can no longer support [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName], as [old_crusade_recipient.GetSheHe] has passed away. The Holy See now supports [old_crusade_recipient.GetHerHis] heir [new_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the throne.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See has decided to start supporting you as the recipient for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName], after the death of [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See has decided to start supporting you as the recipient for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See no longer supports [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName]. With no fitting ruler, I will let you faithful men and women of the Cross decide who these titles might befit.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write to inform you that the Holy See can no longer support [old_crusade_recipient.GetDynName] for the lands of [current_crusade_target_title.GetName], as [old_crusade_recipient.GetSheHe] has passed away. With no fitting ruler available, I will let you faithful men and women of the Cross decide who will receive these titles.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
I might have someone in mind.
Any pledged participant with the §YPapal Recipient Stance§! will have their stance changed to §YBeneficiary Recipient Stance§!

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]
The Vatican is deeply disappointed in your decision to not join the Crusade. Your lack of faith is shocking, and I thought one could think better of a ruler such as you. 

Signed,
[From.GetTitledFirstName]
I decide what is best for my people, not you.

[From.Religion.GetHighGodName] has granted [new_crusade_most_participating_member.GetTitledName] victory in the Crusade for [new_crusade_title.GetBaseName]. [new_crusade_target_char.GetTitledName] has been beaten at every turn through the war, and [new_crusade_target_char.GetSheHe] has finally had to give up on [new_crusade_target_char.GetHerHis] holdings in [new_crusade_title.GetBaseName].

[Root.GetCrusadeSelfishOrNot]

With the [new_crusade_target_char.Religion.GetGroupName]s being pushed out of their old lands, there are certainly more conflicts to come.

[new_crusade_most_participating_member.GetTitledFirstName] has taken most of the core lands in [new_crusade_title.GetBaseName] for [new_crusade_most_participating_member.GetHerselfHimself], to the annoyance of the other Crusaders. The Pope has made an announcement about the victory and selfishness of [new_crusade_most_participating_member.GetFirstName], talking about the vices and virtues of the faith.

[new_crusade_most_participating_member.GetTitledFirstName] has granted the new lands of [new_crusade_title.GetBaseName] to [crusade_king_recipient.GetDynName]. The Pope has made an announcement about the victory and virtues of the Crusaders, as true faithful protectors of the faith.

My men storm the walls of [From.GetBaseName], and finally take the last proper bastion of [duchy_region.GetBaseName]. If I settled my men around the area they could probably support the ongoing Crusade and help us claim victory, but the Pope will not be pleased if I unrightfully take these lands for myself.
[duchy_region.GetBaseName] sounds like an appropriate part of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
§Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! usurps all the titles in the §YDuchy of [duchy_region.GetBaseName]§!.
§YAll Pledged Crusaders§! opinion of §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! changes by §R-20§! for §Y10§! years. §Y(Self-serving Crusader)
I will find a suitable ruler for this new land.
I have no interest in these lands.

The [From.Religion.GetGroupName] Crusaders have taken [duchy_region.GetBaseName] and settled their soldiers around the area. Though the Crusade for [crusade_title.GetName] is still ongoing, the area around [duchy_region.GetBaseName] is indisputably in the hands of [current_crusade_beneficiary.GetTitledName].\n\nEmboldened and supported by the new [current_crusade_beneficiary.GetLordLady] of [duchy_region.GetBaseName], the Crusaders fight harder than ever to conquer [crusade_title.GetName]. It is only a matter of time before the rest of the [crusade_target_ruler.Religion.GetGroupName] realms will fall.
I wonder what life would have been like in [duchy_region.GetBaseName].

The old title of [old_crusade_title.GetName] has often been considered somewhat illegitimate in the eyes of everyone else. Now that I have acquired a new title it might be time to leave the old title behind, to take on the mantle of a more appropriate legitimate title.
Legitimize [old_crusade_title.GetName] as the new rightful Duchy of the region. This will delegitimize the old Duchy of [duchy_title.GetName].
The title has served us well. Rest, old friend.
Legitimate or not, I will keep the title.

The [From.Religion.GetGroupName] Crusaders have taken [duchy_region.GetBaseName] and settled their soldiers around the area. Though the Crusade is still ongoing, the area around [duchy_region.GetBaseName] is indisputably in the hands of [From.GetTitledName].\n\nDespite the continued support of [From.GetTitledName], [From.GetSheHe] has become somewhat unpopular among the other Crusaders, as [From.GetSheHe] is more interested in taking lands for [From.GetHerselfHimself] than fighting for the faith.
Disappointing that anyone can be so self-serving.

As I pass through [current_location.GetName], I come across [other_crusader.GetTitledName]. [other_crusader.GetSheHeCap] invites me to spend some time in [other_crusader.GetHerHis] camp to get to know one another better, as we are allies in the Crusade for [crusade_title.GetBaseName].
Thank you, I will accept your offer.
I am here to fight the infidels, not to make friends.
The last few days here in [current_location.GetName] has been an interesting experience. The [current_location.Culture.GetName] culture has reminded me of how different these lands are to my home.
I should try to learn as much as I can about these lands while I still can!
I will try to befriend one of the locals.
It looks like an abandoned battlefield, the dead strewn across the landscape. The crusaders certainly met quite the resistance, here in [current_location.GetName].
Maybe I could salvage some valuables?
A local merchant caravan approaches me on its way back home to [current_location.GetName]. One of the peddlers flashes me a huge grin, and ask if I want to take a look at his wares.
Thank you, but I have to be on my way.

When I joined the Crusade for [new_crusade_title.GetBaseName], I never expected the loneliness and longing for home. My men look up to me, so I have to continue the facade that everything is all right, as we move ever closer to our goal.
Maybe I just need to try to relax, and stop overworking myself.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] will guide me through these hardships.
As we settle down for the night in [current_location.GetName], a comet passes overhead. The soldiers start talking excitedly what it might mean.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] guides our hand in this just war!
All right, now get back to work men.
Let us take a moment to thank [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] for this miracle.

A group of Crusaders have beheaded several of the locals in [current_location.GetName], for no other reason than them being [current_location.Religion.GetName]. Was this really why we came to [new_crusade_title.GetBaseName]?

As we pass through [current_location.GetName], we come across a small group of [Root.GetCrusadeReligiousMinorityGroup]. They happily receive us as long lost brothers and sisters, and give us a place to sleep and rest for the night.
Let me help you spread your faith, friends.
Would you like to join my court back in [Root.Capital.GetName]?

I find myself walking through the ancient streets of Rome. Once a part of the Roman Empire, then a part of the Papal States. It used to be the very center of the world, and the core lands of the faith. Now it is not even [Root.Religion.GetName].
You and your men capture the city from the infidels, in an attempt to restore it to the true faith.

Once a bastion of the faith, Antioch has fallen from greatness. I look around the city and see the potential to become a center of the faith once more, it if is led by a true [Root.Religion.GetGroupName].
One day, it will live up to the name Theopolis once more.
We will restore the city of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
You and your men capture the city from the infidels, in an attempt to restore it to the true faith.

Once Saint Paul walked across the shores of Cyprus to spread the faith of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], but now it has been lost to the infidels. If only we could restore it as a place of faith and virtue.
Sadly, the island has been lost...
For the glory of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] we fight!
You and your men capture the city from the infidels, in an attempt to restore it to the true faith.
Jerusalem, the beating heart of the faith, has been filled with infidels. Everywhere I look, I see men and women who are clearly not of the faith. The shame stings me to the very depths of my heart.
You and your men capture the city from the infidels, in an attempt to restore it to the true faith.

The bitter losses in the previous Crusade are still lingering across the Christian lands. The messengers of the Pope have traveled across all the faithful realms of the [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s to spread the Crusader spirit among the people, but the nobility has tired from the previous war.\n\nWith the Pope at the forefront, small revolts have occurred as the people want to reconquer the holy places of the faith, with the lords and ladies somewhat skeptical. It is most likely only a matter of time before a larger conflict between the masses and the nobility will take place.
This is not going to end well...

With a bellowing shout, [shepherds_leader.GetFirstName] launches the Crusade of poor souls from [shepherds_province.GetName]. Men and women from all across the [shepherds_province.Culture.GetName] lands have gathered to witness this momentous event, with not a single lord or lady to lead them, nor to be seen among the populace.

Supposedly guided by the hand of [shepherds_leader.Religion.GetHighGodName], [shepherds_leader.GetSheHe] commands the shepherds, fletchers and blacksmiths apprentices to march towards [kingdom_target.GetBaseName]. It is a long and perilous path, with many challenges waiting for them. Without supply lines nor help from the locals, they are unlikely to ever reach their destination.

Can the miracles of [shepherds_leader.Religion.GetHighGodName] truly save them from the fate everyone expects them to have?

[From.GetFirstName] finally had [From.GetHerHis] people stand down as the losses against [FromFrom.GetTitledName] proved to be too costly. Most of the army were executed right there and then, and [From.GetFirstName] brought back to [FromFrom.Capital.GetName] to show everyone what happens to peasants who try to attack their betters.\n\nAfter all, nobody ever believed the peasants would win against the battle hardened armies of [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

With pitchforks and hammers in hand, the shepherds rush the final bastions of defense in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName]. The skeptics were many, but nobody could make the miraculous group of brave men and women stop their quest for the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] lands.\n\nThe rest of the world looks to the new [From.GetKingQueen] with awe and confusion, as [From.GetDynName] takes the throne for [From.GetHerselfHimself]. Peasant no more, nobody can deny [From.GetHerHis] right to the throne. For who else than [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] could have guided [From.GetTitledFirstName] to victory?

Without the guidance of [From.GetFirstName], the men and women of the aptly named Shepherds' Crusade have started to fall apart. [From.GetHerHisCap] death broke the morale of the peasant army, and they have fled to all the corners of the world.\n\nAfter all, who ever truly believed the peasants could conquer anything on their own?
The massive army of peasants have gathered outside of my doorstep at [current_location.GetName]. Their commander, [shepherds_leader.GetFirstName], is asking me for aid in their Crusade.
They are free to pass through, but do it quickly.
You will ally with the Shepherds' Crusade
I will send you some of my men.
You send some of your soldiers to join §Y[shepherds_leader.GetFirstName]§! in [shepherds_leader.GetHerHis] Crusade

The troublemakers of the peasant Crusade have demanded that I expel all the Jews from the realm. According to their leader, [shepherds_leader.GetFirstName], they are not true believers in [shepherds_leader.Religion.GetHighGodName].

As expected, the rebellious peasants of the Shepherds' Crusade have started causing chaos among the local populace of [current_location.GetName]. My people look to me, to stop these foreign elements intruding upon our lands.
It is probably safer to just let them pass through.
Threading upon my lands is punishable by death.
You will treat §Y[From.GetTitledName]§! and [From.GetHerHis] forces as a hostile entity in your lands.

As the Shepherds' Crusade passes by [current_location.GetName], I see an influx of peasants settle down in the area. It seems some of them reconsider their choices, as the Crusade still has a way to go.
We could always use a helping hand or two.
Deserters have no place in [current_location.GetName], get back to the Crusade!
After publicly declaring the Shepherds' Crusade a heretical group of pillagers, [local_bishop.GetTitledName] was executed at the hands of [From.GetFirstName].
It is time to put an end to them.

The cursed [From.Religion.GetName] peasants have entered [current_location.GetName] and have started causing issues among the people. If this keeps going, it is only a matter of time before chaos will ensue.
It is probably just better to wait for them to leave.
I will fight them off myself!

My dear [Root.GetTitledName]
The knights have been looking for somewhere easily defensible, where we can help guide all [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] souls to the Holy Land. We think your newfound lands in [potential_title.GetBaseName] might be the perfect location, and we would pay you for your troubles.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
I write you this letter to inform you that me and my men have officially left your service. We no longer see you fit to rule, and we have once more returned to the faithful service of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

The magnanimous [From.GetTitledName] has donated the island of [potential_title.GetBaseName] to the Knights of Saint John, better known as the Knights Hospitaller. As one of the long standing protectors of the faith, this will surely make the routes safer for all the pilgrims seeking the Holy Land. The order is now known as the Knights of [potential_title.GetBaseName], and [d_knights_hospitaler.Holder.GetTitledFirstName] vows to continue their mission as the righteous defenders of Christianity and its faithful followers.

[Root.GetTitledName]
We wish to finally root out our ancient enemies in the north, and your newfound lands of [holy_order_potential_title.GetBaseName] would help us greatly in this mission. We would re-compensate you for your troubles, as we would not dare insult one with your status.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
I would be happy to help the [d_teutonic_order.GetName]!
My apologies, but these lands are my own.

Supported by the charitable [From.GetTitledName], the Teutonic Order has settled down in [holy_order_potential_title.GetBaseName]. Dedicated to removing the northern infidels once and for all, [d_teutonic_order.Holder.GetTitledName] has started a massive campaign in order to revitalize [holy_order_potential_title.GetName] and turn it into a staging ground for their future wars.\n\nWorking out of [FromFrom.Capital.GetName], it is only a matter of time before they will conquer the rest of [kingdom_title.GetBaseName]. The heathens look towards the new seat of the Teutonic Order with fear and skepticism, knowing they will have to fight to retain their ungodly ways and traditions.
It is only a matter of time before they will fall.

Is it not every [Root.GetTitle]'s dream to be recognized as the true successor to the Caesars? I can invoke the translatio imperii and have [Root.RelHead.GetBestName] crown me as ruler of a new Roman Empire!

As the [Root.GetDukeDuchessCap] of [d_osterreich.GetName] and [d_styria.GetName], I am clearly of a higher rank than the rest of the uncouth scum of the Empire. It is time for [e_hre.Holder.GetTitledName] to recognize my superiority over the other Princes.
Become the §Y[From.GetArchdukeArchduchessCap] of Austria§!, and bring the core lands of §Y[d_styria.GetName]§! and §Y[d_osterreich.GetName]§! in under your new title
§Y[e_hre.Holder.GetTitledFirstName]§! opinion of §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is greater or equal to §Y50§!
Gather the lands of the Eastern Marches
It is time to gather all the land of the eastern marches into one kingdom.
Decide upon which name your new Kingdom will take.
I will gather the crown lands of Byzantium, and raise the old banners of Rome once more.
Become the Emperor of the §YByzantine Empire§!
Form an Empire of the Outremer
I will not stop until the dream of reconquering everything that was once Christian has been fulfilled. I will make sure the Holy Land stays safe and Christian to the end of times.
Form an Order of pious men to defend Iberia against the infidels in the province of Calatrava.
It is time for the [d_knights_calatrava.GetName] to bow down before me, and become my vassals. They will be valuable assets in keeping Iberia safe.
Form an Order of pious men to defend Iberia against the infidels in the province of Santiago.
It is time for the [d_knights_santiago.GetName] to bow down before me, and become my vassals. They will be valuable assets in keeping Iberia safe.
Form an Order of pious men to defend the routes to [k_jerusalem.GetName].
Militarize the Brotherhood of the Holy Sepulchre
Militarize the Brotherhood of the Holy Sepulchre so they can fight back the encroaching invaders of all the other faiths.
Vassalize the Brotherhood of the Holy Sepulchre
Bring the Brotherhood of the Holy Sepulchre into your realm as a vassal, to once more protect the holy places in Jerusalem.
You can send unlanded courtiers to join §YHoly Orders§!, this will disqualify them from an inheritance.
You can ask the §YTeutonic Order§! to target a local pagan ruler in their northern campaigns.
You can ask the §YTeutonic Order§! to target §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! in their northern campaigns.
[This.GetSheHeCap] single handedly brought victory to the [This.Religion.GetGroupName]s in several Crusades, and there are numerous legends spun in [This.Founder.GetHerHis] honor.
Get a larger share of §GCrusade War Chest§!
[This.GetSheHeCap] is known for personally leading the charge of many battles, and it is said no heathen nor infidel could ever bring [This.GetHerHim] down.
[This.GetSheHeCap] is known as the [This.GetKingQueen] of the first Crusader Kingdom of [This.PrimaryTitle.GetBaseName]. A pious ruler who fought and bled for the faith.
[This.GetSheHeCap] is legendary among the Christians for conquering the Arabian peninsula and destroying the Muslim faiths.
Does not suffer §YLethal Injuries§! in battles
Known for shattering the old Empire of Byzantium, and raising a new Empire from its ashes.
§Y[Actor.GetTitledFirstName]§! requests a change to the destination for the upcoming Crusade, to focus on conquering the lands of §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetTitledFirstName]§!.

It is possible to request a change of objective for the upcoming Crusade. This will become progressively more difficult to achieve, the more times a character asks for a change before a Crusade starts.
A Crusade is in the planning phase
A Crusade is not currently being planned
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] has pledged to join the upcoming Crusade
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] has not pledged to join the upcoming Crusade
The target for the imminent Crusade is locked.
The target for the imminent Crusade can be changed.
There is $COMPARISON|Y$ $VALUE|Y$ days left of the Crusade preparation.
New Crusade target is $WHO|Y$, and the new objective is $TITLE|Y$.
$WHO|Y$ will be your beneficiary for the Crusade.

Pledging my support for the Crusade shows the whole world what a great [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] I am, though it will create the expectation of actually attending the Crusade. Rulers who do not follow through on their promises, or later on removes their pledge to the Crusade, might feel the Pope's wrath.
I will remove my pledge to support the Crusade. The Pope might be furious to hear of my lack of faith, and there might be a price to pay for leaving the Crusade.
A beneficiary is the character assigned to receive all the titles of a Crusade, in the case of a victory.

Every benefactor can choose one beneficiary for the Crusade, to receive the titles gained throughout the war. These are the requirements for a character to be eligible as a beneficiary:§Y
 * [Root.Religion.GetName]
 * Must be of your Dynasty
 * Cannot be Landed
 * Cannot be an Heir to a Title
 * Must be at least 12 Years Old
 * Cannot be a Mercenary
 * Cannot be part of a Holy Order
 * Cannot be a monk or a nun
 * Cannot be seriously ill or injured§!
A pious [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] can spend piety to convince the Pope as well as everyone else, to change the target of the upcoming Crusade.
Can not pledge if you are the Primary Crusade Target
Has NOT recently pledged to join the Crusade [Root.GetCrusadePledgeCD]
- you can remove your pledge after: §Y[This.recently_pledged_to_crusade_cooldown.GetExpiryDate]§!
Has NOT recently removed my pledge to join the Crusade [Root.GetCrusadeUnpledgeCD]
- you can make a new pledge after: §Y[This.recently_unpledged_to_crusade_cooldown.GetExpiryDate]§!
You will now play as §Y[new_crusader_king.GetTitledName]§! instead of §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!
You will now play as §Y[beneficiary_check_crusader_beneficiary.GetTitledName]§! instead of §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!
You will now play as §Y[current_crusade_beneficiary.GetTitledName]§! instead of §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!
The Crusaders will take all the land in the targeted title held by §Y[From.GetTitledName]§!
Cannot unpledge from the Crusade if the Pope forced you to be part of it.
You may give the order to castrate §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§! and turn him into a eunuch. He will be unable to sire more spawn or be granted landed titles, a severe punishment.
No landed character in the realm
There is a well kept Saintly burial site in §Y[Root.GetName]§!
Can ask the Teutonics for help again after §Y[From.northern_crusade_targeted_decision_cooldown.GetExpiryDate]§!
It was once a part of the core [From.Religion.GetGroupName] lands, and lords from all across the world gathers to return it to their rightful hands.

[Root.GetHaruspexName] cuts the prisoner open. While the [potential_victim.GetManWoman]'s heart is immolated, the diviner starts rummaging through [potential_victim.GetHerHis] entrails. The response is quite clear: The gods favor our cause in the war to come! The troops will fight with renewed strength now that they now for sure that our victory has been ordained from the heavens.

[Root.GetHaruspexName] cuts the prisoner open. While the [potential_victim.GetManWoman]'s heart is immolated, the diviner starts rummaging through [potential_victim.GetHerHis] entrails. The signs are not entirely clear, but the diviner assures me that there was no signs of the Fates opposing our war. Our troops will surely be comforted by knowing that the gods are not against them.

[Root.GetHaruspexName] cuts the prisoner open. While the [potential_victim.GetManWoman]'s heart is immolated, the diviner starts rummaging through [potential_victim.GetHerHis] entrails. Unfortunately, the response from the diviner is not as positive as I hoped. There are clear signs that the gods are not in favor of this war. This news will not be good for morale...

[Root.GetHaruspexName] cuts the prisoner open. While the [potential_victim.GetManWoman]'s heart is immolated, the diviner starts rummaging through [potential_victim.GetHerHis] entrails. The response is terrible. Not only are the gods against us in this war but, according to the signs interpreted by the diviner, they seem to be favoring our enemies!
You can order unlanded courtiers to take the vows and join a monastic order of their choice. This will disqualify them from normal inheritance, but they can still be claimants.

As [From.GetFirstName] is dragged away from the main hall yelling and cursing, [From.GetSheHe] swears that [From.GetSheHe] will one day return to enact [From.GetHerHis] vengeance and take what [From.GetSheHe] considers to be [From.GetHerHis] birthright by force.

[From.GetFirstName] is dragged away from the main hall screaming and wailing, claiming that spending the remainder of [From.GetHerHis] life cloistered with peasants is a destiny unfitting for a [From.GetManWoman] of [From.GetHerHis] lineage.

Breaking the news to [From.GetFirstName] is not easy. We have a long fight, exchanging a few harsh words, before [From.GetSheHe] finally understands that there is nothing [From.GetSheHe] can do to change my mind and that [From.GetSheHe] must accept [From.GetHerHis] fate in the monastery.

Breaking the news to [From.GetFirstName] is not easy. [From.GetSheHeCap] wastes a few tears before finally understanding that there is nothing [From.GetSheHe] can do to change my mind and that [From.GetSheHe] must accept [From.GetHerHis] fate in seclusion.

[From.GetFirstName] takes the news of [From.GetHerHis] cloistering fairly well. [From.GetSheHeCap] tells me that [From.GetSheHe] understands my reasons and that, if it is my desire to have [From.GetHerHim] languish the rest of [From.GetHerHis] days in a monastery, [From.GetSheHe] will readily obey.

[From.GetFirstName] takes the news of [From.GetHerHis] cloistering fairly well. [From.GetSheHeCap] tells me that [From.GetSheHe] understands my reasons and that, if it is my desire to have [From.GetHerHim] languish the rest of [From.GetHerHis] days in seclusion, [From.GetSheHe] will readily obey.
This was not an easy choice to make...

Hail, [Root.GetSocietyRank]! 

Rumors are that great spoils are waiting behind the walls of [wl_looting_target.GetName], waiting to be conquered by any daring raider with enough grit and ambition. 
I assume I need say nothing more...

Signed, [From.GetTitledFirstName]

The rumors were true! The hold of [From.GetName] was filled with treasure! Since I was the leader of the assault, I'll take the best share of the loot for myself, but I will not forget to share part of this bountiful prize with my brothers and sisters of [Root.Society.GetName], for informing me of the existence of this treasure.
You must lead your raiders to loot [From.Location.GetName] to prove your worth and gain the riches laying within it.
To complete this mission, personally lead your troops to loot §Y[FromFrom.GetName]§!.

Hail, [Root.GetSocietyRank]! 

It has come to our attention that you are eschewing your duties as a member of [Root.Society.GetName] as of recently. You should be focusing on training and improving your form if you wish to compete with the rest of us. 
I hope I made myself clear.

Signed, [From.GetTitledFirstName]

Hail, [Root.GetSocietyRank]! 

It has come to our attention that you are eschewing your duties as a member of [Root.Society.GetName] as of recently. There is much that a [Root.GetManWoman] can learn by tracking down game in the wilderness.
Do not forget to show me some of your best trophies.

Signed, [From.GetTitledFirstName]

Hail, [Root.GetSocietyRank]! 

While we [From.Society.GetName] always appreciate a good brawl, I think it is important that we always keep in mind what are we fighting for.
You should always keep in mind your responsibilities as a ruler.
You have a duty to lead and protect your subjects.

Signed, [From.GetTitledFirstName]

Hail, [Root.GetSocietyRank]! 

While we [From.Society.GetName] always appreciate a good brawl, you should also understand that there is a time for fighting and a time for enjoying oneself with the company of [From.GetHerHis] brothers and sisters of battle. Would it kill you to organize a feast or two?

Signed, [From.GetTitledFirstName]

As a [Root.GetSocietyRank] of [Root.Society.GetName], it is imperative that I spend enough time on my military training. Only through constant exercise I will be able to become the best warrior in [Root.Capital.GetName].

As a [Root.GetSocietyRank] of [Root.Society.GetName], I must keep my mind sharp and keep refining my natural instincts if I wish to maintain the respect of my fellow warriors. I am looking forward dedicating some time outside of palace, tracking down wild creatures.
What is the point of being a warrior if I have no one to defend? I should not forget what my duties as [Root.GetTitle] are. It is time I focus my energies on ruling my realm.
It is the right thing to do.

It has been a long time since I properly celebrated a great victory, or invited my fellow warriors over for a feast. What is the point of accomplishing such legendary feats if they are not remembered and honored?
The older members of [Root.Society.GetName] are concerned that I might be neglecting my training to focus on other, menial activities.
To complete this mission, select the §YWar Focus§!.
The older members of [Root.Society.GetName] have suggested that I spend some time refining my senses by hunting wild game.
To complete this mission, select the §YHunting Focus§!.
The older members of [Root.Society.GetName] are concerned that I am neglecting my duties as [Root.GetTitle] to focus on other menial activities.
To complete this mission, select the §YRulership Focus§!.
There is a time for fighting and a time for celebrating, and the older members of [Root.Society.GetName] are concerned that I might be neglecting the latter to focus on other, menial activities.
To complete this mission, select the §YCarousing Focus§!.
