My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has been encouraging me for some time now to try and eat more, fearing that my frugal diet might cause me to get seriously sick, and that my frail disposition might reflect badly on our family's prestige.

My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has been encouraging me for some time now to try and eat more, insisting that I need to be sturdier if I wish to deliver strong children, and that my frail disposition might reflect badly on our family's prestige.
My diet is just fine as it is!

My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has been encouraging me for some time now to try and eat less, fearing that immoderation in my diet might cause me to get seriously sick and, more importantly, that it might put a stain on our family's good name.

For some time now my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has been making comments insinuating that I might be gaining too much weight, and that I should exert more moderation, especially during court dinners, as it is unfit for a [Root.GetLordLady] of my stature to be seen eating so much.

My [GetFromRelation] has heeded my call and finally embraced [From.Culture.GetName] customs. I am certain that [From.GetHerHis] new attitude will lead [From.GetHerHim] to treat [From.GetHerHis] subjects with decency and justice, and allow [From.GetHerHim] to teach good morals to [From.GetHerHis] children.
Now we truly look like [GetFromRelation] and [From.GetRootRelation]!

My [GetFromRelation] has stubbornly refused to listen to my advice. [From.GetFirstName] insists that [From.GetSheHe] was born and grown [From.Culture.GetName] and will not abandon the proud and moral traditions of [From.GetHerHis] culture.
How else can I make [From.GetHerHim] understand?

My [GetFromRelation] has taken to heart my advice and sacrificed some of the time [From.GetSheHe] wasted at the altar of vanity to focus on [From.GetHerHis] responsibilities instead. [From.GetFirstName] might not be quite as much the charmer with the ladies at court as [From.GetSheHe] used to be, but it is for [From.GetHerHis] own good.

My [GetFromRelation] has taken to heart my advice and sacrificed some of the time [From.GetSheHe] wasted at the altar of vanity to focus on [From.GetHerHis] responsibilities instead. [From.GetFirstName] might not be quite as much popular with the young lords and bards at the court as [From.GetSheHe] used to be, but it is for [From.GetHerHis] own good.

[From.GetFirstName] and I have never been as close as since I convinced my [GetFromRelation] to forsake empty vanity to focus on more concrete responsibilities. The rest of the court might see us as coarse and uncivilized, but we both know better now.
A sharp mind trumps a pretty face.
Perhaps I was too harsh with [From.GetHerHim]?

My [GetFromRelation] refused to follow my advice and is still spending an undue amount of time grooming [From.GetHerselfHimself] while neglecting some of [From.GetHerHis] responsibilities. I fear that [From.GetSheHe] is too enamored with [From.GetHerHis] own image to see how [From.GetHerHis] behavior is hampering is growth as a [From.GetManWoman].

Following my advice, my [GetFromRelation] has finally started to take better care of [From.GetHerselfHimself] and is slowly learning how to properly act at court. Even I was surprised to see how much more charming [From.GetSheHe] could become just by cleaning [From.GetHerHis] face and speaking more softly.

Following my advice, my [GetFromRelation] has finally started to take better care of [From.GetHerselfHimself] and is slowly learning how to properly act at court. [From.GetFirstName] looks more and more like a proper [From.GetLordLady] with each passing day. Bards might soon start writing songs about [From.GetHerHim].

By following my advice, [From.GetFirstName] has become quite the charmer. Maidens that would not have given [From.GetHerHim] a second look before are now filling the palace with their feverish gossiping about my [GetFromRelation]. I have never felt as proud of [From.GetHerHim] before.

By following my advice, [From.GetFirstName] has become quite the charmer. Young men that would not have given [From.GetHerHim] a second look before are now hopelessly competing for [From.GetHerHis] favor and attention, following my [GetFromRelation] whenever [From.GetSheHe] goes. I have never felt as proud of [From.GetHerHim] before.
You are finally starting to look like a proper [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]!
I hope [From.GetSheHe] does not go too far now...

[From.GetFirstName] refuses to listen to reason. My [GetFromRelation] seems to prefer acting like a wild animal, loud and uncivilized, too absorbed by [From.GetHerHis] own petty interests to understand how [From.GetHerHis] crass demeanor is costing [From.GetHerHim] the respect of [From.GetHerHis] peers and the dignity of [From.GetHerHis] family name.

I am glad to see my [GetFromRelation] has taken my advice to heart and started to eat more. A young, healthy [From.GetManWoman] of [From.GetHerHis] status should work on developing a robust and imposing figure, worthy of fear and respect.

I am glad to see my [GetFromRelation] has taken my advice to heart and started to eat more. A young, healthy [From.GetManWoman] of [From.GetHerHis] status should work on developing a robust frame and birthing hips.

Feeling [From.GetFirstName] encroaching on my place at the dinner table, I stick my elbow in [From.GetHerHis] gut, prompting my [GetFromRelation] to raise [From.GetHerHis] head from the plate. [From.GetSheHeCap] proclaims that there soon will not be enough space for both of us in the hall, at which point we both erupt in a bellowing laughter.

[From.GetFirstName] rests back [From.GetHerHis] head with a sleepy expression, pressing a napkin on [From.GetHerHis] mouth to suppress a belch. I point at the paunch pressing against [From.GetHerHis] dress and comment that, with such commitment to [From.GetHerHis] new diet, my [GetFromRelation] will soon outrank me as the largest member of our family.

Yet again, I meet my [GetFromRelation]'s gaze with scornful disdain across the dinner table, seeing [From.GetHerHim] refuse to finish [From.GetHerHis] first course. [From.GetFirstName] has completely ignored my advice.

My [GetFromRelation] has decided to follow my advice and finally change [From.GetHerHis] dieting practices. [From.GetFirstName] looks much more lean and spry already, as a [From.GetManWoman] of [From.GetHerHis] age should.

My [GetFromRelation] has decided to follow my advice and finally change [From.GetHerHis] dieting practices. [From.GetFirstName] looks much more graceful and delicate already, as a [From.GetManWoman] of [From.GetHerHis] age should.

Ever since [From.GetFirstName] decided to follow my advice, we have spent much more time together, eschewing the crass excesses of evening dinners for relaxing walks outside and quiet contemplation. My [GetFromRelation] has never looked better, having acquired a much more humble and collected figure, not unlike my own.

Ever since [From.GetFirstName] decided to follow my advice, we have spent much more time together, eschewing the crass excesses of evening dinners for relaxing walks outside and quiet contemplation. My [GetFromRelation] has never looked better, having acquired a much more diaphanous and elegant figure, not unlike my own.

Yet again, I meet my [GetFromRelation]'s gaze with scornful disdain across the dinner table, seeing [From.GetHerHim] demand another course for [From.GetHerselfHimself]. [From.GetFirstName] has completely ignored my advice.
This commander is focusing the training of [Root.GetHerHis] soldiers on stealth and espionage, making them more adept at seeping through the defenses of foreign armies.
By refining coordination between [Root.GetHerHis] troops, this commander has reduced the time required to mobilize [Root.GetHerHis] army.
By strengthening of communications and exploration efforts, this commander has increased the autonomy of [Root.GetHerHis] armies while in enemy territory.

I am thoroughly impressed by how seriously my [GetFromRelation] has taken on my advice to be an exemplar spouse. [From.GetFirstName] has acquired a reputation for courtly manners and undying loyalty of the kind that only bards sing about when referring to Princes in fairy tales.

I am thoroughly impressed by how seriously my [GetFromRelation] has taken on my advice to be an exemplar spouse. [From.GetFirstName] has acquired a reputation for unblemished fealty and staunch chastity of the kind that only bards sing about when referring to Princesses in fairy tales.

I am thoroughly impressed by well my talk with my [GetFromRelation] went. [From.GetFirstName] now fully understands the mutual bounds and responsibilities that bind us together, both in marriage and blood, and has taken on a completely new and inspiring attitude when it comes to upholding the sanctity of our union.
We truly are of one mind!
I could not ask for a more virtuous [GetFromRelation]!

The challenges that [This.Founder.GetFullName] overcame on [This.Founder.GetHerHis] rise to power were so great that the very blood that courses through [This.Founder.GetHerHis] veins is considered legendary.
A master with any weapon, [This.Founder.GetFullName] was always the first into war and the last off the battlefield.
[This.Founder.GetFullName] is said to have been one of the most beautiful [This.Founder.GetMenWomen] to ever live, not to mention a fantastic lover.
The lisp of this character sometimes causes them to mispronounce words.
I guess I'll just wait until nobody is around.

Ancestral legends tell of a time when the three brothers, Lech, Czech and Rus, went their own way to find fertile lands for their people. Today, countless generations later, all the children of this same ancestral blood are united under my rule, so it is only fit that we rid ourselves of our old and petty borders and formally establish one land in which all slavs will be as brothers and sisters.

Centuries ago, the three brothers Lech, Czech and Rus, our venerable ancestors, parted ways to settle their people. Divided by rivers, forests, mountains and wicked conquerors since time immemorial, we proved that blood is thicker than water, as today we celebrate the unification of all brothers and sisters of the great plain.
Together we will stand impervious to the tests of time!
Can only build §YTrade Posts§! in certain Counties along the §YTrans Saharan Trade Route§!\n        Open the §YTrade Zones Mapmode§! to see valid Counties

The Trade Route gives the following effects:
$MODIFIER$

Trade posts built in Trade Route counties increase the modifier for all provinces. If some Trade Route provinces are blocked (by siege or occupation), other Trade Route provinces temporarily get a higher bonus as trade is redirected.

If active, the Trade Route would give the following effects:
$MODIFIER$

Trade posts built in Trade Route counties increase the modifier for all provinces. If some Trade Route provinces are blocked (by siege or occupation), other Trade Route provinces temporarily get a higher bonus as trade is redirected.

Trade Posts can be built for §Y$COST$§!¤ along the coasts by Patrician families in Merchant Republics - even in foreign territory. However, any local ruler is also allowed to build Trade Posts in their counties if a Trade Route happens to pass through. (See the §YTrade Zones§! map mode.)

Trade Posts can be built for §Y$COST$§! along the coasts by Patrician families in Merchant Republics - even in foreign territory. However, any local ruler is also allowed to build Trade Posts in their counties if a Trade Route happens to pass through. (See the §YTrade Zones§! map mode.)
These barracks provide [coptic.GetName] rulers with a strong force of spearmen to hold a defensive line against the enemy.
These barracks provide [assyrian.GetName] ruler with a strong force of infantry, capable of both offensive and defensive battles.
Thanks to the efforts of [This.GetTitledFirstName], the [This.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty has been universally acknowledged as being directly descended from Alexander the Great.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] has been acclaimed by many wise men as the next reincarnation of the great Ashoka, unifier of India.

Legends about Alexander the Great and his epic campaign across Asia are told throughout the known world. Countless young rulers have wasted their lives in their hopeless attempts to emulate the immortal achievements of this legendary figure.\nHaving died young, after fathering only one child, Alexander was unable to establish an imperial dynasty, despite his many accomplishments, tragically dooming his Empire to fall shortly after its creation.\nRulers of all creeds and nations claim to trace their ancestors to the fleeting line of Alexander, yet none have been able to have such a prestigious claim be recognized by their peers and subjects.
I will be the first to succeed!
Attempt to forge a claim to §YAlexander's Bloodline§!.
It would be a fool's errand to try.

The location of the hallowed grounds where the great conqueror was put to his final rest has been a contested topic for millennia. Many Roman Emperors of old have claimed to have visited the tomb of Alexander during their rise to power, yet its true location still eludes modern scholars.\nThe recovery of my ancestor's sacred remains would surely strengthen my claim to his bloodline. As [Root.GetTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], I am closer than most contenders to the most likely locations, yet wasting time and resources in a quest that many have already failed to accomplish in the past might not be the wisest course of action.

The location of the hallowed grounds where the great conqueror was put to his final rest has been a contested topic for millennia. Many Roman Emperors of old have claimed to have visited the tomb of Alexander during their rise to power, yet its true location still eludes modern scholars.\nThe recovery of my ancestor's sacred remains would surely strengthen my claim to his bloodline. Yet wasting time and resources in a quest that many have already failed to accomplish in the past might not be the wisest course of action, especially given how far my expedition would have to travel to reach the most likely locations of the tomb.
Use your §YIntrigue§! and invest §YWealth§! to attempt to find §YAlexander's Tomb§!
Establishing a valid claim would be a better investment of resources.
Use your §YLearning§! and invest §YWealth§! to attempt to establish a claim on §YAlexander's Family§!
This search is taking too much of my time and resources.
Abandon your quest to claim §YAlexander's Bloodline§!.

No sooner Alexander had passed on that his generals had already started fighting for possession over his body. They knew that the one amongst them who became guardian of his remains would be acclaimed as his true successor.\nAnd in the same way, I am certain that by ensuring the recovery of Alexander's body my claim to his ancestry will be stronger than any upstart [Root.Culture.GetName] ruler. Having already spent several weeks consulting the most learned scholars in the realm to gather more information regarding the tomb's possible locations, it is now time for me to invest in a proper expedition to uncover the ancient sepulcher.
By investing a large amount of resources, you will greatly increase your chances of success.
I will buy the best equipment money can buy.
By investing a good amount of resources, you will increase your chances of success.
I cannot bankrupt my realm for this venture!
By investing a moderate amount of resources, you will decrease your chances of success.
The bare minimum is all I can afford.
By investing a small amount of resources, you will greatly decrease your chances of success.

Historians agree that Alexander had a son, named after him, born of a Bactrian Princess, yet the life of this child is shrouded by mystery. The Empire he was supposed to inherit from his father had long been split amongst greedy warlords by the time Alexander's son became a man, making it impossible for him to succeed.
Fearing retaliation from the Diadochi, it is no surprise that Alexander's wife would flee from his army and hide the child from assassination attempts.
It is not so far-fetched to think that their descendants found refuge to [Root.Capital.GetName] eventually, and split into the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName].
My scholars only need to find the right references in the ancient accounts of my dynasty to uncover this prestigious link.
I will provide you with everything you need.
I will have the court library expanded to accommodate new books.
Surely, a few more papers will be enough?

The valiant members of my expedition have finally returned to [Root.Capital.GetName].
They bring a marvelous gift with them: a mummified corpse, covered in ancient jewels that they claim to belong to my distinguished ancestor.
After a long consultation with my scholars, who carefully examine every detail of the body, I am certain that the expedition has been successful.
After having been lost for so many centuries, the body of Alexander the Great has finally been found, and I am the one responsible for its recovery. The only thing that remains for my claim to Alexander's ancestry to become unobjectionable, is to make this news known throughout the world.
Send out every messenger, inform every crier!
Everybody must know of this great discovery!
I should make sure all my subjects know of this.
An official statement should be enough.

The valiant members of my expedition have finally returned to [Root.Capital.GetName].\nUnfortunately, they do not bring much with them. A few rusted jewels and fragments of a skulls, which my scholars quickly dismiss as too recent to belong to the great conqueror.\nDespite the alleged care and efforts that they put into their search, my men were unable to succeed, wasting a considerable amount of my time and resources for nothing.
We must try again! That tomb must be somewhere!
Forget the tomb, we will pursue another path.
I have been ruined enough by this foolish venture.

It took us countless sleepless nights spent reading ancient tomes and pursuing forgotten scrolls, but we have finally achieved our goal. Under my lead, my group of scholars has been able to trace a lineage from the earliest known members of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty and the most plausible line of descendants of the glorious conqueror himself.\nThe only that is left now is to validate my claim in the eyes of my peers and subjects.\nMany envious upstarts are sure likely to dismiss my findings, jealous of my illustrious ascendancy. I will need to make sure that their voices are drowned out in the celebration for this momentous discovery.

Despite all the sleepless nights, hundreds of researched scrolls and learned scholars, my efforts to find a link between my dynasty and Alexander's unknown descendants has been fruitless.
Surely, a man that has traveled so far and wide, that has achieved so much during his brief life and earned eternal glory would not allow his glorious line to die out.
And a dynasty as powerful as mine, who has risen to hold the most esteemed throne of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] must surely trace its ancestry to the great conqueror himself.
Why is it then so hard for me to find the link between us?
Maybe I should focus my attention on Alexander's tomb.
We just need to look harder!

After years of study, research and investment, I have finally achieved my goal and eternally bound my dynasty's name to one of the greatest conquerors of known history.\nLong after I am gone, people will look at my descendants in awe and tremble at the very thought of meeting them on the field of battle.\nWithin our veins flows the same strength that subjugated Egypt, the same genius that cracked Babylon, the same ambition that led one man to travel from the heart of civilization to the edge of the world.

Despite my best efforts, my peers have yet to recognize the legitimacy of my claim to Alexander's ancestry.\nEven worse, my own subjects have reacted with apathy and skepticism to the news about my dynasty's prestigious founder. My councilors believe that the people are simply too ignorant to understand the importance of my discovery, while my peers are merely envious of its implications.\nFor one reason or the other, my quest is not over yet. My claim will have no value for as long as it is not universally recognized.
We need more celebrations and exposure!
The voice of the [Root.GetTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] will be heard!
There must be a way to educate those peasants...
It is no use. This was nothing but a huge waste of time.

There have been many rumors about [From.GetTitledFirstName] recently.\nUsing the help of charlatans, sorcerers and grave-robbers, the [From.GetTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has fabricated a ludicrous claim to Alexander's the Great dynasty. Many rulers have made such ludicrous assertions in the past, trying to latch onto the glorious name of the ancient conqueror, yet none had been taken seriously, until now.\nBy associating [From.GetHerHis] family to Alexander, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has succeeded in increasing enormously the prestige of the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] for centuries to come.
How can people fall for such a blatant fabrication?
And I could not be happier for us!

Ashoka is remembered by many for his outstanding military victories and his wise and prosperous rule. Under his lead, all of India was unified and at peace.\nOf all the dynasties who hopelessly wasted their lives trying to emulate his accomplishments, mine was the closest to succeed. I have been pondering as of recently if the accomplishments of my family in reunifying India and holding it under a just and enlightened rule should be proof that the glorious spirit of Ashoka is being reincarnated through our bloodline, all the way to myself.

Ashoka is remembered by many for his outstanding military victories and his wise and prosperous rule. Under his lead, all of India was unified and at peace.\nMany rulers have wasted their lives hopelessly trying to emulate his accomplishments. As the [Root.GetTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], I have certainly come closer than most, and I wonder now if the feats of my family are proof enough that the glorious spirit of Ashoka is being reincarnated through our bloodline, all the way to myself.
We must get to the root of this question!
Attempt to forge a claim to §YAshoka's Bloodline§!.
The very thought betrays my impurity.

Being already responsible for the reunification of India, my family has a greater claim to Ashoka's legacy than any other [Root.Culture.GetName] ruler, yet, in order for me to be formally recognized as a reincarnation of the enlightened Devanampiya Piyadassi, I must submit myself to the judgment of the wisest amongst us.\nI will call for the oldest and most prestigious Brahmins in India and allow them to examine my life and judge my character, so that they can confirm to my peers and subjects what I already know is the truth.

As a celebrated [Root.GetTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], I have already a greater claim to Ashoka's legacy than many other [Root.Culture.GetName] rulers, yet, in order for me to be formally recognized as a reincarnation of the enlightened Devanampiya Piyadassi, I must submit myself to the judgment of the wisest amongst us.\nI will call for the oldest and most prestigious Brahmins in India and allow them to examine my life and judge my character, so that they can confirm to my peers and subjects what I already know is the truth.
We will take all precautions when hosting the wise ones.
They will be given our best accommodations.
We will treat them with the utmost care.
I am sure they will be honored to assist me.

The wise Brahmins that have gathered in [Root.Capital.GetName] to examine and determine whether I am worthy of calling myself heir to Ashoka or not claim that, before anything else, I must prove my courage to them.\nDespite being born the youngest of Maurya Bindusara's sons and from a mere lowborn, he proved unparalleled bravery during the course of his life, surpassing all of his siblings to arise as a paragon of virtue and discipline.\nIf I truly am the new lion of India, it should be easy for me to prove that I have the fortitude to meet my bold claim.
I will let my deeds speak for themselves...
Allow me to enlighten you with tales of my valor.
But where is the line between bravery and recklessness?
Speak! Whatever the challenge, I will take on it!
I submit myself to your judgment.
What- What kind of proof do you need?
The §YBrahmins§! will examine your conduct and deliver their judgment when they feel satisfied.

It has been months now, yet the Brahmins are unsatisfied with my conduct.
They claim that I have failed to meet the standards of Ashoka's divine valor, of his enlightened leadership in battle and strategic skills.
If I truly am is reincarnation, I should not dread the prospect of facing my enemies and my insecurities. 
Until I have proven to them the purity of my intent, they will not allow me to proceed to the next phase of their test.
I assure you, I will not disappoint you.
If only you could tell me more precisely what you expect of me...
I think you should  re-examine your definition of fear.
What more can I do to prove myself?
I will try my best to impress you.
I am not so sure about this...
This is impossible! Your standards are too high!
Abandon your quest to claim §YAshoka's Bloodline§!.

Ashoka's father may have been an Emperor, but his mother was a common woman, the daughter of a poor Brahmin, and he was but the last of a large litter of Princes.\nAlthough in time he arose far above his station, outshining both his siblings and his old father, it is only thanks to his humble beginnings that Ashoka was able to rule with justice and kindness over the many people of India, achieving harmony between our various creeds and customs.\nIf I am Ashoka's new form, then I must remember the low beginnings of my previous life and share his humility.
Let us talk of his story one more time, wise ones.
If I were proud, would I submit myself to your judgment?
Humility is relative to one's state.
I submit to your judgment, wise ones.
How can I possibly prove that?
Of course! I am the most humble [Root.GetTitle] ever!

Despite my many attempts to convince them otherwise, the Brahmins are not satisfied by my display of humility. They claim that my demeanor betrays the inner smugness of somebody born within the highest echelons of nobility, somebody that has no knowledge nor memory of hunger and anonymity.\nA few of them are convinced that my very desire to be recognized as the heir to Ashoka is proof enough of my unbridled pride.
I understand your concerns, but let us discuss the matter further.
Is your test not faulty to begin with then?
Could we better determine the requirements of your test?
I can only hope you to reconsider your judgment.
But I am humble! Are you blind?!
Enough. I cannot possibly prove this.

According to legend, Siddhartha Gautama was the first to predict the coming of Ashoka. The Gift of Dust, the story holding his prophecy, tells of a time when Ashoka, born as Jaya in one of his previous lives, saw Buddha wandering the streets of his village while playing in the mud. The child, taken by his desire to offer something to the wanderer, threw a fistful of dirt in the Tathagata's bowl.\nBuddha, moved by his gesture, predicted that Jaya would be reborn as Ashoka, Emperor of all India.\nThe Brahmins state that, in order to be acknowledged as Ashoka's new form, I will need to prove that I am just as charitable.
Behold, wise ones, the girth of my munificence!
Oh, yes, I understand what you mean, wise ones...
But how should be valued a gift requested?
I suppose I could make a show of charity...
I imagine a second fistful of dust will not be enough?

The Brahmins are not satisfied with my show of charity.\nThey claim that merely giving some gold to the less fortunate is not enough to prove the true purity of intent that Jaya showed when he met Buddha. When Ashoka's past form had almost nothing, he was still driven to share what little he had to a complete stranger.\nThey say that my display is vacuous at best in comparison as the gifts that I am giving to my subjects I will take back in time as their [Root.GetTitle].
I shall give more than they could ever repay me!
Perhaps it is you who require some of my charity?
How can I fill the hole in this bowl, wise ones?
I have to care for the realm's stability as well.
Still not enough to compare to a bowl of dirt?!
Enough. I have spent too much already.

It was not an easy task to convince the Brahmins, but their final response was inevitable.
It was only a matter of time before my true nature was revealed for all the world to admire. 
I am the last incarnation of Ashoka, the great unifier of India.
By returning in the form of [Root.GetFullName] I have led the people of this great land to peace and prosperity just as I did in my past life, and just like my successors will do after I leave this body.

It was not an easy task to convince the Brahmins, but their final response was inevitable.
It was only a matter of time before my true nature was revealed for all the world to admire. 
I am the last incarnation of Ashoka, the great unifier of India.
By returning in the form of [Root.GetFullName] I will unify the people of this great land under a new Empire of Harmony and Virtue, just like I did in my past life and just like my successors will continue to do after I leave this body.

After a long, laborious ordeal, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been announced by a council of Brahmins as the new incarnation of Devanampiya Piyadassi.\nAfter having unified India once already in the form of Ashoka, this enlightened spirit has been reborn in the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] and achieve this glorious feat a second time.\nUnder [From.GetHerHis] rule, India is sure to know peace, prosperity and harmony for centuries to come.

After a long, laborious ordeal, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been announced by a council of Brahmins as the new incarnation of Devanampiya Piyadassi.\nAfter having unified India once already in the form of Ashoka, this enlightened spirit has been reborn in the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] and [From.GetSheHe] is now set to achieve this glorious feat for the second time.\nUnder [From.GetHerHis] rule, India is sure to know peace, prosperity and harmony for centuries to come.

My prestigious ancestor had already conquered the known world as a young man, bringing the Persian Empire to its knees and traveling all the way from Greece to India, and how much did I accomplish in the same time? How many great conquests have I achieved in my youth?

My prestigious ancestor had already conquered the known world as a young man, unifying all of the different people of India under one rule, and how much did I accomplish in the same time? How many great conquests have I achieved in my youth?
I was never meant to be a conqueror.
What have I done with my life?
The future of the realm depends on this child's survival. As such, [Root.GetHerHis] parents have taken all precautions to make sure that the precious infant reaches adulthood safely.

I am concerned about the health of poor [From.GetFirstName]. This realm requires a strong and healthy heir in order to prosper, yet my my child was not born under the best stars. It is my duty as a responsible [Root.Religion.GetName] [Root.GetTitle] to take all possible precautions in order to ensure a smooth succession.

I am concerned about the future of my dear [From.GetSonDaughter] [From.GetFirstName]. This realm requires a strong and healthy heir in order to prosper, and it is my duty as a responsible [Root.Religion.GetName] [Root.GetTitle] to take all possible precautions in order to ensure a smooth succession.
The stars will reveal the future of my heir!
Issue a closer reading of §Y[From.GetFirstName]§!'s horoscope, entrusting the child's future to your §YPiety§! and §YLearning§!.
I will grow [From.GetHerHim] with the utmost care.
[From.GetSheHeCap] will be guarded from every danger.

Despite [FromFrom.GetHerHis] sickly birth, the horoscope guarantees an almost certain recovery for little [FromFrom.GetFirstName]. And not only that! The child has clearly been born under very auspicious stars and is likely to become a great leader!

A closer inspection of [FromFrom.GetFirstName]'s horoscope has revealed that my child was born under extremely auspicious stars and that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] will likely grow to become a great leader once I have passed to the next world.

Inspecting the child's horoscope has revealed that, despite [FromFrom.GetHerHis] sickly birth, [FromFrom.GetFirstName] will likely grow into a healthy and strong [FromFrom.GetManWoman], fully capable of ruling over my realm after I have moved to the next world.

The story of the Roman Empire's glorious recovery will be told throughout the ages. Those unfortunate enough to have lived through the black days when barbarians sacked Rome at will or the Arab invaders swept in from the desert would not have dared dream of this day. All of the old provinces have been reclaimed and the Empire now stretches farther than it has in nearly a thousand years.\n\nBy shedding the weight of the dead god of the Galileans and re-embracing the Olympians the Empire of Caesar and Augustus has risen from its ashes. It will be a challenge to keep such a vast realm together, but for the sake of all humanity you must succeed, lest the world plunge into yet another dark age of ignorance and barbarity bereft of Rome's guiding light.

For once, it appears I have been able to instill some wisdom in [From.GetFirstName]'s thick skull. After a long and lively discussion, the [From.GetTitle] has finally decided to give into my demands.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] is not so bad a [From.GetTitle] after all...

It was too much of me to expect that [From.GetFirstName] would listen to reason now after ignoring my council for so long. The stubborn [From.GetTitle] has rebuked my suggestion again and again, too shortsighted and proud to admit the merit of my argument.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has been complaining for some time now about how nobody listens to [From.GetHerHim] anymore and that we all should show more respect and bear more attention to an esteemed elder of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. In truth, I believe [From.GetSheHe] just feels lonely.
I will make sure you are not neglected.
I know exactly what you need...
There must be something I can do to help you feel better...

It has been a few weeks now since [From.GetTitledFirstName] started to claim I would make a wonderful [Root.GetTitle] for [scoped_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. It seems the old [From.GetManWoman] is fed up with [scoped_ruler.GetTitledFirstName]'s lack of respect and would be ready to legitimize me as [scoped_ruler.GetHerHis] successor, should I decide to depose [scoped_ruler.GetHerHim].
That is something to think about...

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has been going around [Root.Capital.GetName] praising [From.GetFirstName], claiming that [From.GetSheHe] would make a much better [Root.GetTitle] than I do. Perhaps I should have not treated the Elder so poorly...

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has been going around [Root.Capital.GetName] for a few days now, praising me as one of the wisest rulers [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has seen in decades. Knowing that one of the oldest, most esteemed people in the realm supports me so openly has undoubtedly increased my standing amongst all vassals.
I have always been fond of [From.GetHerHim].

Having long since recognized me as a ruler worthy of praise and respect, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to dedicate some of [From.GetHerHis] dwindling time to share a spec of [From.GetHerHis] ancient wisdom with me, so that I may pass it down to my own descendants.
Tell me of the customs of our ancestors.
You must have watched over many rulers in your time...
I would like to know more about our people's legends.

There are many deities whom I can choose to follow. Will it be motherly Tsumburbura, Goddess of Fertility? Perhaps the moon spirit Ayyur, who knows how to guide me and help my negotiations? On the other hand, for wealth and prosperity, I could turn to the great snake Bida...
I will dedicate my prayers to Ayyur to give me guidance and wisdom.
Bida will bless me with riches beyond imagining.
It shall be Tsumburbura. May the mother protect me.
Strong and mighty Dongo, I will do battle in your name!

Mighty and enlightening Ayyur is a spirit associated with the Moon. Like its light, Ayyur brings brightness in a dark. At night he reads the minds of all living creatures. He offers his inspiration and guidance to all who worship him and sacrifice to him.

Bida, the great snake of Wagadu lives with all its seven heads in deep pit, hidden from eyes of mortals. Bida must be appeased with annual sacrifices and gifts, but in return, the snake eagerly bestows protection and abundance of gold and rain to those who serve him.

The mystical goddess Tsumburbura is the mother and founder of her people of Kano. She lives in a tree shrine on a Dala hill. She accepts any sacrifice and whoever pays her tribute, she shares her wisdom and power with him.

All hail the mighty Dongo, the great warrior king who transcended the bonds of mortality to rule forever! His weapons are stones and lightning, with whom he vanquishes the unworthy and brings justice wherever he goes.
This character is a devout follower of Ayyur, the African moon deity, the provider of wisdom and guidance.
This character is a devout follower of Bida, the African snake deity of prosperity.
This character is a devout follower of Tsumburbura, the African deity of motherhood.
This character is a devout follower of Dongo, the African deity of thunder and war.
It is well known that this character possesses the compassion and dignity of the God Ayyur.

You have toiled devoutly in your endeavor to follow the path of Ayyur. In his name you have promote peace and understanding between your subjects. As a result, your diplomatic skills have been improving.
A deeply revered [west_african_pagan_reformed.GetName] deity, the spider-god Anansi is a famous trickster, considered to be the spirit of all knowledge of stories.
The rainbow serpent is a mediator between spirits & the living in Vodun mythology, that maintains balance, order, peace and communication.
The people of the Book are fascinating to many [Root.Religion.GetName] rulers, who have often been ready to embrace some of the customs of their neighbors.
The people of the Book are fascinating to many [Root.Religion.GetName] rulers, who have often been ready to embrace some of the customs of their neighbors.
One of your neighbors or lieges must follow a §YChristian§!, §YIslamic§! or §YJudaic§! religion
Develop §YSympathy§! from a neighboring §YAbrahamic§! religion group.

You have toiled devoutly in your endeavor to follow the path of Anansi. In his name you have plotted and spied, orchestrated wild schemes and manipulated friends and family. As a result, your skills of intrigue have been improving.
I shall erect a monument in the honor of Anansi.
I shall erect a monument in the honor of Dan.

Finally the monument is finished. It turned out just as you envisioned it, or perhaps even better. To celebrate its completion, a grand ceremony was held in Anansi' honor, and what a ceremony indeed! Tales of it will be told for as long as the monument stands watch over [Root.Capital.GetName].

Finally the monument is finished. It turned out just as you envisioned it, or perhaps even better. To celebrate its completion, a grand ceremony was held in honor of the Rainbow Serpent, and what a ceremony indeed! Tales of it will be told for as long as the monument stands watch over [Root.Capital.GetName].

There are many deities whom I can chose to follow. Will I seek glory in battle by praying to Dongo, or curry the favor of the spider-god Anansi? Yet, if I wish to be blessed with a balanced life, to grow wise and old, perhaps I should look at Dan for guidance.
Anansi will grant me wit and finesse!
Dan will inspire in me wisdom far beyond my years.
Perhaps another spirit will be a better fit for me...
Great Anansi, share your secrets with me, and I shall keep them. The spider-god will guide me through the intricate web of lies out of which our world flourishes.
Glory to the Rainbow Serpent, the holy mediator between spirits and the living, he who maintains balance, order, peace and communication across our worlds!
Perhaps I will study the Book another time...
Rome is not to be ruled by a child

The Imperial Council and the Commanders of the Imperial Army can influence the selection of the new Emperor. Unlike Feudal Electors, each member of the Imperial Court has a different voting strength, based on his prestige, minor titles and attributes, making some electors more influential than others. The Emperor wields the most influence, unless disfigured, deformed or underage. Close relatives of the ruling Emperor, Commanders, Marshals and Claimants are all viable candidates for succession.

An Imperial government differs from its feudal counterpart by placing a larger focus on urban areas and a centralized court whose influence deeply affects internal politics. Councilors and Commanders hold a varying degree of influence, depending on their prestige and competence, which they can use to support or oppose the official heir of the Empire...
Ruler has a valid imprisonment reason

The Emperor and the seven Prince-Electors can nominate a successor from among themselves, any legitimate children and siblings of the ruler, as well as any other major dejure vassal of the Empire, as long as they share the same religion. If an historical elector title is held by infidels or does not exist, another dejure vassal will take its place. If the Empire is run under §YPapal Investiture§! or by a §YDogmatic§! religion, the Prince-Bishops hold a greater sway over the election.
The [Root.GetTitle]'s body should NOT be twisted or disfigured
A child's word is worth little
A child's word is worth nothing
[Root.GetFirstName] is a cunning politician with high §YIntrigue§!
[Root.GetFirstName] is a manipulative demagogue with high §YDiplomacy§!
There are no other valid landed vassals
Periodically attracts the servitude of §GFamous Artists§!

A famous bard named [invited_character.GetFirstName] has arrived to my court, lured by tales of my family's generosity towards all artists and craftsmen. [invited_character.GetSheHeCap] hopes to join my court and offer [invited_character.GetHerHis] services to such an illustrious patron of the art as I am.
I am afraid you will have to look further.

A renowned scholar has arrived to my court to request an audience with me. [invited_character.GetSheHeCap] says [invited_character.GetSheHe] has heard tales of how my dynasty has always offered safe haven and patronage to scholars and artists, and that [invited_character.GetSheHe] wishes to pledge [invited_character.GetHerHis] vast metaphysical knowledge to my service.
I am afraid I must decline your offer.

A mysterious [invited_character.GetManWoman] has reached my court. [invited_character.GetSheHeCap] claims to be a renown scholar from a place far away, who was cast out by [invited_character.GetHerHis] people for [invited_character.GetHerHis] unyielding devotion to knowledge. [invited_character.GetSheHeCap] hopes that a prestigious patron of the arts such as myself would have greater foresight than [invited_character.GetHerHis] previous liege.

A mysterious [invited_character.GetManWoman] has reached my court. [invited_character.GetSheHeCap] claims that [invited_character.GetSheHe] was forced to leave [invited_character.GetHerHis] homeland amidst spurious accusation of witchcraft laid against [invited_character.GetHerHim]. [invited_character.GetSheHeCap] wishes to pledge [invited_character.GetHerselfHimself] to me, hoping that I will show greater foresight than [invited_character.GetHerHis] previous liege.
All scholars are welcome at my court!
I cannot soil my good name by employing criminals.
There is a rare chance of characters growing to become great conquerors with higher attributes and special casus belli.
No Children of Destiny will ever be born.
What?! Friendship is not worth money!
Pregnant characters can receive flavor events normally and are temporarily forced into a regency during the final months of gestation.
Pregnant characters receive less flavor events and are not forced into a regency during the final months of gestation.
Pregnant characters receive no flavor events during their pregnancy and are not forced into a regency during the final months of gestation..
felt like an extension of my arm
and the ground felt firm beneath me
the wind blew gently across my face
and meeting [other_combatant.GetFirstName]'s eyes I saw they were full of apprehension
and I feel as strong as a [GetRandomMythologicalCreature]
and around us the onlookers held their breath
and struck once, I did not need to strike again
and brought my [GetDuelWeapon] down upon [other_combatant.GetHerHim]. They fended off the first blow but not the second
and in a whirlwind of blows they were down
After the duel is done I wipe the blood off my [GetDuelWeapon]
I left them lying on the ground and went to celebrate my victory
Once it is done I roar in victory
Once the duel was over, I mopped the sweat off my brow
looks fancy but I'm not so sure I know how to use it.
before I know it I am lying on the ground in a puddle of my own blood
I am doubled over clutching a wound in my side.
On the ground holding back tears.
§Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! finds a new muse for [This.GetHerHis] poetry
All courtiers will suspect §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! of sodomy
All courtiers will suspect §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! of incest
All courtiers will suspect §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! of impotence
All courtiers will suspect §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! of adultery
All courtiers will suspect §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! of occultism
All courtiers will know that §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! does not trust [Root.GetMyChancellorName] §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§!
All courtiers will know that §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! does not trust Marshal §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§!
All courtiers will know that §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! does not trust Steward §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§!
All courtiers will know that §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! does not trust Spymaster §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§!
All courtiers will think §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! lacks piety
All courtiers will think §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! is a coward
§Y100%§! chance of you making a good move.
§Y100%§! chance of you making a great move.
Apparently the church has found a fitting Saint of the faith. [saint_person.GetTitledName] has proven to be an exemplar of the faith, as well as having done miracles.

[saint_person.GetTitledName] is a well known exemplar of our faith, who recently passed away. Discussions about permanently venerating [saint_person.GetHerHim] as an ancestor have come up, but everyone is waiting for my final decision on the matter.

[saint_person.GetFirstName] was a true exemplar of the [saint_person.Religion.GetName] faith, living a pious and inspiring life. In a grand announcement [canonizer_person.GetBestName] has decided to include [saint_person.GetFirstNameWithNick] among the venerated ancestors of old.

Many tales are told about the feats [saint_person.GetFirstName] did in life, and [saint_person.GetSheHe] will be an inspiration for our descendants in the years to come.

It is a great honor for the family of the blessed one, and may we all aspire to follow in [saint_person.GetHerHis] footsteps.

The Papacy long claimed to be the rightful heirs of the Romans, since they took control of the central regions of the Italian Peninsula. With the recent conquests of [From.GetTitledName], [From.GetSheHe] has claimed the regions for [From.GetHerselfHimself].\n\nThough the Pope has been raging about [ThePope.GetHerHis] losses, and this affront to the Church, most lords and ladies throughout [ThePope.GetHerHis] old lands have accepted the rule of [From.GetTitledFirstName].
Bold moves, let us see how it will work out.

Though [ThePope.GetTitledName] fought long and hard for [ThePope.GetHerHis] lands in the Italian Peninsula, [ThePope.GetSheHe] has finally had to give up. With the losses, [ThePope.GetSheHe] has also had to relinquish all their old claims to the Roman lands stretching throughout the peninsula.\n\nWithout the Papal influence throughout the peninsula, new conquerors and nobles will certainly try to fill the void left by the Holy See. The rulers and city-states throughout the lands, embrace for the conflicts that is sure to come.
By the logic of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] I will convince them to leave my people alone.
Give §Y[From.GetTitledName]§! all the realm land in the §Y[northern_crusade_duchy_title.GetFullBaseName]§!

To the esteemed [Root.GetTitledName]

The Teutonic Order thanks you for your aid throughout the war for [northern_crusade_title.GetBaseName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

To the esteemed [Root.GetTitledName]

The Teutonic Order thanks you for your aid throughout the war for [northern_crusade_title.GetBaseName]. We have sent you a small gift to show our appreciation for your assistance.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
It was the least I could do.

After repeated tries to pacify the north, the Teutonic Knights have finally given up. At every turn, the pagans of the north have come together to protect their way of life.

As the Teutonic Knights finally renounced their Crusade against the pagans, the other Christians in the north will surely have a harder task at hand. With their opponents leaving, the pagans look to the south for potential new expansion.

The rest of the world awaits the pagan fury. The unquelled rampage of the north will surely come soon.

A large honor guard of the Teutons appear outside of [Root.Capital.GetName], led by [From.GetTitledName] [From.GetHerselfHimself]. In response to my aid in their latest wars, they have decided to award me and all my descendants the honor of friendship with the Teutonic Knights.\n\nForevermore, the Order will stay by our side as valiant knights and friends, if we should ever need them.

Though it has been a long and grueling fight between the Teutons and the natives of the [northern_crusade_kingdom.GetAdjective] lands, the campaign has finally ended with victory for the Christians.

No longer will the faithful in the north fear for their lives, as the Teutonic Knights patrol the lands and make sure to punish any infidels who dare step into Christian lands. What was once known as the pagan fury of the north has been pacified, never to be seen again.

The rampage and danger has ended.
It seems I have waited too long, as my men and all my preparation starts to come apart. It seems people lost faith in my plans, when I did not start any wars for Iberia.

Magnanimous [Root.GetTitledName]

Your plans to reconquer Iberia for Christianity inspires me to take up arms as well, and I will support your efforts to the best of my ability.

Your ally,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]

I have declared a reconquest war on [FromFromFrom.GetTitledName], and I am looking forward to see you on the battlefield.

Signed,
Your ally, [From.GetTitledName]
As promised, we will do our part and help out.

After leading troops on both sides of the wars raging throughout the Iberian Peninsula, I seem to have grown quite the reputation among the local peasants and soldiers on both sides.

Though some would consider me a mercenary or a traitor to the faith, my prowess in war has made me a hero among most, and revered among the populace. Some would even go as far as to call me a folk hero.

Surely, my actions must have been righteous, seeing all the responses. I have often wondered if it would all be worth it in the end, and it is a joyous occasion to see all my hard work has paid off.
I will be remembered throughout the ages.

I have fought for the faith several times these recent years, to recapture the Iberian Peninsula  as a true vanguard for Christendom and its followers.

Though we were occupied by the Moors of Al-Andalus invading from the south who forced their way into the heartlands of Christianity, we have pushed them out of our home. Step by step, we have regained what is rightfully ours.

Hispania will rise as a bastion of Christianity once more. We will make sure of it.

[Root.GetTitledName]

I have heard about your struggles against the other [FromFrom.Religion.GetGroupName]s, and I would like to assure you I do not share their animosity towards the [Root.Religion.GetName]s. For a small donation, I will be willing to help you out.

Signed,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]

To the magnanimous [Root.GetTitledName]

I appreciate and accept your offer. I hope to be seeing you at the battlefield shortly.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

To the greedy [Root.GetTitledName]

Your despicable offer disgusts me. I hope to see you at the battlefield next, so I can cut you down together with the rest of the infidels.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]

Your prowess in war is well known throughout the Iberian Peninsula, and I would like to offer your a sum of gold for your services in the current Reconquest War.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
I think... Yes, that sounds like a good deal.
And betray my fellow [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]s? I think not!

To the magnanimous [Root.GetTitledName]

I appreciate and accept your offer. I will be seeing you on the battlefield shortly.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Great! More allies are always needed!

To the despicable [Root.GetTitledName]

I find it insulting that you would even dare think I would betray my fellow [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
It seems I have to look elsewhere.

There will probably be men showing up to fight for the faith in the upcoming wars for Iberia, but I could invest some money into spreading the message far and wide to attract more well trained troops.
A small sum should be enough.
We need to make sure everyone hears about it.

The wars for Iberia are costly, and it has made a noticeable dent into my finances. [Root.RelHead.GetTitledName] has been a valiant supporter of our struggles for a long time, maybe it is time to ask [Root.RelHead.GetHerHim] for help?
A small donation is all I ask for.
No no, it is all right, I do not need any help...

A massive creature of a [new_commander.GetManWoman] is brought in front of me, supposedly [new_commander.GetSheHe] has quite the renown as a commander. After seeing [new_commander.GetHerHis] interactions with some of my men, it is easy to see [new_commander.GetSheHe] knows what [new_commander.GetSheHe] is doing.
I am sure you will fit right in!
I got just the job for you!
Actually, I think we do not need another commander.
A captain of a small fleet of ships appears at my court, trying to sell his services in the upcoming wars. Some of my commanders question the need for ships, but surely I could find a use for them.
I will happily take you up on the offer.
You would not happen to know more captains, would you?
We do not need ships to fight at land!

A year has passed since I started my preparations for the reconquest of Iberia, and I am sure that whoever wanted to take part in the reconquest would have arrived by now. Now all that remains is to find a place to point my newfound allies towards.
Now to find a fitting target.

As the last in a long line of attempts to try to reconquer the Iberian Peninsula, [From.GetTitledName] has begun preparing [From.GetHerHis] troops and looking for allies for a new Iberian campaign. Trying to restore parts of the peninsula to Christendom, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has spent a noticeable amount of resources and sent out a call to gather troops from all around the region.\n\nWith the Christians planning for war, the other faiths have started assembling their troops to defend themselves. It is only a matter of months, or maybe a year, before the two sides will clash together once more, desperately trying to claw their way to more land in Iberia.
The Christian rabble does not belong here.

With the rise of the [e_spain.GetFullName], the Iberian Peninsula has come under total control of the [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s. There was a long struggle between the different faiths occupying the peninsula, but the [From.Religion.GetGroupName] believers has finally conquered their adversaries.\n\nWith the struggle of the two sides finally put to rest, Iberia can finally start looking forward to a peaceful future, free of the wars that has raged through the peninsula.
Hispania will be a cornerstone of our faith.

Not even the Balearic Islands have been safe from the Christian reconquest of Iberia. The final bastions of the other faiths in the region has fallen, now there is only Christendom left.\n\nWith Iberia finally restored to the faithful, the reconquest of the peninsula has ended, and peace has been restored. Once more a cornerstone of the faith, Iberia will surely play an important role in the region.

A minor noble has launched a campaign to start gathering troops to reconquer parts of Iberia. [From.GetTitledFirstName] asks for my help in supporting [From.GetHerHim], and taking part in the reconquest. This is a great opportunity to push back the infidels from Iberia.
Help a minor noble? I think not.
As the sponsor of the upcoming reconquest campaign, I have a prime opportunity to aid [FromFrom.GetDynName]. But in what manner will I help [FromFrom.GetHerHim]?
I will use my renown to find [FromFrom.GetHerHim] a lot of troops.
My connections with the clergy will prove invaluable.
Wealth can topple any enemy and bless any ally.
Why would I help out more than I already have?
As I walk through the streets of [current_location.GetName], I suddenly feel someone bump into me, as a boy runs down the street. With a pouch that looks surprisingly like mine in his hands!
No matter, there was not a lot of money left in it.
Let us find that kid and make him pay.
Maybe he could be of use to me?

After hearing about a wise man in the local area, I decide to go visit him and see what he has to offer. He starts talking about ephemeral concepts that sounds like blasphemy, but I tell my men to go outside so I can hear what he has to offer.
I will learn what he has to offer, blasphemy or not.
Blasphemers must die. I will see what the rest of his library has to offer.
Maybe [current_location.Religion.GetName] has more to offer than [Root.Religion.GetName]?
As we travel through [current_location.GetName], we come across a festival to ancient gods still celebrated by the local populace. It reminds me of some of the harvest festivals at home.
Let us take part in the festivities!
It is not befitting of a true [Root.Religion.GetGroupName].
Maybe these harvest festivals are to the real gods?

I wake up to the voice of what I am sure to be [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] after a late night with my men. It only lasted for a second, but I am sure I was told to use all my resources to continue our righteous Crusade and help my allies.
Maybe I should not have had that much to drink.
I have been called to join the [decided_holy_order.PrimaryTitle.GetName]!

As we camp for the night, riders bearing the cross suddenly approach. Led by the pious [holy_order_meeting.GetTitledName], they settle down with us for the night. Just before I am going to sleep, [holy_order_meeting.GetFirstName] asks if I want to stay up and converse with him.
My apologies, but it is too late for that.

My men and I find ourselves at a bar in [current_location.GetName], as evening turns to night. An attractive serving girl seems to pay me a lot of interest, and when I am about to go to bed for the night, she is clearly interested in joining.

My men and I find ourselves at a bar in [current_location.GetName], as evening turns to night. An attractive serving boy seems to pay me a lot of interest, and when I am about to go to bed for the night, he is clearly interested in joining.
I am not here to pick up foreigners.
Nobody will know about just one night.
You should join me at my court!
I have noticed that my men seem somewhat restless these last days. Our stay in [current_location.GetName] has taken its toll on them, and they seem a bit demotivated.
I will drill the men back into a fighting force!
Maybe the [current_location.Religion.GetName] faith has more to offer us?
I have to say the [current_location.Religion.GetGroupName]s have taken well care of [current_location.GetName] though.

After finally losing their final bastion, the Teutonic Knights are once more landless and have started traveling back to the core lands of Christendom.

As they no longer have a realm of their own, they are once more known as the Teutonic Order, and will offer their services to whatever Christian Lord or Lady fighting the infidels.

The fall of the Teutonic State is surely a blow to the Catholics
Those of the Order are not meant to rule.
Only the first of many to fall.
As a long-standing ally of the Teutonic Knights, they could be convinced to become vassals of the realm if they see us fit.
As a long-standing ally of the Teutonic Knights, we can hire a part of the Order as honor guards temporarily.
Start preparing a campaign against the infidels in Iberia, to reconquer parts of the Iberian Peninsula for Christianity. A large undertaking like this can usually only be done once a lifetime.
Find a fitting dynasty member to become a beneficiary for my reconquests at the Iberian Peninsula.
Set §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! as a beneficiary for my reconquests at the Iberian Peninsula.
§Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! will no longer be my beneficiary for the Reconquest of Iberia.
I can sell my services against the other Christians for a sum of money, if §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! is willing to pay.
I can ask §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! for help against the other Christians invaders, in return for a small sum of money.
§Y[FromFrom.GetTitledName]§! will join in our Reconquest War
I can sell my services against the other [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s for a sum of money, if §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! is willing to pay.
I can ask §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! for help against the other [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]s defenders, in return for a small sum of money.
It is only right that the Supreme Pontiff has an honor guard to protect himself.
Not currently part of another Crusade
Cannot expel Jews during the worst parts of the Black Death epidemic
A soldier appears at the court of §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!.
Completely controls the region of the §YNear East§!
Every ruler participating in the Crusade can choose a §YBeneficiary§!, one that might inherit land in the new Crusader Kingdom if the Crusade is successful.
§Y[d_teutonic_order.Holder.GetTitledName]§! have an opinion of §G25§! or higher of §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!
§Y[k_teutonic_state.Holder.GetTitledName]§! have an opinion of §G25§! or higher of §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!
Recently raised an Assassin army - cannot raise more troops until §Y[Root.assassins_raise_troops_cooldown.GetExpiryDate]§!
Recently raised the Teutonic Honor Guard - cannot raise it again until §Y[Root.hire_teutonic_honor_guard_cooldown.GetExpiryDate]§!
Has land in the Kingdom targeted by the Teutonic Knights
[saint_person.GetFirstName] has become known as a blessed ancestor, and everyone of [saint_person.GetHerHis] §YBloodline§! will reap the benefits.

I have seen [student.GetBestName] during a couple of gatherings with [Root.Society.GetName], and I cannot help but notice how the [student.GetAgeAdjective] [student.GetManWoman] appears needlessly jumpy. Upon returning from a small raid with my personal guard, I have been talking to [student.GetBestName]. The [student.GetManWoman] does not understand the urge for adventure, whatsoever. "What about the prosperity it brings your tribe?", I argue, showing off a new bracelet decorating my arm. [student.GetSheHeCap] sighs, seemingly unimpressed.

Observing yet another game of [Root.GetWarriorLodgeCompetitionType], and [student.GetTitledFirstName] storming off with a sullen expression on [student.GetHerHis] face, it occurs to me how my [student.GetRootRelation] sorely lacks patience. "It is useful in battle as well", I mumble, scratching my chin, contemplating offering [student.GetHerHim] some guidance.

Watching [student.GetBestName] in the training grounds is always interesting. There is something about [student.GetHerHis] fighting technique that comes off as half-hearted, and [student.GetHerHis] weapons, as well as armor, seem like they could use a little more caring for... "[student.GetFirstName], could I have a word?", I interrupt the sparring.
Oh, I could help you hone that ambition, [student.GetFirstName]!
The [student.GetManWoman] needs someone to show [student.GetHerHim] a different way.
Let's talk weapon care and etiquette, my good [student.GetManWoman].
You have better things to do.

I hear you are turning down duels, a [teacher.GetManWoman] sounds behind me. Spinning around, I find myself talking to my [teacher.GetRootRelation], [teacher.GetTitledFirstName]. "[Root.Society.GetNameCap] are aware, of course", [teacher.GetSheHe] says. Putting an arm over my shoulder, [teacher.GetSheHe] continues: "I could help you! You just need a little guidance, my good [Root.GetManWoman]!"

[teacher.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from a raid in foreign lands. My [teacher.GetRootRelation] is showing off the bounty brought back, when I let out a sigh, causing [teacher.GetHerHim] to pause. "You know, you always seem so content with what you have, [Root.GetFirstName]" [teacher.GetSheHe] says. "I could help you hone your ambition", [teacher.GetSheHe] presses.

I recently lost a game of [Root.GetWarriorLodgeCompetitionType], and [teacher.GetTitledFirstName] has approached me, wanting to talk about my temper. "Patience is something that comes from within", my [teacher.GetRootRelation] explains. I clench my fist, a gesture not lost on the [teacher.GetManWoman]. "You just need some guidance", [teacher.GetSheHe] finally says.

[teacher.GetBestName] is watching me in the training grounds. There is something inquisitive about it, and I am not surprised when [teacher.GetSheHe] comes over, asking about the routines I keep, "maintenance-wise, for your weapons and armor". When I fail to come up with a clear answer, [teacher.GetSheHe] continues, unapologetically: "I could teach you how to care for your sword".
I am open for suggestions. What do you have in mind?
I am not your charity project!
You let §Y[teacher.GetTitledFirstName]§! know that you are insulted.
This could lead to you becoming §YBrave§!...
This could lead to you becoming §YAmbitious§!...

[student.GetTitledFirstName] agreed that [student.GetSheHe] needs my help. In order to make [student.GetHerHim] see things differently, [Root.GetTeachingMomentActivity]
You make a show of how invested you are in this endeavor.
[student.GetTitledFirstName] politely declined my offer. The [student.GetManWoman] apparently feels perfectly fine with the current state of things.
[student.GetTitledFirstName] refused my offer, muttering something about not being a charity project. If adequacy is enough for the [student.GetManWoman], who am I to intervene?
That ungrateful...! I was going to bring my favorite [Root.GetTeachingMomentTool]!
[teacher.GetTitledFirstName] did not appreciate my response and has sworn to never aid me in any way, ever again.
Some people are rather sensitive, are they not?

When [teacher.GetBestName] informed me that we were going to live in the woods for a few nights, I was tempted to refuse. We could be eaten by snakes! By [Root.GetRegionalFerociousAnimal]s! Or attacked by raiders! However, falling asleep in the wilderness, to the wind and rustling of the trees, my fears began to wane. Now, I do not know what it was that I was so afraid of.

When [teacher.GetTitledFirstName] said we were going to spend several days in a library, my heart sank. "The scribes know details about all the famous warriors" [teacher.GetSheHe] beamed. Thankfully, it only takes a few hours before I find myself enthralled by the stories. "I knew you had it in you", [teacher.GetSheHe] says cheerfully.

I was not excited to watch others play games of [Root.GetWarriorLodgeCompetitionType], and I think [teacher.GetTitledFirstName] could tell. Yet, the patience with which my [teacher.GetRootRelation] narrated the matches to me, explaining each subtle move, was eye-opening. Even seeing fighters who lost one day, return for revenge the next, was inspiring!

When my [teacher.GetRootRelation] suggested we spend a few afternoons reorganizing [teacher.GetHerHis] armory, I expected to be bored within moments. Yet [teacher.GetTitledFirstName] has managed to keep my interest for several days, and I find myself asking questions I have never even thought of before. I am almost embarrassed by my former attitude.
Thank you, friend, for this opportunity.
I cannot express how grateful I am. Can I... Can I kiss you?
§Y[teacher.GetTitledFirstName]§! is as happy as you are.
§Y[teacher.GetTitledFirstName]§! smiles, and shrugs nonchalantly. "I guess on the cheek would be alright."

I would not have chosen "camping in the woods", but perhaps that is the point. When my [teacher.GetRootRelation] informed me that we were going to live in the wilderness for a few nights, I pushed all imagery of falling off cliffs and being eaten by snakes aside. Looking back on the experience, I have to admit, I am sad it is over.

You want us to spend time, voluntarily, in the library? [teacher.GetTitledFirstName] nods. "Yes! I think you'll enjoy hearing about old heroes," [teacher.GetSheHe] laughs, [teacher.GetHerHis] eyes aglitter. A few hours later, I understand. The tales are fascinating! "Some make for decent role models", I admit.

We are going to watch *others* play at [Root.GetWarriorLodgeCompetitionType]? [teacher.GetTitledFirstName] dismissed my reluctance, and gestured me to a seat. Soon, [teacher.GetSheHe] was narrating the games to me, pointing out subtleties and things I would usually miss. "I.. am beginning to understand how a hot temper might get in the way of these things..." I admit.

Surely, your armory must already be in order? I offer, but [teacher.GetTitledFirstName] shakes [teacher.GetHerHis] head. "This is more about mastering the principles behind the organizing, than the organizing itself" the [teacher.GetManWoman] explains. A few days later, I admit, I have learned some valuable techniques and practices...!
There is nothing to fear here, is there?
Perhaps I simply never knew of all the things I *could* achieve?
I will exercise patience next time, [teacher.GetFirstName].
I will strive to be more diligent in the future, [teacher.GetFirstName].

[teacher.GetTitledFirstName] had us go into the woods, where we were supposed to spend several nights. "Living off the land!" [teacher.GetSheHe] said. "I am the [Root.GetTitle]! I live comfortably in my [Root.GetCapitalHolding], thank you", I responded. The next couple of days were a frightening drudge of unsettling rustling in the trees, cold, and food poisoning.

[teacher.GetTitledFirstName] and I spent several days couped up in a dusty old library. Apparently it was supposed to "inspire" me, whatever that means. I am sorry to say it had the opposite effect. "Perhaps we are not that alike, after all", the [teacher.GetManWoman] sighs in disappointment.

[teacher.GetTitledFirstName] forced me to sit and watch all our friends playing games of [Root.GetWarriorLodgeCompetitionType]. And throughout the whole experience, the [teacher.GetManWoman] talked, and talked, trying to explain the game to me. Eventually I had enough and walked out.

[teacher.GetTitledFirstName] put me to cleaning [teacher.GetHerHis] armory. And everything I did was wrong...! The [teacher.GetManWoman] kept giving me counter-effective instructions and muttering under [teacher.GetHerHis] breath about "impossible", and "why do I even try". If there was a lesson in this, I do not think I understood it.
I don't know why I don't learn.
My [student.GetRootRelation] and I are back from our camping trip. [teacher.GetTeachingMomentResult]
My [student.GetRootRelation] and I are back from our final session with the scribes. [teacher.GetTeachingMomentResult]
My [student.GetRootRelation] and I have retired from watching the games. [teacher.GetTeachingMomentResult]
My [student.GetRootRelation] and I are finally done organizing my armory. [teacher.GetTeachingMomentResult]
I am happy I could help.
[student.GetSheHeCap] will hopefully keep working on [student.GetHerHis] [Root.GetTeachingMomentFocus], even so.
They might need to keep working on this...!

we are to spend a few nights camping in the woods. Judging by the nervous laughter my proposal is met with, I suspect [student.GetSheHe] is aware of the many dangers the wilderness holds... "It is nothing for cowards", I conclude.

we are going to be educating ourselves on famous [Root.Culture.GetName] warriors, and their historical achievements. Surely, their tales are bound to inspire the [student.GetAgeAdjective] [student.GetManWoman].

we are going to be observing some [Root.GetWarriorLodgeCompetitionType] games. I am hoping it will teach the [student.GetManWoman] that fortune comes and goes, and that your spirit is the only permanent thing in this world.
I have asked my quartermaster to let us spend some afternoons organizing the armory. I admit, this year's spring cleaning is overdue anyway!

Any traces of [student.GetHerHis] initial reluctance are gone, and I'm proud to be able to compliment [student.GetHerHim] on how well [student.GetSheHe] handled the experience. "Thank you, for this opportunity, [Root.GetFirstName]", [student.GetSheHe] says, more heartfelt than expected.
To my amusement, [student.GetSheHe] keeps talking, gesturing excitedly about everything [student.GetSheHe] has learned. [Root.GetTeachingMomentRomanceReaction]
[student.GetSheHeCap] did not seem to be overly enjoying [student.GetHerselfHimself], but I feel confident that [student.GetSheHe] picked up a thing or two anyway.

I... I am not sure it was what [student.GetSheHe] had in mind, and [student.GetSheHe] was clearly overwhelmed. Or perhaps I expected too much. [student.GetSheHeCap] mostly seemed agitated, in the end.
I love your [Root.GetTeachingMomentFocus], [student.GetSheHe] mumbles, before moving closer to kiss me.
I would happily learn more about your [Root.GetTeachingMomentFocus], [student.GetSheHe] smiles. Then [student.GetSheHe] moves closer, and I welcome [student.GetHerHis] embrace.
Can I kiss you? [student.GetSheHe] asks suddenly, and I can't stop myself from letting out a laugh. Then I shrug, but make myself clear: only on the cheek.

I am so grateful. I could kiss you! [student.GetSheHe] laughs. I blush, attempting to seem disinterested. [student.GetSheHeCap] lifts me up, and twirls me around, kissing me on the cheek. "Thank you", [student.GetSheHe] says again. Then the moment is gone.
smack my [Root.GetDuelWeapon] into the side of [other_combatant.GetHerHis] head

After some truly exciting skirmishes in [target_title.GetName], [Root.Society.GetName] have returned home from their legendary journey.

And then there was only one.
And so it falls to me to continue this journey alone.

I can't take it any longer. "Jailer!" I shout. For some reason the person who shows up on the other sides of the bars is a [crossfire_target.GetManWoman], saying "I heard we had a real brute down here. I got curious." I lash out at [crossfire_target.GetHerHis] smirk, punching the iron bar so hard my fingers crunch. My blood boils, but all I can do is crumple to the floor, the pain overwhelming my blood thirst.

I can't stand being confined here. In the corner of our cell, [crossfire_target.GetFirstName] stands, scratching something in the wall. "Doesn't it drive you mad?!" I growl at [crossfire_target.GetHerHim]. "YOU drive me mad!" [crossfire_target.GetSheHe] roars, flying for my throat. My boiling blood takes hold of me and soon the [crossfire_target.GetManWoman] is lying whimpering on the floor.

I have lost track of day and night, and everything reeks. The other prisoners laugh when I start attacking the wall. "Acting out your frustration?", they mock. After a few days, and some ridicule from the jailer, I manage to break loose an iron bar... The feeling of an actual weapon in my hand makes my blood boil.
You want to go again?! I can do this all day!
Get out of my way! I am getting OUT of here!
Get out of my w- Oh, no! I'm sorry! Are you hurt?

Now, to convene with my agents...

My [other_combatant.GetRootRelation] seems unaware that the little scrape I inflicted is what is causing [other_combatant.GetHerHis] limbs to slowly go numb... "Valiant effort!" I proclaim, watching [other_combatant.GetHerHis] sluggish movements.
