I'm not sure why my [Root.GetMySpymasterName] wants to inspect my equipment prior to the duel – surely, [job_spymaster.GetHerHis] comment about poison were in jest! Later, my performance in the fight is not my greatest accomplishment, but I honestly expected my [other_combatant.GetRootRelation] to put up more resistance. I barely have a scratch!

Impressive! [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] splutters, on [other_combatant.GetHerHis] knees in the [Root.Capital.GetGroundDesc]. Finally, I let the anger fill me. "I had your weapons switched", I hiss, pressing my dagger to [other_combatant.GetHerHis] throat. "I have eyes and ears everywhere", I explain to the bewildered [other_combatant.GetManWoman]. "You thought I'd let you *poison* me?"
[other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName]'s moves are graceful, and I'm impressed – the [other_combatant.GetManWoman] should be looking weaker by now... [other_combatant.GetPoisonDefense]
[other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] has only managed to get a few scrapes in on me, yet I can feel my energy draining. Something is wrong. I wonder... [Root.GetPoisonSpeculation]
Why are the trees so colorful suddenly...? I... Can't hold my [Root.GetDuelWeapon] up... Oh, the [Root.Capital.GetGroundDesc] looks so comfy...
Could [other_combatant.GetSheHe] have... If I didn't know better, I'd argue that I am experiencing ... symptoms of ... of poison.
Is this not reminiscent of how nightshade would make a person feel, if they had been poisoned? Wait, NOOOOO!
What have I eaten today...? My food taster was right there... Oh, by [This.Religion.GetHighGodName], this is not how I wanted to go.

I am exhausted, I realize. In fact, breathing is hard, and my chest feels tight. "What is...", I mumble, as I fall to the ground, catching a glimpse of [other_combatant.job_spymaster.GetTitledFirstName] in the crowd. The [other_combatant.GetMySpymasterName] is grinning in triumph.
\nSuddenly, the taste of blood fills my mouth. "YOU were going to poison ME?", [other_combatant.GetSheHe] hisses, throwing a second dagger into my chest.

Could I have messed up the ingredients...? "Wait!" I call out in desperation, trying to buy myself some time. Something is wrong, I think frantically, but it is too late. The [other_combatant.GetManWoman] [other_combatant.GetKillingBlowOnMeShort].

It's a good day for a duel!, I chuckle, hefting my [Root.GetDuelWeapon] in my hand. "Enough talking", my opponent growls. Soon, [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] is lying face down in the [Root.Capital.GetGroundDesc], as I have seen to [other_combatant.GetWeaponInjuringBlow].

My opponent looks nervous, [other_combatant.GetHerHis] armor a little ill-fitting, and I briefly contemplate asking if [other_combatant.GetSheHe] would rather do this another day... A moment later, I snap out of it, letting the fresh morning air sharpen my senses instead. The [other_combatant.GetCharacterLook] [other_combatant.GetManWoman] is soon on the ground, groaning in pain.

The sun is beginning to set when I meet with [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName], my [GetDuelWeapon] ready. Don't look so glum, [other_combatant.GetTitledName] offers. [other_combatant.GetSheHeCap] has me on the ground, *again*, and I losing any patience I ever had. "You oaf-" I begin, but I collapse from the pain. The [other_combatant.GetManWoman] has managed to [Root.GetWeaponInjuringBlowOnMe], and the clear scent of blood has me dizzy

I am not sure what is wrong with me, but nothing I do has any effect on [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName]. "Come on, don't give up already!" [other_combatant.GetSheHe] commands, disgruntlement clear in [other_combatant.GetHerHis] voice. I try to rise, but I can't. My [Root.GetBodyPartInjured] hurts like it never has before. Pain is throbbing in my [GetBodyPartInjured], and I clench my jaw, trying not to cry. "It's not over!" I growl, but my opponent is lowering [other_combatant.GetHerHis] weapon. The last rays of the evening sun envelops [other_combatant.GetHerHim], and suddenly, [other_combatant.GetSheHe] looks like a warrior sent by the heavens themselves...! In an attempt to say something about it, I pass out.
Your sabotage had little to no effect.

My [GetBodyPartInjured] hurts, but it somehow doesn't seem as bad as what my opponent is suffering. "I'm not done!", [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] says, through gritted teeth, but then [other_combatant.GetSheHe] lies back down on the ground, throwing [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetDuelWeapon] to the side. [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] is taken aback when I [other_combatant.GetWeaponInjuringBlow]. "[Root.GetTitledFirstName] wins!" someone proclaims, and my opponent groans. I am ignoring the pain in my [GetBodyPartInjured], but I have a suspicion [GetSeverityOfInjury].

No, I can still fight! I say, dropping to my knees, sensing my own lie. Even though [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] has clearly injured [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetBodyPartInjured], [other_combatant.GetSheHe] has been proclaimed the winner. Sighing, I ponder my own worst injury. I have a feeling [Root.GetSeverityOfInjury].

You don't give up, do you? my opponent laughs. "I've thought about it", I mutter, attempting to stand. [other_combatant.GetSheHeCap] did just see to [Root.GetWeaponInjuringBlowOnMe]... As I slump back on the ground, [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] smiles in triumph.

Die! [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] bellows, with what must be the last of [other_combatant.GetHerHis] strength. The blow to my [GetBodyPartInjured] comes with a blinding pain, but one last glance at my opponent, I feel certain that the exhausted [other_combatant.GetManWoman] will join me in my death...

It is with effort that I finally [other_combatant.GetWeaponInjuringBlow]. But as it dawns on me that I am about to win the fight, instead of letting out a cry of victory, I struggle for breath. As I fall to the ground, I can't feel my legs. The last thing I see is the blue sky.

There is something odd about the reluctance with which [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] is fighting. Perhaps the poison I had my agents prepare is working better than anticipated? My [GetBodyPartInjured] is stinging with pain, and inspecting my other wounds, I find myself feeling dizzy, my vision beginning to blur... No... No, no, no!

[other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] is moving sluggishly. Perhaps it's due to the special breakfast I had my agents prepare for [other_combatant.GetHerHim], but it is clear that the [other_combatant.GetManWoman] is not in [other_combatant.GetHerHis] best form. Before anyone catches on, I attack with full force. It feels almost too easy.

[other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] is moving [other_combatant.GetClumsilyElegantly], yet I can't even muster the strength to hold my [GetDuelWeapon] right. Smirking, [other_combatant.GetSheHe] swings [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetDuelWeapon], and [Root.GetKillingBlowOnMeShort].

For a moment I am worried that [other_combatant.GetHerHis] armor is going to simply fall off [other_combatant.GetHerHim], but [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] does not appear to notice my sabotage. All I need to do is land a blow in the right area and... There! The [other_combatant.GetManWoman] is spinning, clutching [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetBodyPartInjured], screaming in pain.

I instructed the squire to weaken my opponent's armor, but I am having trouble spotting the sabotage. "Are you making a wish?" [other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] asks, impatiently – we have been at this for hours, and my scheming has lead nowhere. I back away, clutching my [GetBodyPartInjured]. [GetSeverityOfInjuryCap].
it is not going to leave any lasting means

§Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! has NOT recently issued this challenge to §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!
Why Can't We Just Talk About It?
This character is building a rumor of great cowardice. If [Root.GetSheHe] is not careful, [Root.GetHerHis] subjects might strive to emulate this behavior...

My [craven_ruler.GetRootRelation] confesses that [craven_ruler.GetSheHe] has recently turned down another duel [craven_ruler.GetSheHe] was challenged to. I am not sure what words of comfort I can offer, but I understand [craven_ruler.GetHerHis] feelings of guilt and shame. Is this the ruler [craven_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] should have?

[craven_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] recently turned down another duel [craven_ruler.GetSheHe] was challenged to. At first I was embarrassed, on behalf of all [craven_ruler.GetHerHis] subjects, but who am I to say I would not react the same way? Perhaps there is value in choosing your battles...?
Yes, one can never be too careful.
No! I am ashamed of the cowardice [craven_ruler.GetSheHe] keeps displaying.

[From.GetTitledName] stops me in the great hall today, beckoning me to the side. In a low voice, my [From.GetRootRelation] explains that [From.GetSheHe] thinks I am right to be cautious, when all manner of villains and fools challenge my rule. "You set an example, saying that it's fair to prefer the diplomatic approach. Thank you."
NO! You are supposed to do as I *say*! Not... Argh...

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has sent me a letter, containing thinly veiled accusations of cowardice. "It is no way to uphold ideals of honor, my [Root.GetLordLady], declaring the preferred course of action to be inaction." I groan loudly, in annoyance.\n"Anything interesting, [Root.GetMasterMistress]?" a servant inquires.
I... I have to do something about this.
As a member of §Y[From.Society.GetName]§! you can choose to educate §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! in the shadowy arts of the brotherhood.
§Y[assassin_protege.GetTitledFirstName]§! will offer [assassin_protege.GetHerselfHimself] up to Allah and convert to the religion of Shia Islam, either publicly, or secretly.
To complete this mission, the training of a protégé must be initiated and completed. To train a child, §Gright-click§! on their portrait and choose "Train Protégé".
This option is available because you have §Y[book_target.GetName]§! in your §YTreasury§!
I will see to it that we make use of existing recipes, for inspiration.
Let's make use of this little book, why don't we?
You find yourself unable to put the book down...
Your [potential_cannibal.GetRootRelation] takes charge of the administration of food...
I will lose myself in reading [book_target.GetName] instead!
I shall practice restraint by only *reading* about food!
To better understand the plight of others, I must seek out new perspectives!
I will look for inspiration in the tales of others.

[book_target.GetName] is still on my mind, when one of my servants cautiously inquires whether I wish to make a donation to the local [Root.GetMOBuilding]. My first reaction is reluctant, but out loud I say: "Yes, of course". Perhaps this is the first step towards freeing myself of the desire for material possessions?

At first, every minute felt like an eternity, but then it got easier, as a certain passage of [book_target.GetName] grabbed my interest. I kept reading, consumed by the words of [book_target.OriginalOwner.GetTitledFirstName]! Now, I go to sleep with a smile on my lips and a renewed sense of purpose.

[This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to become [Root.GetKingQueen] of [This.Capital.Kingdom.GetName]. If pagan, with succession laws set to Elective Gavelkind, it allows [This.GetObjectPronoun] the unlimited use of the Subjugation Casus Belli within the kingdom. If the Fabricate Claims councilor mission is available, it may acquire a claim on [This.Capital.Kingdom.GetName] with this ambition. There is also a reduced cost for creating the [This.Capital.Kingdom.GetTier] if it does not yet exist.

Pagans, with succession laws set to Elective Gavelkind, are allowed to subjugate other pagan rulers once in their lifetime. (With the 'Become $KING$' ambition, there is no such time limit against those who control titles within the kingdom.) Free men are always willing to follow the mightiest ruler...

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
Staying idle is not in a warrior's blood, I hence invite you to aid me against my enemies. I promise to put in a good word you at the lodge based on your participation in the war. [GetWarLetterFlavor]

With the hope of your support,
[From.GetTitledName]
I gladly accept. May my weapon taste the blood of your enemies!
I have other matters to attend to.
Let us ride together into battle! Our battle cries will rally our warriors and send our enemies cowering back home!
Let the battlefield overflow with the blood of our fallen enemies!
Come, [GetSisterBrother], let us quench our weapons' thirst for blood together!
It would be an honor to have a renowned tactician such as yourself.
I hope we can have a fruitful exchange of knowledge during the war.
I am certain that partaking in a war will aid you in your thirst for war.
I hope you take this pristine chance to keep your wits sharp.
I am certain that partaking in a war will steady your aim for your future hunts.

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
I heard that you turned down the offer made from [warrior_lodge_war_defender.GetTitledFirstName]. My counter offer is similar, I will put in a good word you at the lodge with the possibility of something additional if my victory is ensured. 

With the hope of your support,
[From.GetTitledName]

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
I am reaching out to you, asking if you wish to join the war against [warrior_lodge_war_defender.GetTitledFirstName]. I promise to put in a good word you at the lodge if I win the war. [GetWarLetterFlavor]

With the hope of your support,
[From.GetTitledName]

The war that raged between [warrior_lodge_war_attacker.GetTitledFirstName] and [warrior_lodge_war_defender.GetTitledFirstName] has now ended in favor of [warrior_lodge_war_victor.GetFirstName]. [GetWarLetterOutcome]
I am pleased to hear this.
Is that all? I expected more...
The war that raged between [warrior_lodge_war_attacker.GetTitledFirstName] and [warrior_lodge_war_defender.GetTitledFirstName] has now come to a sizzling ending in white peace. [GetWarLetterOutcome]

The war that raged between [warrior_lodge_war_attacker.GetTitledFirstName] and [warrior_lodge_war_defender.GetTitledFirstName] has now ended in favor of [warrior_lodge_war_victor.GetFirstName]. [GetWarLetterOutcome]

Pleased with the aid I provided in the war, [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetFirstName] has sent me a letter informing me that [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetSheHe] has begun to spread the word of my ferocity and great deeds.
[warrior_lodge_war_side.GetFirstName] has sent me a letter informing me that [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetSheHe] will not speak highly of me for my passive deeds.
The nerve of this brazen fool!
What should I have done differently...?
There is truth in his harsh words. I must abandon my craven ways.

Another letter from [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetFirstName] arrived today. [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetSheHeCap] shares the news of people's reactions after he regaled them the grand tales of my deeds. Along with the stories is also an invitation to join [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetHerHim] in [GetSuggestedActivity]...
exchanging knowledge of war among other things
celebration of their, as well as my own, victory in the war.
I happily accept! What a joyous occasion to share with [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetFirstName].
Decline the invitation. It is not suitable to my taste.

I can tell by the handwriting that another letter from [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetFirstName] has arrived on my desk. After I accepted [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetHerHis] invitation to celebrate [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetHerHis] victory, [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetSheHe] has written more often. Surely there's a reason for this continued contact?
Time spent [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetFirstName] are precious memories I will forever cherish.
I never thought that I could find love as a consequence of war...
My letters to [warrior_lodge_war_side.GetFirstName] is nothing but formality.

The sudden death of [From.GetBestName] has left an undeniable sense of emptiness. [From.GetHerHisCap] prowess and strength in the battlefield were legendary. Although [From.GetSheHe] is sorely missed, I am sure that [From.GetTitledFirstName] is celebrated as a true warrior in the afterlife as well.
I shall have a weapon forged in [From.GetHerHis] honor!
We must teach and reflect on [From.GetHerHis] techniques!
A moment in calm solitude is the best way to pay respects.
You try to find a smithy of worth to make this weapon...

My search for a worthy weaponsmith has reached the ears of [weapon_forger.GetBestName], who tells me of a ritual that can infuse the strength of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] into a weapon. [weapon_forger.GetSheHeCap] claims that this ritual requires the weapon to be forged in the remains of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] or the body of a close relative. My choice is between desecrating the remains of the dead or to add another one to their ranks.
Forgive me, my friend, but I require your strength.
You decide to risk getting caught retrieving [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] remains...
The blood of a family member will have to do.
You decide to attempt a kidnapping of [potential_sacrifice.GetFirstName]...
No, stop this nonsense! Away with you!
abduct the close blood relative of my dear friend
retrieve the resting remains of my dear friend

Under the cover of darkness, I deploy my plan to [GetDecidedActionInHF51002] to forge a soulbound weapon. Although the plan was hastily crafted, I had not expected if to fail so dramatically. [witness1.GetTitledFirstName] is staring at me with such intensity one's skin could burn, and [witness1.GetSheHe] is not alone in witnessing my crime.
No! It is not what you think!
It was [weapon_forger.GetTitledFirstName]! [weapon_forger.GetSheHeCap] told me to do this!

I succeeded in my plan to [GetDecidedActionInHF51002] to forge a soulbound weapon. Memories of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] flood my mind, soon their strength will be wieldable in the shape of a weapon. My efforts are finally bearing fruit, and [weapon_forger.GetTitledFirstName] requests an answer on what kind of weapon I want forged.
An axe is the most appropriate way to honor [dead_warrior.GetFirstName].
[dead_warrior.GetFirstName] would have wanted a sword in [dead_warrior.GetHerHis] name.
A mace to crush both my and the old enemies of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName].

The day has finally come, the [GetDecidedWeapon] infused with the strength of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] is now complete. [weapon_forger.GetTitledFirstName] suggests you test the weapon, but just a few swings in the air was all it took for the [GetDecidedWeapon] to shatter! [weapon_forger.GetFirstName] struggles for words and then mutters that it is a bad omen.
...It was simply bad luck, nothing else.
This is clearly your fault! Fix it!
I will sacrifice your life to appease the gods.

The day has finally come, the [GetDecidedWeapon] infused with the strength of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] is now complete. [weapon_forger.GetTitledFirstName] said [weapon_forger.GetSheHe] would bring the weapon to me first thing in the morning, but never showed. The intrusive thought of [weapon_forger.GetHerHim] stealing my [GetDecidedWeapon] enters my mind.
[weapon_forger.GetSheHeCap] is simply running late, that is all.

The day has finally come, the [GetDecidedWeapon] infused with the strength of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] is now complete. As I arrive at the decided location of meeting with [weapon_forger.GetTitledFirstName], I hear [weapon_forger.GetHerHim] screaming bloody murder. [unfortunate_child.GetTitledFirstName] had somehow gotten a hold of the weapon and injured [unfortunate_child.GetHerselfHimself]!
This is a cursed weapon that thirsts for blood! Get rid of it!
The weapon is not what injured the child. The blame is on [unfortunate_child.GetFirstName].

Many good omens have shown the last couple of days, and the completed [GetDecidedWeapon] infused with the strength of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] is now in my hands. Though the weapon seems ordinary to me, [weapon_forger.GetTitledFirstName] adamantly says that the ritual was a success.
I hope [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] is witnessing this from the afterlife.
I do not appreciate you lying to me, [weapon_forger.GetFirstName].

Many good omens have shown the last couple of days, and the completed [GetDecidedWeapon] infused with the strength of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] is now in my hands. A sudden gust of wind passes by as I touch the weapon and the voice of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] starts ringing in my ear. Though brief, it was as if [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] was standing next to me.
A part of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] truly is in this weapon.
No! This is a cursed weapon that thirsts for blood! Get rid of it!

Many good omens have shown the last couple of days, and the completed [GetDecidedWeapon] infused with the strength of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] is now in my hands. A surge of energy fills me as I touch the weapon. I hear the laughter of [dead_warrior.GetFirstName] in my mind as vividly as if [dead_warrior.GetSheHe] were standing in front of me. As [dead_warrior.GetHerHis] laughter dies, I feel stronger than ever!
A mysterious mace made of metal tougher than most. Those who wield it say that a voice of a warrior speaks to them.
A mysterious sword made of metal tougher than most. Those who wield it say that a voice of a warrior speaks to them.

After gathering the lands of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] under [From.GetHerHis] rule, [From.GetDynName] has declared [From.GetHerselfHimself] the Grand [From.GetDukeDuchessCap] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in a grand ceremony that is sure to be remembered for many years to come.\n\nThe rest of the Princes of the Empire look to [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] with jealousy, as [From.GetTitledFirstName] will surely play an important role in the Empire with [From.GetHerHis] newfound rank.

Was not crowned after §Y30§! years of rule.
The current ruler will vote as [Root.GetSheHe] pleases.

Now that I have found a distinguished member of the Catholic clergy to officiate the rites, it is time to organize the ceremony itself. Unfortunately, the necessities imposed by the war I am waging will force me to have only a small gathering of my closest allies to witness this momentous occasion.

The time of my coronation draws near: only a few more days before I am crowned [Root.GetTitle] before God and all my subjects. It will be a long wait and I can only hope that the day will not fall in the middle of a major battle...

What sort of [Root.GetTitle] am I to become? I could not even manage to organize a proper coronation ceremony, during a time of peace. Here I am, wading through the mud of a military encampment, preparing to receive my crown in the most undignified of settings...

However justified my reasons were to organize a secluded ceremony during a war, my vassals are far from pleased. Not only do they perceive it as a sign of weakness, but they all seem to have taken their lack of invitation as a personal slight against them!

I have only heard of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s pending coronation after the news spread across the realm. It seems that the [From.GetTitle] has organized a very secluded ceremony for [From.GetHerHis] coronation, to be held in [From.GetHerHis] own military tent. Invitation was granted only to [From.GetHerHis] most trusted councilors.

As if sending a Cardinal in [coronation_priest.GetHerHis] place was not enough of a slight from the Holy Father, the Papal envoy himself has proven to be a most insufferable man, constantly complaining about the lack of care he is receiving and recanting all the many dangers I am exposing him to by having this coronation held in the middle of a war.

It came to me as no surprise that [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] was disappointed with the secluded ceremony my liege organized for [From.GetHerHis] coronation. The [coronation_priest.GetTitle] even refused to visit my ruler in person, claiming that it would have been too dangerous a travel for [coronation_priest.GetHerHim] to partake.

As the yells of the commanders drilling troops echo in the tent, [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] gives me a quick blessing and summarily places the crown upon my head, proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of God.

As the yells of the commanders drilling troops echo in the tent, [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName]'s envoy gives me a quick blessing and summarily places the crown upon my head, proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of God.

As the yells of the commanders drilling troops echo in the tent, [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] gives [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName] a quick blessing and summarily places the crown upon [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] head, proclaiming [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of God.

As the yells of the commanders drilling troops echo in the tent, [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName]'s envoy gives [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName] a quick blessing and summarily places the crown upon [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] head, proclaiming [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of God.
With the ceremony finally concluded, [From.GetTitledFirstName] bid me farewell and dismissed me from [From.GetHerHis] private tent, alongside all [From.GetHerHis] other guests.
After endless procrastination, this ruler was eventually forced to be crowned in a hurry at the worst of times, in the middle of a war.
I was given a good position in the §YCouncil§!
I have a really high §YOpinion§! of this ruler
I have a decent of §YOpinion§! of this ruler
I have a low §YOpinion§! of the scoundrel on the throne
After [From.GetHerHis] labor, I think [From.GetSheHe] deserves a treat.
Allow your [GetFromRelation] to recover [From.GetHerHis] own way.
Solace in solitude is what [From.GetSheHe] requires.
Allow your [GetFromRelation] to mourn in peace.
My [GetFromRelation] has been surprisingly understanding of my new habits. Knowing that I have [From.GetHerHis] unconditioned approval has put me much more at ease with my recent change in lifestyle.
If only my throne was as supportive...

I was surprised to see how tactful my [GetFromRelation] has been ever since my last pregnancy. [From.GetSheHeCap] has allowed me to mourn in peace, without complaining about my isolation or attempting to drag me back into society.
I only wish I could find the strength to thank [From.GetHerHim]...

[From.GetTitledName] has accused me of cowardice and incompetence! [From.GetSheHeCap] claims I am not fit to serve as the regent of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName], and has challenged me to single combat for the title.

With [From.GetFirstName] defeated, nobody is left to contest my claim to the regency [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. It is blatant to everybody at court that only my lead can ensure the prosperity and stability of the realm during these dangerous times.

This character is porphyrogennetos - literally "born in the purple." It is an honor bestowed only to children born of a ruling Basileus or Basilissa in the Purple Chamber of the Imperial Palace. Their succession claim is stronger than that of older siblings born before their parents ascended the throne.

This character had the honor of being born in the Purple Chamber of the Imperial Palace. As such, [Root.GetHerHis] succession claim is stronger than that of older siblings born before their parents ascended the throne.
If Rome and other key territories of the old empire could be reclaimed, the Byzantine Empire would win recognition in the eyes of the West as the true and rightful continuation of the Roman State.
If we retake control over enough former provinces of the old empire, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] would be reborn once again as [e_roman_empire.GetName].
[From.GetSheHeCap] just needs a good beating, that is all!
Compliment §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! for [From.GetHerHis] vocabulary, preventing [From.GetHerHim] from §YAntagonizing§! you for some time.
For your admirable honesty, I dub thee Sir [From.GetFirstName] of the Turnip!
Grant §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! a knighthood for [From.GetHerHis] honesty, preventing [From.GetHerHim] from §YAntagonizing§! you for some time.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has entirely misunderstood my intent! Rather than being upset by my slanderous allegations, [From.GetSheHe] praised me for my refined vocabulary.
Do not worry, [From.GetFirstName], I have much more to say!
I will just have to try harder!
Perhaps I should rethink my strategy...
[From.GetFirstName] was ecstatic hearing my praise and assured me that [From.GetSheHe] has a lot more interesting names to call me.
Hopefully they will all be as endearing!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has entirely misunderstood my intent! Rather than being upset by my slanderous allegations, [From.GetSheHe] praised me for my honesty, and even decided to knight me!
You can always count on me to tell the truth, my [From.GetTitle]!

People of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], lend me your ears! After the miraculous recovery of territory lost centuries ago, our mighty nation has been reborn! Our land has endured dark times since the imperial frontiers were stormed by barbarians and province after province burned at their touch, but now a bright new age has dawned for all of civilization.\n\nOur great Nation will no longer be referred to as [e_byzantium.GetName] by jealous pretenders, but recognized as the true heir to the legacy of its illustrious ancestors. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] rules a restored Imperium, but much work remains to be done. There is still territory to recover and ancient borders to reclaim. For the Senate and People of [Root.Capital.GetName]!

The [From.Culture.GetName] [From.GetTitle], has somehow managed to reclaim enough lost territory to declare [e_roman_empire.GetName] restored! It can no longer be denied that they are the true successors of the Empire of old and its glorious legacy. They claim a new era is upon us.

Soul Eaters are said to be damned people cursed by witches to forever roam the desert, sustaining themselves upon the souls of unwary travelers. Holding powers beyond the comprehension of ordinary men, these creatures can occasionally find their way into the dark corners of civilized societies, appearing in semblance of mortals to deceive their victims.
Has not been approached by the Soul Eaters before.
Attempt to find out whether §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is open to the power of the occult. If so, you turn [Root.GetHerHim] into a Soul Eater.

During [Root.GetHerHis] rite of adulthood, this character tried to curry the favor of benevolent spirits, painting [Root.GetHerHis] face in vibrant colors, hoping to attract prosperity and peace for [Root.GetHerselfHimself] and [Root.GetHerHis] family.

During [Root.GetHerHis] rite of adulthood, this character tried to curry the favor of warmongering spirits, painting [Root.GetHerHis] face in strident colors, hoping to be blessed with power beyond [Root.GetHerHis] reach and instill fear in [Root.GetHerHis] enemies.

During [Root.GetHerHis] rite of adulthood, this character tried to curry the favor of trickster spirits, painting [Root.GetHerHis] face in dark colors, hoping they will help [Root.GetHerHim] conceal [Root.GetHerHis] intentions and strike [Root.GetHerHis] enemies.

During [Root.GetHerHis] rite of adulthood, this character tried to curry the favor of the guardian spirits of the Underworld, painting [Root.GetHerHis] face in pale colors, hoping to be spared from an untimely death.

I will soon no longer be a [Root.GetBoyGirl]. The time has come for me to perform the rite of passage that will mark the beginning of my adulthood. The shamans assure me that the larger and louder the ceremony is, the more likely the spirits will be to bless me.
All the people of [Root.Capital.GetName] will be invited!
By issuing a large celebration, the effects of your rite of passing will last for the next §Y20§! years.
I will invite everyone I know!
By issuing an average celebration, the effects of your rite of passing will last for the next §Y10§! years.
By issuing a small celebration, the effects of your rite of passing will last for the next §Y5§! years.
I do not believe in these silly superstitions!
Refuse to perform the rite of passage.

A large crowd has reunited around my palace, waiting for me to emerge as a grown [Root.GetManWoman]. The sound of chanting, cymbals and drums echoes all the way to my chambers while I prepare myself. The shamans warned me that this is a delicate and dangerous transition when the spirits roam closer to the world of the living, and that I should be careful not to anger the wrong ones.

A small crowd has reunited around my palace, waiting for me to emerge as a grown [Root.GetManWoman]. The sound of chanting, cymbals and drums echoes all the way to my chambers while I prepare myself. The shamans warned me that this is a delicate and dangerous transition when the spirits roam closer to the world of the living, and that I should be careful not to anger the wrong ones.

The little group of relatives and acquaintances awaits in the great hall, chanting and waiting for me to emerge as a grown [Root.GetManWoman]. The shamans warned me that this is a delicate and dangerous transition when the spirits roam closer to the world of the living, and that I should be careful not to anger the wrong ones.
Spirits of Life, watch over me!
I hope a powerful entity will lend me its strength.
May the Tricksters grant me their wits!
Will they spare me from death and sickness, I wonder?
Spirits and magic are all around us, hiding inside every tree, under every river, flying above our heads and beneath the very earth we walk on.

§GCharacters perform a rite of passage upon reaching adulthood§!
The Byzantine Imperial insignia, a crown only fit for the true heirs of Rome.
Take some time to rest and relax.

In order to ensure the divine purity of their bloodline, [From.GetTitledFirstName] and [From.GetPossPronoun] [GetFromVsNewRelation] [New.GetTitledFirstName] have gotten married under the blessed auspices of [From.Religion.GetHighGodName], ensuring fullness and Order. We can collect a Royal Aid Duty to pay for the ceremonies.

Thanks to the tireless efforts of the glorious [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the lands of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have been wrestled from the barbarity and the misery of its dark past, and have been dragged into a new era of clarity and order. 
A new urbanized bureaucratic caste has taken hold of the provinces once held by quarreling warlords, reinvigorating the Imperial Throne with legitimacy and power beyond all expectations.

Ten thousand years of peace and prosperity upon the great [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty and its magnificent reformer!
Let darkness and violence be forever banned from our heavenly realm.
The European incursions in the Levant have brought a multitude of strident cultures together. From their clashes, a new Outremer identity is emerging.
All §Y[latin.GetGroupName]§! Provinces in your demesne become §YOutremer§!

Against all odds, the children of Christ have succeeded in their misbegotten quest to reconquer Jerusalem! \nHosts of archangels with shining armor and flaming swords have been reported to have descended upon the walls of the holy city during the final battle, smiting the infidels, turning the defenders' weapons into rust and melting their eyes out.\nA child now rules over the Kingdom of Heaven, and few doubt that it was through divine intervention that [From.GetSheHe] was put there.

Against all odds, the children of Christ have succeeded in their unlikely quest to reconquer Jerusalem! \nHosts of archangels with shining armor and flaming swords have been reported to have descended upon the walls of the holy city during the final battle, smiting the infidels, turning the defenders' weapons into rust and melting their eyes out.\n[From.GetFirstName] now rules over the Kingdom of Heaven, and few doubt that it was through divine intervention that [From.GetSheHe] was put there.

Rather than wasting lives and wealth after dreams of new conquest, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has dedicated [Root.GetHerHis] life to the improvement of [Root.GetHerHis] own realm, founding several new cities during the course of [Root.GetHerHis] reign, strengthening the infrastructure of [Root.GetHerHis] roads and holdings, and improving the living conditions of [Root.GetHerHis] subjects beyond measure.\nThanks to [Root.GetHerHis] efforts, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has grown to be a much more prosperous and populous realm than it would have otherwise been.\nThousands of new settlers will forever remember [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s vital contribution to the creation of their new homes.

While avoiding being forgotten entirely is my primary concern, it is also equally important for me to think about how I actually do wish posterity to think of me. How can I make sure that when I die, future generations will speak in awe and wonder about my accomplishments as [Root.GetTitle], and feel inspired to emulate me?
In order to immortalize my name I must leave an indelible mark on [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], improving my realm beyond what even my predecessors dared to accomplish...

A beacon of virtue and wisdom, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has acquired immortal fame by dedicating years of [Root.GetHerHis] rule to reach a deeper understanding of the word of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and of the truths hidden within our holy texts.\nRiding through an initial tide of controversy, the [Root.GetTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] was able to establish a court of scholars and theologian, filled with endless disquisitions over the highest matters which will surely prove instrumental to lead us to gain a better understanding of this world and the ones beyond.

The Crusaders are leaving the [From.Religion.GetName] realm, their eyes towards Constantinople and [e_byzantium.GetName]. At the same time, the Pope has made an enraged speech about the vices of men and how the good faithful have been led astray. [ThePope.GetSheHeCap] threatens every single Crusader with excommunication from the church, but the Crusaders continues onwards towards the ancient capital at the Bosporus.\n\nWhat was once the bastion of the [From.Religion.GetGroupName] faith is now desperately protecting itself, and [e_byzantium.Holder.GetTitledName] is looking for any help [e_byzantium.Holder.GetSheHe] can get.

Constantinople falls to great cheers from the [From.Religion.GetName] Crusaders. The rest of the world weeps as the last lingering memories of the Roman Empire shatter. The former Emperor [FromFrom.GetDynName] has run off to [FromFrom.Capital.GetName] to try and restore what remains of the Empire.

[Root.GetByzantineRefugeeText]Now [e_latin_empire.Holder.GetTitledFirstName] sits on the throne in Constantinople. [e_latin_empire.Holder.GetSheHeCap] has declared [e_latin_empire.Holder.GetHerselfHimself] the new ruler of the Greek Empire, and will rule with both Greek and Latin traditions in mind.

Only time will tell, if the [From.Religion.GetName]s will be remembered as the ones who broke the [From.Religion.GetGroupName] Bulwark, or the ones who restored Constantinople to greatness.
In the middle of the fighting, [byzantine_refugee.GetDynName], the [From.Religion.GetName]-sponsored pretender to the Byzantine throne, died.

Cart after cart is brought before me. I try to keep track of how many there are but quickly loses count. They are numerous, and every single one is filled with nothing but gold. To see such wealth is extraordinary and to know that all of it belong to me...

Just as I am about to retire for the day a messenger comes running up to me, quite out of breath. He bows quickly before speaking, "Forgive me, my [Root.GetLordLady], for disturbing but... Our gold mine has collapsed! There is simply no more gold to be found in [depleted_gold_mine_target.GetName]"
I just received word that the gold mine in [depleted_gold_mine_target.GetName] is fully operational once more! The workers found another vein a few days ago and have already begun mining it.

It would seem that a recent influx of gold in [gold_inflation_province.GetName] has caused local prices to increase. Not only does it make things more expensive, but it also leaves the peasants with less money with which to pay me taxes!
Such is the price of gold...
Clever investments should keep the inflation in check.
Have soldiers take back the gold by force!
A smaller trade post at which travelling merchants can buy and sell various trade goods.
A trade post that has grown into a large market, attracting a wider range of merchants and trade goods.
This is a significant trading hub on the Trans-Saharan trade route. It attracts merchants from all over Africa, trading wares and services that cannot be found anywhere else.
A small field for finding and extracting gold. This gleaming metal is highly valued and is often used as a currency.
A well established mine capable of producing larger quantities of gold.
The production of this larger mining complex is unrivaled. It produces an immense amount of gold.
A place where cloth of high quality is produced and sold.
A mine for extracting vast quantities of salt. A highly valued trade good said to be worth its weight in gold.
The gold mine has been depleted and will not provide any gold until another vein is found.
A large influx of gold has caused prices to be severly increased.
An influx of gold has caused prices to increase.
Local peasant are rioting after having had their possessions confiscated.
Sacrificing a lot of people as
Ruling with an iron fist as

The word around the court is that a remarkable [GetWeaponArmorSmith] is residing in [neighbor_province.GetName]. Perhaps I should invite the [smith.GetManWoman] to my court to see [smith.GetHerHis] work for myself. If [smith.GetSheHe] manages to impress me, I could order my own custom made item.
What a fine idea, how clever I am!
As long as [physician.GetSheHe] keeps me healthy I shan't complain.

Once the [GetWeaponArmorSmith]'s craftsmanship had been checked by my most knowledgeable attendants to ensure the quality was sufficient, I received [From.GetHerHim] in the throne room. [From.GetSheHeCap] introduced [From.GetHerselfHimself] as '[From.GetMasterMistressCap] [From.GetFirstName]' and gestured towards [From.GetHerHis] numerous assistants, who all carried examples of [From.GetHerHis] work. 'Does my [Root.GetTitle] have anything special in mind?'

I find myself lying in bed all day, the act of getting up almost as difficult as that of ruling. Food tastes bland, and my time spent with friends doesn't bring the joy it once did. I don't really understand why, but I hate my life.
The smith will never reach their destination and your treasures will be recovered.
The castle blacksmith, more used to horseshoes and helmets than work fit for royalty, presented you with a dirty old box. "Ta da" he says, nervously, "It was a sword you wanted right?" he adds.
The blacksmith who made this sword was probably drunk when they did so.

I am slashing my way through the enemies at the river bank, my blade covered in gore. The few enemies left are starting to back away from me, obviously terrified. Suddenly I am pulled off my feet as a sharp pain engulfs my leg. I turn to look into two large black eyes before I am pulled into the water.
was fed to a crocodile by $KILLER$
$NAME$ will become the new chief diety
$NAME$ will become a new evil diety
A Guardian of Kailash is steadfast in their defense of the holy mountain of Kailash They fight for the Bön faith.
[This.Founder.GetTitledFirstName] managed to unite the formerly disparate East and West Slavic people under [This.Founder.GetHerHis] rule.
[This.Founder.GetTitledFirstName] managed to unite the formerly disparate East and West Slavic people under [This.Founder.GetHerHis] rule.
Only characters within the Eastern Steppes, India or Tibet can use Grace Actions. Tributaries cannot extend China's diplomatic range.

The use of dark magic has corrupted me! The dark tendrils of [Root.GetDWDevil]'s magic has invaded my body, eroding mind and muscle alike. It is obvious that [Root.GetDWDevil] is keeping me alive, but at what cost?

All power comes at a price. The use of dark magic has corrupted this character's body and mind, making them frail and demented. Despite their apparent weakness, a dark force is keeping them alive for nefarious reasons...
Fighting in a Warrior Lodge as
Restoring the Glory of Rome as
The Daura claim descent from Bayajidda and Magajiva – the first of whom slew a great serpent, and the second of whom instituted the matriarchal system of the Hausa people.
When the time comes, I will join in [Root.GetFirstNameWithNick]'s reconquest war!
Vanquisher of both Moors and Leonese in his campaigns for Portuguese independence, Alfonso cunningly battled many enemies to establish the roots of his own realm.
Lord over half of Iberia, Alfonso claimed the title “Emperor of all Spain” and sought to unify the peninsula under his rule. He was also known as a patron of arts.
Known as James the Conqueror, he established dominance over the Mediterranean Sea. He is also remembered as a sponsor of artists and a notorious lawmaker.
Warrior-king of the Basques and a major sponsor of the Reconquista, Garcia restored Basque control over Navarra after a long period of Aragonese domination.
Known as a champion of the faithful, diplomat and friend to Christians, Muhammad managed to keep alive the light of Al-Andalus despite the Castillian invasion.
A scholar and conqueror, Musa became a legend in the Islamic world for the vast wealth and majesty of his African kingdom. He also sponsored many construction projects.
A major leader of the First Crusade, Bohemond used his legendary martial skill and political cunning to capture Antioch and establish a kingdom for himself in the Levant.
Last of the great Norman conquerors, Roger unified Sicily under his rule, transforming it into a local power responsible for raids across the Muslim lands.
A leader of the Fourth Crusade, Baldouin fought alongside the Venetians to topple the last remnant of the Roman Empire, becoming the first Latin Emperor of Constantinople.
Founder of the Tughluq dynasty, he expanded Muslim reach across the Indian subcontinent and successfully repealed the Mongol menace.
Founder of the Ottoman dynasty, Osman rose to prominence as a daring commander, achieving victories against both Greeks and fellow Turks in his campaigns.
The mastermind behind the Fourth Crusade and the sack of Constantinople, Enrico is remembered as one of the most successful and prosperous doges Venice ever had.
Yusuf was invited by the emirs of Andalusia to come to Iberia and stop the Christian onslaught. He won, and established a vast realm extending from Ghana to Toledo.
Leader of the Almohad dynasty, the reign of Abu made both trade and science prosper, with his administrative and military skills being successful in halting the Reconquista.
Once sold in a slave market, Baibars would eventually become the man responsible for both defeating the Mongol advance and removing the Crusader States from the Levant.
A powerful woman, Arwa was known for her intelligence and knowledge of both heavenly and earthly affairs. She also engaged in several building projects across Yemen.
A pious and respected leader of the Third Crusade, Philippe fought against both heretics and infidels with great success.
An able ruler, Frederick 'Barbarossa' was known both as a warrior who sought to control the rebel Italian princes and as a skilled lawmaker.
Despite his involvement in the murder of his elder brother, Boleslav was a tenacious leader who significantly strengthened the Bohemian realm.

They say you are famous for your [Root.GetMilitarySquadPride], my [other_combatant.GetRootRelation] mocks me. "Not saving you this time, is it?!" [other_combatant.GetSheHe] bellows, swinging [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetDuelWeapon] furiously. My heart pounding, I suddenly find myself covered in something wet and sticky. My entrails are spilling out through a gash in my stomach...

Occasionally spotted leaving offerings in the rain, the Children of the Storm fight and train in the name of Dongo, the father of storms and god of thunder. When charging into battle, they wear blue and are known to carry small fetish symbols close to their heart.
Gather your people around the fire, and carry on the tradition of storytelling.
Has NOT recently told a story

A [Root.Capital.GetLocalTemperature] wind sweeps through the village. As the fire flares up, it lights up the crowd gathered around for the evening. I pass my drink to a servant and call for silence. "Friends! I am glad you have joined me tonight, for I shall tell you a story about...-"
... How I once beat up a crocodile with my bare hands!
... A brave warrior, who wandered the desert, in search of his true love.
... Mankind, and how we came to be.
... A benevolent spirit, who dwells in [Root.Capital.GetName].
This character is known to tell a tall tale every now and then...
You don't understand, the dog was *huge*!
This character carries wondrous stories of [Root.GetHerHis] ancestors.
This character inspires many emotions, through clever storytelling.
This character is great at recounting tales from [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName].
This character can captivate an audience with tales of old.
Duelers are NOT involved in a war
Unusually heavy rainfalls are sweeping through the area, causing harvests to over-perform, while riverbeds run the risk of flooding.
A moderate amount of rainfall is currently having a positive effect on harvests in this area.
This area is currently suffering from a lack of rain.
This area is suffering a severe drought, its people starving and fighting over resources.
The inhabitants in this area are praying for rain.
A local cult is devoted to the gods of harvest.
This area has been blessed with good weather – as long as it remains, the inhabitants will believe that it is thanks to their acts of devoutness.

The light rains over [rain_dance_province.GetName] are having positive effects on the lives of the inhabitants. Harvests are plentiful, spirits are up, and it is said that people are flocking to join our troops. Everyone who has been praying for rain has had their faith affirmed.

The local cult devoted to the gods of harvests are reveling in the continuous light rains over [rain_dance_province.GetName]. The good spirits can be noticed on everyone, from contented farmers and workers, to smug merchants and eager soldiers in the area.

The area surrounding [rain_dance_province.GetName] are experiencing booming harvests after a continuous increase in downpour. "It is proof! Our prayers to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] have been answered!", a courier says, gesturing towards the sky.

Heavy rains continue to pour down over the area surrounding [rain_dance_province.GetName]. Harvests are over-performing, morale is high, and some people are jubilant, convinced that their own acts of devotion played a significant role in bringing this weather about. "Praise [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]", a servant mumbles.
Our rituals must have had an effect!
Clearly the locals followed my instructions for rationing.
Rains have been plentiful and great for harvests in the area surrounding [rainy_province.GetName]. Some of the locals cannot even remember a time when the weather was causing them trouble.
Let them hold a festival to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], to ensure these good times keep coming!

[drought_province.GetName] have gone weeks without rain. Watering holes for grazing animals are shrinking, and as inhabitants become more reliant on outside trade, traders charge more for resources. People are beginning to lose faith, even in [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

The dry season in [drought_province.GetName] is becoming dangerous. While the land suffers, ravaged by bush fires and disappearing watering holes, so does our people, growing desperate for water and food, as trade continues to dwindle in the area. Some are asking if there is even a point in turning to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
I'm sure the weather will change in time.
Make sure our traders are well-stocked.
Have people keep an eye on our rivers and lakes.
Send men to inspect our roads for erosion by the water.
We should put away surplus grain for the future.
Let's invest in refining the irrigation of our crops.
We must get food out to the people outside our [Root.GetCapitalHolding].
Let's share the wealth from our capital with [province_to_save.GetName]!
We must put our faith in [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
Winds from the south are bringing unusually heavy rains over most of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
The seasons have lately brought regular light rainfall over large parts of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
Unrest is growing as large areas of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] grow drier each season.
The situation in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is dire, as the drought brings people to the brink of starvation.
Reports vary from region to region: [GetWeatherSplit]
some of our provinces are blessed with [GetHeavyLightRain] rains, while others suffer drought.
some areas run a risk of flooding, while others are enjoying lighter rain.
while the winds could still change, there are provinces where the drought has gone on too long.
We should probably keep an eye on the water levels in the region, one councilor suggests. "There are many ways to tackle this, my [Root.GetLordLady]", another interjects.
We should spend this time stockpiling for future!
If it continues this way, no one in the realm will be safe from the harsh times ahead.
Some are saying I am to blame, that it is my administration and governing of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] that has failed.
\n"My [Root.GetLordLady]?", my [Root.GetMyTreasurerName] [my_steward.GetTitledFirstName] interrupts my thoughts, clearly expecting me to react to the weather report.

I am told that the country is becoming a harsh environment for civilized people, and that people are fighting over every single drop of water. "We have some private stores in the [Root.GetCapitalHolding], of course", my council reminds me.
You will make sure §Y[This.GetName]§! is better prepared to handle the situation.
This area receives regular shipments of food from the capital.
This ruler is turning to religion, praying to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] to end the drought slowly taking its toll on [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
The traders in this area are encouraged to bring in far away goods, maintaining a steady flow of vital resources throughout the realm.
Efforts have been put into improving irrigation in this area.
A message system has been put into place to warn for flooding in this area. An effort has also been put into shoring up riverbanks.
Guards patrol this area, making sure that travelers are not caught in landslides caused by the heavy rain.

All of your direct demesne provinces with §Y'Heavy Rain'§! get '§YRiver Patrols§!' for five years, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §G-1.0%§!
Morale of Armies: §G+5.0%§!
Culture Technology Points: §G+0.05%§!

All of your direct demesne provinces with §Y'Heavy Rain'§! get '§YRoad Patrols§!' for five years, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §G-1.0%§!
Morale of Armies: §G+5.0%§!
Culture Technology Points: §G+0.05%§!
All of your direct demesne provinces with §Y'Light Rain'§! or §Y'Heavy Rain'§! will be more likely to withstand drought related hardships in the future.

[flooded_province.GetName] is suffering terribly from the heavy downpour. Now a heavy landslide has swept through the heart of the province, taking people and even buildings with it. The atmosphere is somber when my council presents me with our options.
We must try to save the people.
Can we save... Some of the people?
Your agents will make sure that your rival is caught in the landslide...
This option is available because your rival is at risk.
We cannot afford to lose the buildings.

The toll that the drought is taking on [starved_province.GetName] is proving lethal. The lack of water is causing people to fight over resources and unsanitary living conditions are reaching even the highest echelons of society. My council tells me that an outbreak of disease is imminent.
Surely, we could simply... Get rid of the sick?
Let's have all able-bodied men prepare shelters for the sick.
An outbreak of disease? This is awful!
Your agents will arrange a series of "accidents".
This character has sent word through [Root.GetHerHis] realm that builders will receive extra gratitude during these hard times.

It started out as a strange smell, and could have gone unnoticed for weeks, had I not been down there recently, my [Root.GetMyLordSpiritualName] [my_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] explains, a hint of pride in [my_spiritual.GetHerHis] voice.\n"This way, my [Root.GetLordLady]", [my_spiritual.GetSheHe] says, leading me into the flooded room. The smell makes my nose itch.
These items are *priceless*! We have to save them!
Moldy old books? Get rid of them.

The quartermaster noticed it first, [my_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] says, clearly disgruntled by the ordeal. "We have cleaned out what we could, but I am afraid there are still some items unaccounted for, [Root.GetMasterMistress]", my [Root.GetMyMarshalName] says, avoiding my eyes.
You're an expert! Find the items, and make them *shine*.
Surely, you do not mean *my* things? Noooo, my [target_artifact.GetName]!
Our people in [starving_province.GetName] are starving. The lack of food is bound to affect the health of the residents at court there.
In spite of relief efforts, some people in [starving_province.GetName] are starving. The lack of food is bound to affect the health of the residents at court there.
In spite of the extra storages of food, people are starving in [starving_province.GetName]. The lack of food is bound to affect the health of the residents at court there.

I have been following a rumor, trying to track down what is supposed to be the most feared fighter in [target_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. A deadly fencer, I'm told. "You go to your death!" an innkeeper warns. Yet, when [combatant_2.GetSheHe]'s pointed out to me, I find myself face to face with a hunched elderly [combatant_2.GetManWoman], eyeing me suspiciously.
I will not go easy on you, just because you're old!
The [combatant_2.GetManWoman] throws off [combatant_2.GetHerHis] cowl, accepting your challenge.

I've partaken in a local tournament, and I have been knocking out [target_ruler.Culture.GetName] fighters with ease. Grinning, I search the crowd for the face of [fellow_member.GetFirstName], who has been cheering me on. I find [fellow_member.GetHerHim] looking a bit pale. Turning to face my final foe I hear someone shouting an introduction: "[combatant_2.GetBestName]!"
You will duel the tallest [combatant_2.GetManWoman] you have ever seen.

Rumors of my adventures have been spreading here in [target_title.GetName] and I have received a personal invite from [target_ruler.GetTitledFirstName], to appear at [target_ruler.GetHerHis] court. "To the brute [Root.GetFirstName]. If you insist on causing trouble like this, you will fight someone I choose", the pompous messenger reads.
I am not afraid. I will duel any of [target_ruler.GetHerHis] champions!
As you accept, the messenger snickers.
The legendary journey is over for you, and you return home in shame.

As the [combatant_2.GetManWoman] unclasps [combatant_2.GetHerHis] cloak, I gasp. Beneath the disguise of a poor and withered elder, is an athletic and statuesque person, donned in fanciful armor. [combatant_2.GetSheHeCap] lashes out at me with a silvery sword, and I almost scream in surprise. When it is over, I am bloody and out of breath.

The crowd is cheering loudly as the giant looms over me. All the men I have fought so far pale in comparison. "YOU DIE NOW!" the beast of a [combatant_2.GetManWoman] roars, swinging a massive club. When it fails to hit me and bites the ground, the earth shakes. As [combatant_2.GetSheHe] moves to lift it again, I strike! The crowd falls silent.

A brute gets to fight a brute!, [target_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] proclaims, gesturing to the stage, where a... "That's a bear", I say, clearly less alarmed than expected. "I have fought bears before", I continue, picking up my [Root.GetDuelWeapon]. The creature roars. While the ensuing fight takes time, the monster soon lies at my feet.

I keep telling you plucky fools: I am retired, the [combatant_2.GetManWoman] hisses, unsheathing a silvery sword and straightening [combatant_2.GetHerHis] back. It dawns on me that my original assessment was wrong. "You're... Some kind of dueli-", I try, but I do not have time to finish my words. I am spluttering blood, staring in disbelief as my killer walks away.

The giant only grunts in response to my taunts, sluggishly swinging [combatant_2.GetHerHis] massive club. I slash at [combatant_2.GetHerHis] legs and unprotected arms, and the crowd roars with excitement. Suddenly, my opponent discards [combatant_2.GetHerHis] weapon, declaring: "I'll stop toying with you now, barbarian". [combatant_2.GetHerHisCap] swings pick up speed. I have nowhere to run.

A BEAR? I protest. "Aye, my [Root.GetLordLady]", the spindly man nods, gesturing onto the stage. "Fight!", [target_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] proclaims, and I do. The bear is brutally strong, and a wild beast at that. My sword does little when it grazes [combatant_2.GetHerHis] fur, and I am being tossed around like a toy. I... Ouch! Arrgh...

[This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to have a child and see them reach adulthood.

If [This.GetFirstName]'s Inheritance Law is §YAgnatic§!, only a male child will fulfill this ambition. Similarly, if [This.GetFirstName]'s Inheritance Law is §YEnatic§!, only a female child will do.

While active §YFertility§! is increased by §G20%§!, and once your child reaches §Y12§! years, you may choose to §Gright-click§! their portrait and choose to §YIntroduce Heir to Realm§!.
Is Male, while the Inheritance Law is §YAgnatic§!
Is Female, while the Inheritance Law is §YEnatic§!
The Inheritance Law is neither §YAgnatic§! or §YEnatic§!
I am surely with child... I wonder what my late husband would think of this.
This character is left-handed. While seen with suspicion by the clergy, left-handed people tend to have a considerable advantage in combat.

Depending on your circumstances, you might want to '§YCreate New Vassal§!' in the Holding menu, or give the title away.

Hail, [Root.GetSocietyRank]!

It has come to our attention that your [recruit_to_be.GetSonDaughter] [recruit_to_be.GetFirstName] remains outside of our fold. May we humbly urge you to talk to [recruit_to_be.GetHerHim] about becoming a member of [Root.Society.GetName], like [recruit_to_be.GetHerHis] [Root.GetFatherMother]?

Signed, [From.GetTitledFirstName]
It could be that our descendants follow in our footsteps, but to make certain that the legacy of our Warrior Lodge continues, encouraging our young is key.

To complete this mission you need to §Gright-click§! on the portrait of your target and choose to §YRecruit§! them. If the initiation is successful, you will receive §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!. However, if your child fails the initiation duel, the mission fails.
The premature death of my [From.GetRootRelation] §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! means that I fail my mission to recruit [From.GetHerHim]. [Root.Society.GetName] will find something else for me to do.
We're recommending this expansion as you've selected an §YEast African§! character.
In addition to warrior lodges and crusade enhancements, §YHoly Fury§! adds more content to players in certain regions of Africa.
We're recommending this expansion as you've selected a character in Sub-Saharan §YAfrica§!.
As §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! is a [This.GetDuelNormbreakingReason], this challenge is widely frowned upon.
This character has shown a lack of subtlety and great disdain for societal traditions with [Root.GetHerHis] indiscriminate choice of dueling targets.
Almost anyone can be dueled. Penalties in regards to gender or religion are no longer applied.
fire my [Root.GetDuelWeapon] at [This.GetHerHis] [This.GetBodyPartInjured], the sound shocking even myself
fire at my opponent's head, covering [This.GetHerHis] face in blood
rip the ground apart with a shot, startling my opponent into tripping over [This.GetHerselfHimself]
fire [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetDuelWeapon] into the ground, startling me into tripping over myself
pull the trigger, firing my last bullet. It finds [other_combatant.GetHerHis] temple
pulls the trigger, firing what has to be [other_combatant.GetHerHis] last bullet. The noise rings in my ears as I fall to the ground
Under rare circumstances, rulers have a chance to turn Hellenic and restore the old religion.
Events and decision dealing with the restoration of the Hellenic religion are disabled.

With the ceremony finally concluded, [From.GetTitledFirstName] bid me farewell and dismissed me from [From.GetHerHis] encampment, alongside all [From.GetHerHis] other guests. I still cannot believe that the coronation was not abruptly interrupted by an enemy raid... [From.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] must really be protecting [From.GetTitledFirstName].
You are the current ruler of [e_roman_empire.GetName]. May your reign be a prosperous one!
This character is the current ruler of the restored Roman Empire and commands the respect an office of such magnitude is due.
This character is the current ruler of [e_roman_empire.GetName] and commands the respect an office of such magnitude is due.
All Titles will be assigned Primogeniture succession.\n - The oldest child inherits all titles.\n - Your successor will like the law, but other members of your Dynasty will slightly disapprove.

All Titles will be assigned Gavelkind succession.
 - Titles are divided among your children, with the oldest getting the primary title.
 - You get no Prestige penalty for having unlanded sons.
 - You can have a §Y30%§! larger demesne.
 - Destruction of Titles is not allowed.
 - Very popular with everyone except your oldest child.

All Titles will be assigned Elective Gavelkind succession.
 - Titles are divided among your children and the Primary Heir who is elected from among the members of the ruling Dynasty.
 - You get no Prestige penalty for having unlanded sons.
 - You can have a §Y30%§! larger demesne.
 - Destruction of Titles is not allowed.
 - On succession in Kingdoms and Empires, new Kingdoms might be created for younger sons if possible.
 - Junior heirs always get the choice to declare independence without a war.

All Titles will be assigned Elective Monarchy succession.
 - You and each lower rank Vassal (e.g. Dukes if you are a King) can nominate a successor from among themselves and your legitimate children and siblings.
 - Dukes are valid electors in both Kingdoms and Empires.
 - Very popular with your Vassals, but they will not approve if you personally hold too many elector Titles.

All Titles will be assigned Seniority succession.\n - The oldest member of your Dynasty inherits all Titles.\n - Your oldest child will greatly disapprove of this law, but all other members of the Dynasty will approve.
All Titles will be assigned Ultimogeniture succession.\n - The youngest child inherits all Titles.\n - The opposite of the far more common Primogeniture.

All Titles will be assigned Tanistry succession.\n - You and all Vassals at one and two ranks below can nominate an heir - the Tanist - from among the members of your Dynasty.\n - Vassals will tend to favor older members from other branches of the family, especially Claimants.

My history in battle is known to many, but there are still those who could benefit from learning more about my experiences. "Like that time you chopped someone's head off?" [fellow_member.GetTitledFirstName] asks, in response to my idea. "A feast, where you regale your court with the stories!" [fellow_member.GetSheHe] continues. I consider the spirits it could lift, as I soon depart for [target_title.GetName].
